loans.name: Maria Asunta

texts.es:
María Asunta pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

María Asunta, tiene 30 años y tiene dos hijos, ella vive en la comunidad de Inquilpata del distrito de Anta del departamento del Cusco. Su principal actividad económica es la venta de comestibles y su actividad económica complementaria es la venta de queso, leche y venta de ganado, ella vende sus productos en el Campo Ferial de la Comunidad Campesina de Inquilpata-Anta los días viernes. 

María Asunta es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia, ella requiere el crédito para comprar detergente, arroz, azúcar, gaseosas, cerveza  y muchas cosas más. 
 
María Asunta se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
María Asunta, 30, is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA” (Virgin Mary of Inquilpata) communal bank. She lives in Inquilpata, Anta district, Cusco department. Her main commercial activity is Cosmetics sales but she also sells cheese, milk and livestock at Friday’s Inquilpata-Anta Farmers Market. María Asunta is a hard-working, enterprising woman who always seeks ways to get ahead in life and provide the best for her family through her own daily efforts. She needs funds to buy detergent, rice, sugar, soft-drinks, beer and many other things. María Asunta is grateful for the opportunity provided by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy detergent, rice, sugar, soft-drinks, beer and many other items.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina L. is from the village of Basagan, Katipunan Zamboanga del Norte. She is 49 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living Gina makes and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

Gina joined PMPC in 2009 to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP. She is requesting her second loan, for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase materials for house repair. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her family’s general living conditions.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for house repair.

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: S. Aïssatou est née le 19 Novembre 1966 et est mariée à AKONDO Jerry. Le couple a deux enfants, et six enfants à leurs charges. Tous leurs enfants sont scolarisés. Il y a une dizaine d'année que Aïssatou s'est installée avec son mari et ses enfants au quartier Gbégamey à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique. Le couple se partage ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Pour assurer ses différents besoins, Aïssatou mène comme activité la vente d'igname pilé à Allada. C'est dans le Nord du Bénin que Aïssatou s'approvisionne. Aïssatou a dix ans d'expérience dans l'exercice de cette activité et a déjà obtenu trois crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire, Aïssatou sollicite un quatrième prêt, afin de mieux faire face aux exigences de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Aissatou Seibou was born November 19, 1966 and is married to Jerry Akondo. The couple have two children and have six other children in their care. All of their children attend school .For the past 10 years Aissatou has lived with her husband and children in the Gbegarney neighborhood of Allada, in the Atlantic region of Benin. The couple work together to meet the family's needs. To meet their different needs, Aissatou sells ground sweet potato. She buys her supplies in the northern part of Benin. She has 10 years of experience in this business and has already completed three loans with ALIDe, loans that have been successfully repaid. In order to grow her business and increase her income Aissatouo is requested her fourth loan to better meet the needs of her clients.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of sweet potato.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 56 years old. He is married with 4 children ages 17, 20, 27, and 29 years old. Two of the children are currently attending school.

He is a farmer from Nkubu town in Eastern Kenya. He has been farming for 26 years and has, over time, employed people on a temporary basis. His main product is milk, coffee and fish which he sells to the local market. He also sells tree seedlings to the local market and operates a taxi business in the same area.

His biggest challenges in farming are low milk prices, high cost of feed and unpredictable weather conditions.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 47,700 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will help him acquire a dairy cow that will increase his income through the sale of milk and help him educate his children. He hopes to expand his dairy farming in future and start growing beans and maize on his farm in Ruiru-Central Kenya.

He is requesting Juhudi to assist in sourcing a good high-quality dairy cow.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Loy

texts.en:
Loy is married to an accountant and they have six children, all of whom graduated. She takes care of additional family members--two grandchildren.  She owns a kiosk in Ntinda where she sells her pan cakes, chapatti, samosas, and donuts.  She wants to use this loan to buy more cartons of wheat flour and jerrycans of cooking oil. She sells these eatables at the market and door to door. Her customers are market vendors and ordinary people.  

Loy works six days a week.  Her business challenges include the rainy season and transporting cartons of wheat flour and jerrycans of cooking oil from Kampala city to her home.  She aspires to expanding her business to another market. Loy decided to work with MCDT because they were giving out loans to low income people. Loy resides in and owns a four-roomed house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes food and medication.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of wheat flour and jerrycans of cooking oil

loans.name: Rothny's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Rothny S. is 49 years old and is this group's leader, having been selected by its four members, located in Kampong Dar village, Kandal province. The members of this group loan hope to increase their incomes in order to improve their family's standards of living. 

Mrs. Rothny S. and her husband, Mr. Touch Yarn, are farmers who own a plot of land on which to cultivate rice. With their farm, they work very hard to support their five children. In order to increase their income to improve the family's standard of living, Mrs. Rothny S. will use the loan to buy piglets and pig food for pig breeding. This couple has five children; one is a mechanic and two are laborers, while the other two are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food for pig breeding.

loans.name: Guandulin

texts.en: Guandulin M. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 49 years old and is married with six adult children. Guandulin owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and octopus meat in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Guandulin joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish and other seafoods to sell. Guandulin is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Milton

texts.en:
Operating a retail shop selling general merchandise is a formidable business venture from which M. Milton, aged 31, has managed to earn some money to fulfill his life and his family's necessities up until now in Omuruberera Trading Centre, Rukungiri. 

It is difficult for many youth in this area to settle down and create their own means of earning; many spend their time drinking alcohol and gambling. Milton has a different economic approach and has the responsibility of taking care of his 3 children and family, which has made him selttle down with his business.

Having received little capital from his previous farming business, to kick start his retail shop business that should make him 350,000 UGX monthly, he is seeking a loan to expand his business into wholesale and purchase enough stock as there is a ready market of customers. He is looking at buying a plot of land when he gets more money.

loans.use: To purchase more stock.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca R. is from the village of Centro Napu,Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old, widowed, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for sale. She is just starting this business.

In 2008, Francisca joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to build shelter for her livestock. Francisca is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be her 6th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Yajaira Abigail

texts.es: Yajaira habitante de comarca mokoron, su familia esta conformado por su esposo y un hijo menor el cual estudia educacion primaria, su principal actividad es su pequeño negocio venta de ropa, es una mujer muy progresiva y con deseo de superacion, su esposo colabora en los quehaceres de su unidad de produccion y  tambien con el manejo de su inventario ganadero,  necesita este financiamiento para invertirlo en compra de ropa para surtir el inventario de su negocio y de esta menera mejorar el nivel de sus ingresos economicos en la familia, en su comunidad la consideran como un persona de buenas costumbres,  espera ser beneficiado con el fondo KIVA para poder hacer realidad su sueño.
texts.en:
Yhajaira lives in the Mokoron region. Her family is comprised of her husband and a minor child who goes to elementary school. Her main activity is her small business of selling clothes. She is a very progressive woman with the desire to excel. Her husband assists with production unit tasks and with managing their inventory of livestock. She needs this loan to buy clothes to stock the inventory in her business. This will improve the family’s level of income. In her community she is considered to be a person of good moral values. She hopes to receive a Kiva loan to be able to make her dream a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make purchases for her business

loans.name: Wilmer Antonio

texts.es: WILMER ANTONIO P., Trabaja como Higienista en el Mercado Roberto Huembés de Managua. el prestamo solicitado lo Va a utilizarlo el la plata en la reconstrucción de casa de habitación repellar paredes y resolver algunos problemas familiares, tiene un hijo  y este se encuentra en edad escolar, los prestamos otorgados por ceprodel han sido para el mejoramiento de su casa de habitacion.
texts.en: Wilmer Antonio P. works as a hygienist in the Roberto Huembés market in the city of Managua.  The loan he requested is to reconstruct his home, plaster walls, and solve some family problems.  He has a son of school-age.  The loans have been granted by Kiva field partner Ceprodel to improve his home.

loans.use: To reconstruct his home and plaster walls.

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en: Sarantuya A. is 43 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her oldest son is a student at the university while her younger son attends elementary school. Both Sarantuya and her middle daughter receive pensions for disabilities. Sarantuya has been operating a small boot-making and repair business in their home, with the help of her husband, since 1990 and has gained much experience. She successfully participated in the program of providing services to disabled children at home, implemented by World Vision, NGO, and was named "Best Volunteer-2008" in Huvsgul province. Her business earnings have enabled her not only to pay her daughter's tuition fees but also to provide for her entire family. Sarantuya is a modest, helpful, and open-minded business woman and is requesting a 250,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary materials and supplies to make a wider variety of shoes and boots.

loans.use: To make more shoes and boots

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es: Maria del Carmen tiene
texts.en: Maria del Carmen has

loans.use: Purchase of groceries

loans.name: Marjory

texts.en:
Marjory B. is from the village of Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya . She is 48 years old. Marjory is married and has four children. To make a living, Marjory owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for breeding. Marjory has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marjory joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marjory has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Marjory is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Marjory from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

location.town: Brgy. Inaban,Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Ekoué

texts.fr: Ekoue a 29 ans et est marié. IL est né à Agbetiko et  vit à Lomé.  Il est électronicien mais associe la vente d’appareils électroniques. Il achète  habituellement  au port autonome de Lomé et revient vendre dans son atelier à Akodessewa. Il demande un crédit au près de WAGES pour acheter d’autre nouveaux appareils et de là satisfaire beaucoup de clients.
texts.en: Ekoué is 29 years old and married. He was born in Agbetiko and lives in Lomé. He is an expert in electronics and also a retailer of electronic devices. He usually buys his supplies at the autonomous port of Lomé and retails in his workshop in Akodessewa. He came to WAGES and applied for a loan to buy new devices, so that he can satisfy his many customers.

loans.use: To buy electronic devices

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a married man with one child who is still too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

He has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business for the past two years. Neighbors and passersby are his potential customers. Juma faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to expand and purchase a car for hire in the future. 

With the 20,000 KES loan, he wants to purchase another motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle

loans.name: Soy

texts.en: Soy S., 31, purchases rice to sell, earning an income of USD 5 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. Her husband is a civil servant, earning an income of USD 2 per day. The family has to spend USD 50 on food, USD 5 on electricity, and USD 45 on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase rice to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr:
Monsieur Daouda  Koné  est un homme marié de 29 ans polygame qui  vit   avec ses  deux  enfants à Gouna, dans un  village de la  Préfecture de Kolondièba, dans une grande famille élargie  dans la  troisième région (Sikasso) de la  République Mali.
N’ayant pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école, Daouda s’est très vite initié aux activités génératrices  en optant pour fait l’achat vente de petits ruminants. 
Pour augmenter son capital il adhère au programme de  Soro Yiriwaso  et il est à son premier  prêt. Monsieur Koné a 10 ans d’expérience dans cette activité.
Il achète des  montons et chèvres, dans son village Gouna et environnants et les revend au marché à bétail de Kolondièba à une clientèle composée de bouchers et d’autres consommateurs. La vente se fait  généralement au comptant.   
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice de 40.000FCFA par mois soit 120.000FCA par trimestre.
Le bénéfice  sera réinvesti dans  l’entreprise. 
Il ambitionne ouvrir une boutique pour la vente des articles et divers pour diversifier ses activités.
texts.en:
Mr. Daouda Koné is a polygamous man, 29 years of age, who lives with his two children in a large extended family in Gouna, a village in the Kolondièba, in the third Region (Sikasso) of Mali.

Not having had the opportunity to attend school, Daouda very early started earning an income, deciding to go into selling goats and sheep. In order to increase his capital, he has joined Soro Yiriwaso  and is now on his first loan. Mr. Koné has 10 years of experience in this business. He purchases sheep and goats in Gouna and nearby village and resells at the animal market Kolondièba to a customer base composed of butchers and other consumers. He generally sells for cash. He plans to achieve a monthly income of 40,000 West African Francs, i.e. 120,000 for  a three-month period. The income will be reinvested n his business. His goal is to be able to open a general store in order to diversify his activities.

loans.use: Purchasing goats and sheep

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Kusasira Development Group-Mukono

texts.en: Thirty-nine year old Sarah M. belongs to Kusasira Development group-Mukono. A decade is the time she has been bearing a hand in a pharmacy business in Kikoza. She joined this business with the influence of her mother. Before that she was into charcoal sales and retailing. Monthly this business generates shillings 200,000 and with this loan, the mother of 2 says she is going to purchase more stock of drugs to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of medicine to resell.

loans.name: Daylyn

texts.en:
Daylyn P. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 25 years-old. Daylyn is unmarried and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Daylyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk food, breads, biscuits and sanitary napkins in the local community. Daylyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Daylyn joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daylyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. Daylyn is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods and junk foods. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Daylyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Greyda Catalina

texts.es: La señora Greyda  Catalina R. , tiene la edad de 30 años , habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo que labora como mecánico , para apoyarla con los gastos del hogar ellos tiene a cargo dos niñas las cuales estudian su primaria y necesitan del apoyo de ambos , doña Greyda tiene el sueño de algún día poder comprar un tramo en el mercado para poder estar  estable en su negocio de frutas y verduras , durante este tiempo ah luchado día a día para brindarles sus pequeñas un mejor bienestar ya que con el primer crédito compro materiales de construcción p ara hacer el repello de la casa por la parte de adelante , ahora quiere comprar bloques , cemento , arenas y otros materiales para terminar de cerrar un cuarto ya que ella quiere que en un futuro las niñas tengan su propio cuarto .
texts.en: Mrs. Greyda Catalina Rios is 30 years old and she lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe together with her husband. He works as a mechanic in order to contribute towards the household expenses. They have two girls in their care who are in primary school and they need the support of them both. Greyda's dream is to purchase some day a stand in the market in order to have s table business location to sell fruits and vegetables. Throughout this time she has been struggling day after day to provide her little girls with well-being. With the first loan she was able to purchase construction materials to plaster the front section of the house. She now requires to purchase construction blocks, cement, sand, and other materials needed to finish building a room. She will need it in the future so that her daughters will have their own room.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Mendieta Onofre

texts.es:
J. de 62 años, es un hombre trabajador que inicio pintando carro pero un día se decidió por empezar a vender hot dog en una carrera ya que la pintura le hacía daño.

Su esposa le ayuda en la preparación de los hot dog en las mañana ya en la tarde el sale con su carreta a vender hasta la noche. No tiene dificultades en sus ventas ya que todos sus clientes lo conocen y lo esperan para comprarle.

Con el préstamo desea es invertir más en su carreta  para sus ventas y mejorar su vivienda. Su meta es seguir trabajando cada día más con su esposa.
texts.en:
J., age 62, is a hardworking gentleman who started out painting cars for a living. One day, he decided to sell hot dogs at a race because the paint was affecting his health.

His wife helps him with preparing hot dogs in the morning and then he goes out in the afternoons with his cart to sell them into the night. J. has no difficulty making sales since all of his customers know him and wait for him so that they can buy.

With this loan, he wants to invest more into his hot dog cart so that he can generate sales. In addition, he wants to make improvements to his home. His goal is to continue working each day alongside his wife.

loans.use: To invest in his hot dog business and pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
Soun M. is a 56-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Cham province. She is married to Touk Mao, who is also 56. Soun and her husband work together to cultivate and sell rice. The couple has two adult children who are married and who help them in the business. 

Soun is requesting a loan to buy a plot of farmland to grow a variety of crops. This loan will provide her with a new asset.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Ema

texts.es: La señora Ema tiene la edad de 66 años y pese a su edad es una persona muy trabajadora ya que tiene una tienda de abarrotes llamada “Monarca” y los días domingo por la noche vende pozole, corundas, tacos etc. ella tiene con su negocio de los abarrotes hace 5 años y dice que sus hijos les ayudaron a ponerlo para que de ahí se mantuvieran y no tuvieran preocupaciones de dinero. Doña Ema cada 8 días sale a surtirse de sus abarrotes a la población de Zitacuaro ya que dice que le dan buenos precios y así ella le puede ganar un poco más. La señora ema comprara con su crédito refresco, jabón, arroz, azúcar, papel higiénico, fríjol, pan, sopas, leche etc. ella esta agradecida con el préstamo porque dice que gracias a este podrá tener muy bien surtido su local.
texts.en: Ema is 66 years old, and in spite of her age, she is a very hard-working person. She has a small grocery store called “Monarca” ["Monarch"], and Sunday nights she also sells pozole [a traditional soup], corundas [a type of tamales], tacos, etc. She has had her grocery business for 5 years, and she says that her children helped her set it up, so that they could support themselves and not have money worries. Every 8 days, Ema goes out to stock up on groceries in the town of Zitacuaro, since she says they give her good prices there, and in this way she can earn a little more. With her loan, Ema will buy soft drinks, soap, rice, sugar, bathroom tissue, beans, bread, soups, milk, etc. She is grateful for the loan because she says that thanks to it, she will be able to have her store very well stocked.

loans.use: stock her small grocery store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. J. is a married lady who has four children aged between twelve and twenty-three years old. She describes herself as God-fearing and customer-friendly.

Mary sells fish to local people. She has been in this business for ten years now. Her business is located along the roadside in Kisumu, the region of Kenya that includes the famous Lake Victoria and is well known for production of tilapia fish. She works very hard to keep her business doing well.

Mary says that her business is profitable, but her major challenge is a lack of refrigeration facilities to keep the fish fresh longer. She is using her loan of 60,000 KES to buy a freezer to store her fish. Mary hopes to be a wholesaler in future. She also sees herself owning fish ponds in which she will raise fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy a freezer to store her fish.

loans.name: Tolibjon

texts.ru: Толибчон проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 24 года. Женат. Имеет 5 детей. Он живет вместе с родителями. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается торговлей на рынке. У него имеется магазин, где он продает телевизоры и DVD. Вместе с ним работает его брат. Этим видом деятельности Толибчон занимается 7 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения новых моделей телевизоров.
texts.en: Tolibjon lives in the city of Kulob. He's twenty-four years old, married and has five children. His wife is a stay-at-home mom; they live with his parents. Tolibjon has a store at the market, where has sold TV's and DVD's with his brother for the last seven years. He's requesting a loan to buy new models of TV's.

loans.use: to purchase new television sets

loans.name: Melida Terersa

texts.es:
Mélida vive en el municipio de San Jacinto en el departamento de Bolívar, con su esposo trabajador independiente y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 10 a 16 años, con los que sueña se conviertan en unas personas exitosas  y son ellos  su principal motor en el ejercicio diario de su trabajo como artesana, heredado de su medio  familiar y que se constituyen desde hace 15 años, en  ingresos importantes con los que apoya la gestión de su hogar.  
Mélida tiene dos negocios por un lado vende manualidades que ella misma fabrica y por otro comercializa productos de belleza y mercancía en general. Su meta más adelante es tener un punto comercial donde se exhiban sus manualidades, y hacerlo crecer hasta convertirlo en un almacén especializado de artesanías. Mélida es una mujer que ha aprendido a observar lo que necesita el mercado y lo que ella también puede ofrecer para responderle, aumentando sus ingresos, por eso también comercializa productos de belleza, electrodomésticos menores por encargo y los vende a crédito. Este es el primer financiamiento que Mélida hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, porque necesita aumentar su capital de trabajo, para responderle oportunamente a sus clientes y con su credikiva planea comprar cosméticos, hornos microondas, licuadoras, entre otros artículos que tiene encargados y que rotaran rápidamente entre sus mejores clientes, haciendo de esta una recuperación oportuna y una inversión exitosa. Mientras Mélida aporta su gran esfuerzo para alcanzar su sueño, continua con una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menores del 37%, que con su credikiva actual y los futuros proyecta incrementar
texts.en:
Mélida lives in the municipality of San Jacinto, department of Bolívar, with her husband (who is self-employed) and their three children, who are between the ages of 10 and 16. She dreams that her children will become successful people and they are the principal motivation for the work she does every day. She works as an artisan, which was passed down through her family. She has been doing this work for 15 years and her income is important because it helps support her household.

Mélida has two businesses. On one side, she sells crafts that she makes herself. On the other, she sells beauty products and general merchandise. Her goal in the future is to have a storefront where she can exhibit her crafts, and she thinks about developing it into a specialized store for artisan crafts.

Mélida is a woman who has learned how to observe what the market needs and what she can do to respond to it in order to increase her earnings. This is why she also sells beauty products and small home appliances on request, and she sells them on credit. Mélida is taking out her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo because she needs to increase her working capital in order to respond opportunely to her customers. She plans to use her "credikiva" to buy cosmetics, microwave ovens, blenders, and other items that she has orders for or that move quickly among her best customers. She will make her money back quickly and it will be a successful investment.

Mélida puts in great effort in order to achieve her dream. She consistently makes a profit of at least 37% and with this Kiva loan, she projects that future profits will increase.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, microwave ovens, blenders, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy embroidery material.

loans.name: Carmentina Lili

texts.en: Carmentina lives in the town of Danli in southern Honduras where she has made a living for the last 18 years by selling clothing and women’s cosmetics. She is a returning client and has maintained a punctual payment history. Carmentina is requesting a loan of Lps. 10,000 with which to purchase merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase pants, skirts, blouses, shirts, sandals, lipstick, eyeliner, moisturizer, and foundation.

loans.name: Rhona May

texts.en:
Rhona May is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Rhona May has a food shop that sells banana and sweet potato cues (caramelised sweet snacks). She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy ripe bananas and sugar.

Rhona May is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy ripe bananas and sugar

loans.name: Ana Cesilia

texts.es: Ana Cesilia ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene 3 pero solamente uno de sus hijos esta bajo su cargo. Inicio hace 11 años con esta actividad, tiene que levantarse temprano para salir a ofrecer cada día sus productos. El entusiasmo  de trabajar y sacar a su familia delante es lo que ha hecho que Ana este pendiente de su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de toallas, sabanas, calzado, cosméticos, bolsos y ropa en general.  Ella desea ampliar su inventario también quiere obtener otro negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Cesilia sells general merchandise.  She has three children, but only supports one of them.  She began her business 11 years ago.  She has to get up early to go out each day and sell her products.  Her enthusiasm for working and helping her family get ahead in life have made Ana devoted to her business.  

She is applying for a loan to buy towels, sheets, footwear, cosmetics, handbags and clothing. She wishes to expand her inventory, and also wants to start another business.

loans.use: To sell towels, sheets, footwear, cosmetics, handbags, and clothing

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, age 29, has been practicing mixed farming for the past six years. Previously, she sold furniture to earn a living. She testifies that she has lifted up her standard of living through Faulu Kenya. She and her husband have two children, both enrolled in school.

Rose dreams of having a well-established business in the future. She has requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 Kenya shillings in order to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is married with three children. She is 32 years old and lives in Delusom, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur.

Daisy sells groceries to earn a living and has had this business for one year. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this business. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase stock for her general store.

In the future, Daisy hopes that she can provide their financial needs every day.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 11, 9 y 6 años de edad, él se dedica a la venta de agua, refrescos, jugos, galletas, él inicio trabajando en el lavado de carros, luego quiso instalar su propio negocio lleva 15 años ya realizando sus ventas, el horario es de 6:00am a 4:00pm.
Actualmente comprara más mercadería, aprovechando la compra por mayoreo de bebidas, galletas, agua, con esta inversión mejorara el servicio que brinda a las tiendas donde distribuye mercadería.
Su primer propósito es terminar de pagar el vehículo, en el que trabaja transportando la mercadería, y con su progreso en el negocio también mejorar la condición de su familia.
texts.en:
Víctor lives with his wife and children (ages 11, 9, and 6). He sells water, soft drinks, juices, and cookies. Víctor started out working at a car wash, but he later established his own business 15 years ago so that he could begin making sales. His work schedule is from 6am to 4pm.

He currently needs to buy more merchandise and take advantage of bulk purchases of beverages, cookies, and water. With this investment, he will improve the service he provides to the stores that receive his merchandise. His main goal is to finish the payments on the vehicle that he uses for transporting his merchandise. By making progress in his business, Víctor will also be able to improve his family’s conditions.

loans.use: to buy beverages, cookies, and water in bulk.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is married and blessed with one child. Violeta is 54 years of age and lives in Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental.

Violeta has a small farm. She plants various fruits and vegetables like "santol", squash, string beans, "kangkong" and others. To earn a living Violeta sells vegetables to a buyer in the market. She has been engaged in this business for five years. Violeta has a net income every month in the amount of PHP 2500 with this line of business. She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for her farm.

Violeta has been a member of GDMPC for 3 years.  Violeta wishes to buy another piece of land where she can plant more vegetables and fruits.


GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC: people empowering people.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: C1907 Abagamijiterambere Group

texts.en:
Josiane, 29 years old, is married, has four children between 3 and 7 years old and takes care of one person. She is the leader of this group called “ABAGAMIJITERAMBERE” in the local language. Josiane has been selling various good such as rice, sugar, salt, flour, etc. for seven years. In the photo, she is the second person on the left in the first row. 

Josiane and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand their businesses and purchase more goods to sell. With any profits from the loan, Josiane and her team would like to satisfy their families' basic needs, reinvest in their businesses and start saving for their future.

loans.use: To purchase various good such as rice, sugar, salt and flour

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine, 32, is married and has two children age 2 and 5. She has been selling clothes for about three years and her hours of operation are from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. daily.

Vestine has requested this loan through Vision Finance Company in order to sell different styles of clothes. The extra income from this loan will help her business and enable her to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Maria Salome

texts.en: Maria Salome is a widow with three children. She is 37 years old and lives in Ozamis City, Philippines. Maria Salome owns and operates a motorcycle transport business to earn a living, and she's been in this business for two years. Each month, she earns 5,600 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 20,000 to purchase motorcycle spare parts for better service. Maria Salome has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Maria Salome wants to have another motorcycle for transport.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spareparts

loans.name: Francisco Manuel

texts.es:
Don Francisco, es un hombre que continua en el comercio de la venta y compra de chatarra, en donde estos años, le ha ido bien, al invertir mas en materiales para vender y que gracias a prestamo se le hizo posible hacer mas grande su capital, generandole mejores ganancias.
Con su credito anterior logro terminar su muro, que le da mas reguardo a su propiedad, como mejor seguridad a su familia, lo que esta contento por esta mejora y que junto a su esposa siguen trabajando en este pequeño negocio.
Con su nuevo financiamiento, invertira en la compra de alumino, bronce, hierro,cobre, acero, para, cumplir con la demanda de su negocio.
texts.en:
Francisco is a man who is continuing with his scrap metal business where he’s done well all these years; he will invest in more materials to sell.  Thanks to the loan he was able to increase his capital generating improved profits.

With his last loan he was able to finish building his wall to provide increased security for his property as well as for his family.  He is happy about this improvement since he continues working in his small business with his wife.

He will use the new loan to buy aluminum, bronze, iron, copper and steel to meet his business’ demand.

loans.use: to buy more metals.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia, de 49 años, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora. Esta separada de su esposo, y vive en compañía de su hija de 14 años, a la que quiere mucho y desea darle una mejor calidad de vida, habitando una casa que es de su propiedad. La actividad que realiza Aurelia es la venta de comida rápida y frituras, como pollos Broaster, salchipapas, contando para esto con un pequeño local acondicionado en su propia casa, a la que le puso el nombre de Salchipapería “Las dos Hermanitas”, siendo muy conocida por esa zona, atendiendo a su clientela desde hace 4 años. En este negocio cuenta con el apoyo de su hija y un ayudante para la atención a la clietela. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el cocinar, le gusta su trabajado, la distrae, habiéndose iniciado por necesidad económica, ya que no les alcanzaba con el ingreso de su ex pareja. Ahora que ha crecido un poco más su negocio, le genera los ingresos económicos que necesita para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar  y los estudios de su hija, a la que quiere mucho y es su motivación para seguir esforzándose y salir adelante. Por otro lado, considera a su negocio rentable, ya que cuenta con una regular clientela que se supo ganara gracias a su buena atención y carisma. Tiene planes de crecer su negocio, incursionando en la venta de pollos a la brasa. Este será el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo para avanzar con su negocio, desea seguir recibiendo dicho apoyo, por eso se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con el pago de sus cuotas, como en los créditos anteriores. Por otro lado se siente contenta con el grupo comunal que forma parte, ya que considera a sus integrantes ser personas solidarias y responsables.
Con le monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de un horno a un costo referencial de 2500 nuevos soles, para incursionar en el negocio de venta de pollos a la brasa,  y lo restante los invertirá en los ingredientes para la preparación de pollos broaster.
texts.en:
Aurelia, age 49, is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She is separated from her husband and lives with her 14-year-old daughter who she loves dearly and wants to provide a better quality of life. Aurelia lives in her own home. She sells fast food and fried snacks, such as roasted chicken and “salchipapas” (sausages and fried potatoes), from a small space inside of her home. Her business is named “Las Dos Hermanitas” (The Two Little Sisters) and is well-known in the area. Aurelia has been serving her customers for four years. In her business, her daughter and another employee help with attending to the customers. She enjoys cooking and working because it keeps her occupied. Aurelia started working out of financial necessity since she receives no income from her ex-husband. Now she wants to grow her business a little more so that she can generate the necessary income to pay for the household expenses and her daughter’s education. She wants this very much, so she is motivated to continue striving and moving forward. Aurelia considers her business to be profitable because she has regular customers that she has gained as a result of her good service and charming personality. She has plans to grow her business by adding the sale of barbecued chickens.

This will be her fifth loan with the MFP organization. Aurelia is grateful for the financial support she has received so that she can advance her business. She wants to continue receiving this support, so she promises to continue the completion of her payments just as she did with her previous loans. Aurelia is pleased to be part of her Communal Bank group because she considers the members to be supportive and responsible individuals. The amount she requested will be invested in the purchase of an oven that costs 2500 PEN so that she can begin selling barbecued chickens. The rest of the loan will be invested in ingredients for preparing roasted chickens.

loans.use: to purchase an oven and ingredients for preparing roasted chickens.

loans.name: Tuaoi

texts.en:
Tuaoi is 39 years of age, married, and has three children.

Tuaoi owns and operates a business venture selling fried foods in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business. Tuaoi needs a loan of 1,500 Somoa Tala (WST) to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 WST or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Tuaoi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Tuaoi's 2nd loan with SPBD. 

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Isabelle

texts.fr: Isabelle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Ayant pour activité principale la vente de divers au grand marché , elle les vend en carton et en détail et fait son approvisionnement dans le même marché chez des grossistes. Pour  faire face à la demande de cette clientèle qui ne cesse de s'accroître, elle opte pour le renouvellement de son micro-crédit à Finadev. Dame Isabelle vise à maximiser ses intérêts  et à supporter en partie les dépenses de son foyer et surtout la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Isabelle is married and mother to three children. 

Her main business is selling a variety of items at the large market, which she sells both individually and by the carton, and she gets her supplies at the same market at the wholesaler's. 

To respond to the demand from her clients which doesn't stop growing, she has opted to renew her micro-loan with Finadev. 

Madam Isabelle aims to maximize her interests and to partially pay for her household expenses and especially her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy 25 large bottles of mayonnaise, 100 1kg bags of rice, 100 1L bottles of oil and other items.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba has four children. She has received a junior high education. 

Aba sells fried plantain and bean stew (red-red) at Enyinase. She has done this for twelve years. Her husband is a farmer. Aba uses her income to support and take care of the home expenditures. 

Aba will use the loan to purchase plantain and beans to cook for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase plantain and beans to cook for sale.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa is a 36-year-old married woman with four children. The oldest child is 11 years old. Her husband works as a driver. Marissa has been running a sari-sari store for 6 years. She sells items like soy sauce, vinegar, cooking oil and canned goods. Marissa is able to help provide for her family's daily needs through her business. Marissa is requesting a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks and rice. Marissa hopes for her business to grow. She also hopes to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks and rice

loans.name: Rosa Orfelina

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer trabajador que tiene muchas aspiraciones en los años próximos de prosperar en su pequeña tienda ya que tiene una familia conformada de tres hijos y es soltera. 

Comenzó con el negocio vendiendo pequeñas cosas poco a poco comenzó a tener ingresos. Ahora ella trabaja en su tienda.  Tiene muchas aspiraciones por eso quiere continuar su tienda para darle una mejor vida a sus hijos. 

Por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar vivieres para la tienda como arroz, aceites, bebidas, granos etc.
texts.en:
Rosa is a hardworking woman who has many goals in the coming years for her little store to prosper.  She has a family of three children and is single.

She began the business selling little things and little by little began to have income.  Now she works in her store.  She has many goals, so she wants to continue her store to give her children a better life.

This is why she wants the loan to buy supplies for the store such as rice, oil, beverages, grains, etc.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and beverages.

loans.name: Rosita Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socios emprendedores una de ellos es Ervin que es artesano en bambú tiene experiencia  desde hace 15 años, tiene 36 años de edad y es un negocio heredado por sus padres. El crédito lo  invertirá en materia prima como el bambú, Rosita vende legumbres y frutas y Celia vende frutas.
texts.en: This group is formed of three business-minded friends. One of them is Ervin, who is an artisan working with bamboo. He has worked with bamboo since he was 15 years old, and he is 36 years old now. He inherited the business from his parents. His share of the loan money will be used to buy raw materials such as bamboo. As for the other members of the group, Rosita sells vegetables and fruits, and Celia sells fruits.

loans.use: purchase raw materials such as bamboo.

loans.name: Djidjoho Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DJIDJOHO est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Philomène Akouavi est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo, et a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Philomène Akouavi  est âgée de 40 ans et vit au Bénin. Philomène Akouavi est mariée à un certain du nom de Alphonse. Le couple à un enfant, scolarisé et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Philomène Akouavi vend depuis dix ans des tissus, des mèches et des produits cosmétiques. Philomène Akouavi s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Philomène Akouavi ensemble avec les membres du  groupe DJIDJOHO, sollicite un premier crédit.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus, des mèches et des produits cosmétiques.

loans.name: Minakpon Group

texts.fr: MINAKPON est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la cinquième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Marie Claire (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 34 ans. Marie Claire a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Marie Claire est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Bahougobi. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Marie Claire et son mari. Pour cette raison, Marie Claire vend du maïs et des conserves dans sa région depuis dix sept ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Marie Claire s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Marie Claire sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe MINAKPON, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des conserves et du maïs.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claudine is 36 years old. He is married with 3 children aged between 5 and 11 years, 2 of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 5 years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to pay medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: 55 year old Teresita is a farmer from the town of Garcia Hernandez in Bohol province. She and her husband work in the farm tending to their vegetables like eggplants and spring onions while also raising hogs. They support themselves since their daughter has her own family now. She is asking a loan to buy feed, piglets and fertilizer for her farm. Teresita dreamed that someday, out of her business she can also support and help her daughter in raising her grandchildren. Part of her profit will be for school fees of her grandchild and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy feed, piglets and fertilizer

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Mrs. O. had her 3 years fashion design training from 1996 to 1998 and has practiced her profession for 8 years. She is optimistic that her business will improve more than what it is now if given the above amount.

loans.use:
To buy sewing machines and clothes for making
Dresses for sale

loans.name: Sodjidé

texts.en:
Sodjidé A. is a widow, born in Kpétsou in 1951. She has five children. She now lives by producing gari (a granulated cassava flour). Her deceased husband, a peasant at the time, did not leave an inheritance to his now orphaned children. To provide for her school-age children, she buys cassava from farms, digging the roots out of the earth. She then produces gari from them to sell in local marketplaces. Presently, she is requesting a loan of $600 to buy large fields of cassava in order to augment her production and to meet market demands. Her sales will increase, so that she can better provide for the needs of her children.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1951 à Kpétsou, Veuve A. Sodjidé est mère de cinq (5) enfants. Elle vit aujourd’hui d’une activité : la production du gari (farine à base du manioc). Son mari défunt, paysan de son vivant, n’a pas laissé un héritage aux orphelins. Pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants encore en âge scolaire, Madame A. achète du manioc sur les champs, le déterre et produit du gari qu’elle vend sur les marchés locaux. Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit de $600 pour pouvoir acheter de grands champs de manioc afin d’augmenter sa production et répondre aux demandes du marché. Ceci augmentera son chiffre d’affaire afin de mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.

loans.use: To buy cassava fields in order to augment her production of gari

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona has had a small store in her home for about two years. She and her husband also travel around the local area offering their products to the public from a tricycle cart. They mainly sell eggs, cheese and ham, often serving as distributors to other small stores in the area.

Ramona is hoping that she can take out a loan to improve her profits. She will purchase more of her common products at better prices and much larger quantities. She hopes to eventually start delivering these products to all the small stores in the area.

Ramona is 28 years old and she has two daughters who are in school. Her husband is very supportive of her business and helps her invest with leftover income from his job. They hope they can make some improvements to their humble home in the near future.

loans.use: Invest in ham, eggs and cheeses

loans.name: Silvino

texts.es:
Silvino is married and has four children, all grown and married. He used to work as a schoolteacher in Creel, in the state of Chihuahua, and is now retired. He couldn't make ends meet with his retirement pay, so he set himself up in business as a carpenter and furniture maker. He is well respected for the quality of the furniture he produces.

He needs tools to speed up production and improve the quality of his goods. Silvino is asking for a loan of $825, which he expects to repay in only six months. With this loan he will buy the specialized tools and raw materials he needs to stay in business. Silvino thanks all lenders for their support and their contribution toward the growth of his business.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Señor Silvino es casado y tiene cinco hijos, todos ellos casados. Años atrás él se desempeñaba como maestro en la localidad de Creel en Chihuahua, pero una vez que se jubiló la pensión que recibía era muy poca para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, ante esta necesidad inició su propio negocio, un taller de carpintería en el que ha logrado realizar muy buenos trabajos y se ha dado a conocer entre sus clientes por la calidad de los muebles que fabrica.

Para agilizar su producción y mejorar la calidad de los productos que elabora, Silvino solicita un crédito por $ 825 dólares que se compromete a regresar en solo 6 meses, de esta manera podrá adquirir mejor herramienta y comprar el material que necesita para continuar con su trabajo. Silvino agradece a todas las personas por su apoyo y contribución para el crecimiento de su negocio.

loans.use: To buy tools and raw materials

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Mrs. Manuela M. lives in two rooms she rents in the Llojeta area, west of La Paz city. She lives with her two daughters since her husband abandoned them two years ago. Mrs. Manola buys and sells clothes for a living, traveling to the provinces.

Mrs. Manuela, with her savings, was able to purchase a small piece of land in the hillsides of the city for which she paid 50% and the balance is left to be paid.

The credit requested will be used for the construction of a single room in this property, to which they'll move and hence save the rent they currently pay.

This is the first time they request a loan. The socioeconomic analysis of the family qualifies them favorably and allows them to access a new credit.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


La señora Manuela M. vive en dos habitaciones en alquiler en la zona de Llojeta ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con sus dos hijas, ya que su esposo las abandono hace dos años; la señora Manuela se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa, viajando a las provincias. La señora Manuela, con sus ahorros pudo comprar un pequeño terreno en las laderas de la ciudad para la que pago el 50% y el saldo se encuentra pendiente de pago. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de una habitación en su terreno, al que se trasladaran, para poder así ahorrar los alquileres que ahora pagan. Esta es la primera vez que solicitan un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Building a single room house

loans.name: Lukia

texts.en:
Lukia is a 56-year-old hard-working mother of three, who lives in the Vituka area in the city of Dar es Salaam. She has been in business for 20 years, and now operates a small food market. She received training in business and entrepreneurship skills from the Youth Self Employment Foundation.

Lukia requests a loan of $550 to purchase food to sell in her shop.

loans.use: Purchase supplies to sell

loans.name: Ina

texts.en:
Ina is 25 years old and a mother of one child, aged 5. She sells clothes on credit. She has been running her business for quite a long time. She can earn a profit of $2.50 per day. Her husband, D., is a motorcycle driver who has no regular income.

Ina is a member of MBK. She is requesting IDR 500,000 ($75 USD) to expand her business and generate more income. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy various types of clothes

loans.name: Shafiga

texts.en: Shafiga is 44-year-old woman who owns a small booth in the Sabirabad bazaar. She has been selling women's and baby clothing for seven years. She would like to increase the inventory of her clothes and for this purpose she requests 1200 USD.

loans.use: Increase the inventory of her clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase merchandise for the store

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor, is a very industrious, multifaceted, and enterprising woman, who has always sought a way to provide to her family with the necessary things that they need to develop fully. Therefore, since she was very young, she has been selling different articles of clothing. She is a very responsible and dedicated mother to her 5 children. On the weekends, with the aid of her older daughter and her husband she sells chicken soup, from her in-laws’ house. During the week, she is dedicated her clothing sales (and when the opportunity arises, footwear sales) in a small rented space near her house. For a year, Leonor has sold food and also other articles of clothing locally. Before she was trying to sell groceries, but found that it produced low profits. Leonor has dreamt of owning a car and has now decided to invest her savings to buy a car, so she can have transportation. However, this dream is in the distant future (as she cannot afford it yet), therefore, she will continue to work for the benefit and welfare of her beloved family. She needs a loan to increase the quantity and variety of articles of clothing that she offers in order to increase her profits and eventually reach her dream.

Translated from Spanish by Jenny Dean, Kiva Volunteer.

Leonor, es una mujer emprendedora, multifacética y muy hacendosa, siempre ha buscado la manera de proveer a su familia lo necesario para que se desarrollen plenamente, por esa razón su vida siempre ha estado ligada, desde muy joven, al comercio de diferentes artículos que han albergado una experiencia positiva en el mundo de las ventas; ahora ya es una madre de familia muy responsable y dedicada a sus 5 hijos. Los fines de semana vende caldo de gallina, de cabeza y mondongo en la casa de sus suegros con la ayuda de su hija mayor y su esposo, los días en los que no desarrolla esta actividad se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir en un pequeño espacio que alquiló muy cerca de su casa y en oportunidades aprovecha las temporadas para vender calzados. Leonor ya lleva un año dedicándose a la venta de comida y también de prendas de vestir en un local, antes se dedicaba a la venta de abarrotes, pero decidió ya no hacerlo por las bajas ganancias que le producían. Ha decidido invertir los ahorros que le han permitido obtener sus actividades económicas para comprarse un auto para incursionar en el transporte urbano y aunque este anhelo está todavía un poco lejano de concretar, se ha propuesto seguir trabajando para beneficio y bienestar de su querida familia. En esta oportunidad solicita un préstamo para incrementar la cantidad y variedad de prendas de vestir que oferta a fin de acrecentar sus ganancias para pronto alcanzar su sueño.

loans.use: Capital gain to increase the quantity and variety of articles of clothing that she offers.

loans.name: Thi Xuan's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. C. Thi Xuan, 50 years old, is living with her 2 children (one of which is working, and the other one is still going T. school), her husband and her father-in-law. Her family does many activities such as: working on the rice field, selling merchandises in general store, sell fertilizer, assisting ceremonies, catering, etc. She wants T. borrow money T. expand her general store. Other members in her group also want T. borrow 125 USD in 25 weeks. They are: Mrs. L. Thi Canh, 47 years old, and Mrs. T. Thi Hoa, 32 years old, borrow money T. buy rice T. make rice crepes; Mrs. T. Thi Nga, 43 years old, borrows money T. sell noodles; Mrs. V. Thi Ty, 54 years old, wants T. borrow money T. buy pig mash; and Mrs. D. Thi Them, 35 years old, wants T. borrow money T. sell noodles and eggs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị C. Thị Xuân, 50 tuổi, sống cùng 2 con (1 con đã đi làm, còn 1 còn đi học), chồng và bố chồng. Gia đình chị rất nhiều hoạt động: làm ruộng, bán hàng tạp hóa, bán phân, đạm... (dịch vụ nông nghiệp); cho thuê phông bạt, bát đũa... phục vụ các đám cưới hỏi, ma chay... Chị vay vốn để thêm vốn mua hàng tạp hóa bán. Các thành viên còn lại trong nhóm chị đều vay mức vốn 2006000 đồng trong 25 tuần: Chị Lê Thị Canh, 47 tuổi và Chị Tô Thị Hoa, 32 tuổi vay vốn để mua gạo làm vỏ bánh đa nem. Chị Trần Thị Ngà, 43 tuổi, vay vốn để buôn bán mỳ, hàng mã. Chị Vũ Thị Tỷ, 54 tuổi, vay vốn để mua cám lợn, ngan. Chị Đinh Thị Thêm, 35 tuổi, vay vốn để buôn bán các mặt hàng mỳ, trứng...

loans.use: buy more merchandises for general store, buy rice, pig mash, to sell noodles and eggs

loans.name: Tupokigwe

texts.en: Tupokigwe M. is from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania.  She is 32 years old, married, and has 3 children aged 5, 9 and 11. In 2004, Tupokigwe established a used clothing business, which imports second-hand clothes from North America and Europe, washes and irons them, then sells them on the streets of Dar es Salaam.  She is now requires a loan of $425 in order to purchase additional clothes in bulk.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Aristides

texts.es:
Aristides started working in a service station, but for various reasons, the station unfortunately had to close and the company was obligated to give Aristides a one-time severance pay. When Aristides received the money, he was very astute and decided to invest it in starting his own small business that he could use to generate greater income.

Due to his great interest in animals and due to the fact that his brother is studying to be a veterinarian, he decided to open a veterinary store. The work is very well organized; while Aristides sells animal food and medicine, his brother does vaccinations. The two work together in a very efficient way which has brought them more and more customers.

This loan will be used to purchase balanced meals for animals.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

Arístides inicio trabajando en una estación de servicio, por diversos motivos, la compañía tuvo que cerrar entonces se vieron obligados a pagarle a Arístides una indemnización. Cuando Arístides recibió esta suma de dinero fue muy inteligente y no dudo en invertir en una microempresa que le pueda generar más dinero.

Debido a su gran pasión por los animales y debido al hecho que su hermano estudia veterinaria decidió abrir una veterinaria. El trabajo esta muy bien organizado; mientras Arístides vende remedios y alimentos para animales, su hermano se dedica a la parte de vacunación. Los dos trabajan conjuntamente de una manera muy eficiente. Por lo tanto el número de clientes va a aumentando día a día.

El dinero proveído por el crédito será utilizado para la compra de balanceados para animales.

loans.use: Purchase of balanced meals for animals

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị N., 43 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2007. She has been in the business of selling grains and rice and of making rice mills for eight years. She used her first loan of 3,000,000 VND to purchase grains and rice. She has a flair for business and always takes advantage of market conditions - when price conditions are favorable, she sells. In conjunction with her grain and rice related businesses, she also invests in raising pigs to make use of the leftover husk and bran.

The family's dream is to establish a rice factory locally. Her husband and two children all help with the family businesses. One of her children is still attending school and the other is able to help in all facets of the business.

For this round of loans, they would like to raise 9,000,000 VND to purchase grains. Their average income is 4,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị N. 43 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2007, có gần 8 năm trong nghề buôn bán thóc, gạo và làm máy xay sát. Tham gia vào Quỹ vòng vốn đầu tiên chị vay 3.000.000đ đầu tư thêm vốn vào mua thóc, gạo. Chị là người nhạy bén trong kinh doanh và luôn năm bắt tốt thị trường khi thời điểm được giá là chị lại bán, kết hợp với việc làm nghề buôn bán thóc, gạo, máy xay sát chị còn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, tận dụng cám bã thừa, với mong muốn của gia đình chị trong tương lai sẽ mở đại lý gạo ngay tại địa phương, công việc gia đình chị luôn được chồng và 2 con chị chia sẻ, 1 con chị vẫn đang đi học, 1 con đã phụ giúp các công việc gia đình. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000 đầu tư vào mua gao. Thu nhập bình quân. 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: To purchase grains.

loans.name: Biljana

texts.en:
Biljana is a young woman from the town of Doboj. She is married with one child, and her husband currently works full time. Biljana runs a small shop where she sells a variety of goods, including drinks, snacks, and some personal hygiene products.

She is requesting this first loan in the amount of 600 KM to use to purchase more inventory for her store. Her husband’s salary is not enough to support the whole family, and Biljana is having trouble meeting all of her overhead costs at the moment. She hopes that by taking this loan she can have more available to sell up front and that this will lead to an increase in her income.

loans.use: To buy more inventory to support her store

loans.name: Titik

texts.id: Titik H. (36) adalah ibu 2 anak dan memiliki usaha sebagai penjual kue. Saat ini dia sudah memasuki tahap pinjaman kedua, setelah sebelumnya telah melunasi pinjaman yang pertama. Pada pinjaman pertama, modal usaha yang deberikan dipakai untuk membeli bahan dasar membuat kue seperti tepung, telor dan alat membuatnya. Usahanya tersebut memberikan dia keuntungan sekitar Rp.100.000 setiap harinya, terlebih lagi di saat hari raya umat agama seperti Galungan dan Lebaran. Biasanya pada hari raya tersebut, banyak masyarakat yang memesan kue untuk perayaan. Contohnya saat ini memasuki masa menjelang Lebaran, Titik mendapat banyak pesanan kue untuk perayaan nantinya. Oleh karena itu, dia butuh modal usaha yang lebih besar, dan dia sangat berharap bisa meneruskan usaha ini sampai benar-benar memiliki modal sendiri nantinya.
texts.en:
Titik H. (36) is a mother of two and sells cake. Currently she is in her second stage of funding, after paying off her first loan. During her first stage of the loan, the capital was used to purchase raw materials such as flour, eggs and equipments. She earns around 100,000 IDR* profit every day, especially during religious holidays such as Hindu's Galungan and Muslim's Idl Fitr. For example, during a period prior to Idl Fitr such as now, Titik receives a lot of orders. Hence, she needs more working capital and she really hopes she could continue her business until she could 100% fund it by her own. * 1USD is roughly 9,000 IDR

Translated from Indonesian by arliadi (ludi) mahadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Adding working capital

loans.name: Salma's Tujikwamue Group

texts.en:
Salma is 38 years old, is married, and has three children between the ages of 11 and 4. She has run her own general store since 2005. She works every day from 6 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Salma is now seeking a loan to buy more products for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwana.

loans.use: To buy more products for her business.

loans.name: Felomena

texts.es: Felomena tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Es agricultora desde su niñez, sus raíces familiares tuvieron como sustento durante varios años esta actividad, ahora ella sigue, junto con su familia, esta línea de trabajo, en el cual cultiva principalmente papa y arveja, también cría animales, vacunos y ovinos.  Cada día se esfuerza levantándose de madrugada para preparar los alimentos necesarios para sus 3 hijos, que están en edad escolar, luego se dirige a ver sus campos de cultivo, de esa manera observa el crecimiento progresivo de sus plantaciones, para luego ir a un inmenso campo donde pasteará a sus animales, regresa cuando está por anochecer, después de esa larga  caminata. Felomena realiza este trabajo diariamente, movida siempre por darle a sus hijos todo el sustento necesario. Ahora, solicita este préstamo con el que podrá comprar abono y semillas. Ella desea seguir dedicándose a las tareas agrícolas, porque también le agrada la tranquilidad del campo.
texts.en:
Felomena is 48 years old. She lives with her husband and their three children. She has been a farmer since birth, her family roots having supported her during many years of this. Now she continues along with her family in this line of work, in which she mostly grows potatoes and aloe. She also raises animals, cows and sheep. Each day she works, getting up at dawn to prepare the food for her three children, who are of school age. Later she goes to a big field where she takes the animals to pasture. She returns when night is falling, after a long walk. Felomena does this work daily, motivated always to give her children all the sustenance that they need. Now, she is asking for a loan with which she would be able to buy fertilizer and seeds. She wants to continue working in agriculture, because she also likes the tranquility of the fields.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds to increase her agricultural production

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita A. is a 28-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She is a very resourceful wife and mother whose hard work brings a great deal to her family. Specifically, Rita supports her husband in providing for the household by working as a trader: she sells used shoes and ladies' slippers to earn a profit. Indeed, there is a big market for used shoes and slippers in Ghana because new shoes/slippers are too expensive for the country's poor people. Accordingly, selling used shoes and slippers is a niche market for many women like Rita to get involved in. Rita now seeks a loan to increase her business' inventory by purchasing additional used shoes and slippers. She believes the loan proceeds would enable her to pay for her children’s education and to rent a store for her trading business.

She is member of the group known as the God is Good Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each other's loans as social collateral (i.e., if one member does not promptly repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears), and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans.

loans.use: To increase her trading business' inventory by purchasing additional used clothing and shoes and to rent a store

loans.name: Oam

texts.en: Oam M., 44, is married and lives in the Prey Veng province with her husband and two children. She raises pigs and makes approximately $4 each day, while her husband makes $5 a day working in construction. Inflation has made prices soar lately in Cambodia, and Oam M. realized that she needed to expand her business to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase construction tools for her husband. She sees this loan as a great economic opportunity and believes that she can raise her standard of living through her careful investment.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools.

loans.name: Eutequa

texts.en:
Eutequa M. is already 50 years old. Her husband, a farmer, has been tilling the farm and working very hard to support their family. Their son is now in high school. No matter how hard she tries looking for additional income, she is somehow too old and can no longer be employed for a job. Since then, she heard about CEVI and decided to join their credit program and start her own business.

Eutequa's sari-sari store started last February 28, 2008 with PHP 10,000 in capital. Now, she wants to avail another loan to purchase additional merchandise for her store. She is not just focusing on her displays, but she is also into the “buy and sell” business. With this loan, she believes that she could increase her income and better support her family.

She is happy to be part of the CEVI credit program. Now, Eutequa still enjoys availing the credit assistance, trainings, as well the insurance coverage that CEVI offers to all its clients.
