loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy A. is a forty two year old widow that has four children – two boys and two girls. All of her children are currently in school. She lives together with her children in a family house in Koforidua, a small community near Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Koforidua is a business and farming community in the region. Lucy works very hard to take care of the family and, most importantly, to pay the children’s school fees.

Lucy owns a small drug store in front of the family house. She sells all kinds of drugs – tablets, syrups, local concoctions, etc... Lucy purchases her drugs from big pharmacy shops in the big cities, especially Kumasi, the regional capital. Lucy has managed this business for more than twenty years and is full of experience. As a result, many town folks shop in her store all day long. She would like a loan to procure drugs in bulk to meet her clients increasing demand and make more profit.

loans.use: To procure drugs for her shop.

loans.name: Chantho

texts.en: Mr. Chantho P. lives in Ta Koul village in Kandal province. He is 31 years old and has three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school, while the youngest one is still too young to work or study. Mr. Chantho P. earns income as a vet, while his wife, Mrs. Et Kong, is a farmer who cultivates rice and vegetables on a piece of land. Even though they work hard, Mr. Chantho P. and his wife still earn too little to be able to repair their family's house. Therefore, Mr. Chantho P. has decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: House repair

loans.name: Byambatsetseg

texts.en: Byambatsetseg N., 35, lives in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar (the capital city of Mongolia) with her husband, 15-year-old son and 2-year-old daughter. In 2001, her family moved into their own ger (a traditional tent) for the first time. In 1999, with her husband, she opened up a small butcher shop in the Hantalst open-air market in Ulaanbaatar. Since its inception, her business has been quite successful, and she has been able to invest her profits into opening a second, wholesale meat stall. Her husband has been having some kidney and back problems in recent years. Hence, she has been running the business by herself. Although she is a butcher now, she has a degree in pedagogy. In the future, she would like to make sure that her children receive a proper education and pursue their own professions, unlike her. She requests a loan to buy more wholesale meat for her inventory now, when the price of meat is at its lowest point of the year.

loans.use: To buy wholesale meat

loans.name: Almoudou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Almoudou Traoré a 44 ans, marié et père de 4 filles, il réside avec sa famille à Médine, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école, il s’est très vite initié à la couture auprès de son oncle à Sikasso. Son atelier est situé au grand marché de Sikasso et la plupart de sa clientèle est composée d’hommes et surtout les forains.
Avec sa grande expérience dans le domaine, il jouit d’une parfaite confiance de la famille des tailleurs ce qui lui a valu la présidence du Comité de Surveillance de l’Association des Tailleurs de Sikasso (A.T.S.). En plus de la couture, il achète des machines à coudre à Lomé (république de Togo) afin de les revendre aux tailleurs de Sikasso.
 Dans les souci de mieux satisfaire ses commandes de machines de plus en plus croissantes, il sollicita la collaboration de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et il est à son premier prêt individuel qui lui permettra d’acheter 10 machines à coudre.       
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui va lui permettre de résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses personnelles, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son atelier.
texts.en:
Mr. Almoudou Traoré, 44, is married and the father of 4 daughters. He lives with his family in Médine, one of the working class neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Not having had the opportunity to advance in school, he began at a young age to learn tailoring from his uncle in Sikasso. His workshop is located in the big open-air market of Sikasso and most of his clientele is composed of men and especially of itinerant merchants. With his vast experience in the activity, he has the total confidence of the guild of tailors which has earned him the presidency of the Tailors' Guild of Sikasso (Comité de Surveillance de l’Association des Tailleurs de Sikasso--A.T.S.) Besides tailoring, he buys sewing machines in Lomé (Republic of Togo) to re-sell them to the tailors of Sikasso.

With the desire to satisfy his ever-growing orders for sewing machines more fully, he came to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and he is on his first individual loan which will permit him to buy 10 sewing machines. With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 200,000 F CFA which will allow him to cover most of his personal expenses, contribute to family expenses, pay the interest on his loan, and invest any remainder into his workshop.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sewing machines for re-sale

loans.name: Abdukayum

texts.ru: Абдукаюм мужчина 31 года, работает механиком по ремонту автомашин.проживает в городе Костакоз. Кроме своей работы он имеет дополнительный доход с откорма и продажи скота.Также у него небольшой земельный участок с которого он получает урожай капусты и болгарского перца.Его жена занимается шитьём женских национальных платьев.Абдукаюм узнав , что можно в кредит увеличить бизнес животноводства, решил подать заявку.Сейчас у него две коровы и 8 баранов.
texts.en:
Abdukayum is a 31 year old man. He works as an auto mechanic and lives in Kostakoz. In addition to his job he earns additional income from fattening and selling livestock. He also has a small plot of land from which he gets a harvest of cabbage and Bulgarian peppers. His wife sews traditional women’s dresses. Abdukayum having found out that he could grow his livestock business via credit, decided to apply. Currently he has two cows and 8 sheep.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fattening and sale of livestock

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
L. Nguyen Thi is fifty-two years old and lives in the town of Hung Nguyen.  She is married and has five grown children. To make a living, L. owns and operates a manufacturing business.  The main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling bamboo products to local businesses and community members.  L. has been engaged in this business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $285 a month from these activities.

In 1998, L. joined the Kiva field partner, TYM Fund, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by giving her the ability to engage in business activities.  L. has successfully repaid previous loans from TYM Fund.  These previous loans were used to invest in developing the business.  L. is now requesting a new L. that will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings.  This will be her eleventh L. from TYM Fund.  L. plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to expand product offerings.

loans.name: Hoshim

texts.en:
Hoshim R. is 39 years old and the father of 4 children who are all attending the local school. His wife is a housekeeper. Hoshim owns a 0.5-hectare field for cultivating onions and tomatoes in order to earn a living. On this plantation, Hoshim now cannot do any planting because he does not have enough money for seeds and fertilizer. In order to deal with this problem, he decided to ask for a loan of $800 USD to buy the necessary substances. Hoshim counts on this opportunity to obtain a better yield, in order to improve the living conditions of his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Абдуллоева Матлюба женшина 48 лет.Замужем имеет 4-х детей. Матлюба занимается продажей моющих средств. Она торгует на рынке "Панчшанбе" 6 лет. Раньше у неё было небольшой магазин и торговала она батарейками, свечками и мылом. Первый кредит получив на расширение ассортимента. Благодаря очередному кредиту она имеет большой магазин и благодарит за подержу кива.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. Matluba A. is 48 years old, married, and has four children. She sells cleaning goods, and has been selling them at the "Panshanbe" market for the last six years. Before, she had a small store where she sold batteries, candles, and soaps. With her first loan, she diversified her stock and because of a subsequent loan, she has opened up a big store, and she is grateful to Kiva for their support.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: puchas of cleaning goods

loans.name: Chanphally

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanphally U., 30, and her husband, Mr. Vannak Soun, 39, were married in 1985 and have three children: one son and two daughters. One of the children attends school and other two are still young. The family lives along National Road Number One, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.

Chanphally and her husband have been selling gasoline for eight years. They buy some from a gasoline station about 3 kilometers from her village and some from the Khmer-Vietnam border, for resale in their village. The couple wants to build a new house in which to live, but they lack the money. So, Chanphally is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to help build a house.

loans.use: To build a new house for the family.

loans.name: Ogbonnaya

texts.en: Ogbonnaya is 42 years old. He is married with 4 children. He sells zobo drinks. Zobo is a locally made drink in Nigeria. He hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more zobo ingredients to make more zobo drinks to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more zobo ingredients

loans.name: Cagrielo Group

texts.en:
Arapha is a member of the Cagrielo borrower group,she is 38 years old woman,she married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 14,9 years,she also cares for other 2 dependents.

Arapha started her own cafe business selling food 5 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 250,000 Tsh.

This is Arapha`s fist loan from BRAC.She requested loan amount 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more rice,cooking oil for her business.

With the profit she gain from the use of this loan Arapha hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Yunith is another member of the same borrower group,she requested loan amount 300,000 Tsh to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice,cooking ol,sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: stock up

loans.name: Dally

texts.en:
“Be thrifty; use money wisely." This is one of Dally S.'s life rules. She is from the village of Lawig, Lamut, Ifugao. Due to the difficulties of life, she and her husband, Antonio, try their best to minimize their expenses. This way, they can save for the future of their two children, April Dianne, 13, and Elton Jan, 7. April Dianne is now in her second year of high school, while Elton Jan attends elementary school. Dally and Antonio want their children to become successful, no matter what they choose to do.

Antonio works as an Overseas Filipino Worker, or OFW, in Saudi Arabia, while Dally works as a motorcycle operator. Drivers rent her motorcycle and use it to transport goods. Dally is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to 5,000 Philippine pesos (or about $125 US) to be used for the maintenance of her motorcycle.  She hopes that someday, her family can better their place in life.

loans.use: Motorcycle repairs

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza B. is from the village of Binuangan. She is 36 years old. Liza is married.

To make a living, Liza owns & operates a dried fish vending store, selling dried fish in the local community. Liza has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Liza joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liza has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC.

Liza is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Rex

texts.en:
Rex R. is a 32 year old farmer from Norala, South Cotabato.  He started managing his 1 hectare rice field in 2004.  On May 2009, he joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. because of its good program.  It helped him finance his business with a low interest rate.

Now he is requesting a loan of Php 8,000 to buy farm inputs (fertilizers, etc.), payment for a hand tractor, and labor.  This will help him to not delay the application of farm inputs on his farm.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Valens

texts.en:
M. Valens is 32 years old, single, and he is the president of a group called Dukore, that has been in business since 2006. They have a small shop selling a variety of goods such as foodstuffs and some drinks. This business is open from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day.

This group is requesting their first loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders in order to expand their business as well as to get enough profit, which, in turn will help them to buy their own houses and save for their future.

loans.use: To buy a variety of foodstuffs and drinks for sale

loans.name: Loretta

texts.en: Loretta C. F. is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Moamoa. She is married and has two infant children. Loretta owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 700 WST a month. In 2008, Loretta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Loretta is now requesting a new loan of 1,500 WST which will again be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 2nd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza H. is from the town of Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Liza has a sari-sari (general) store from which she sells daily use products such as rice, shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc. in the local community. She has been in business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (about $128 US) a month for these activities.

In 2008, Liza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Liza from PMPC; she has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 pesos. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Liza is requesting a new loan of 14,900 pesos which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase inventory & as working capital

loans.name: Yulia

texts.en:
Yulia is married with one child. She rents some space at a department store in Novomoskovsk town and sells men's clothing, jeans, hats, etc. Her profit is about 4,000 UAH per month.

Yulia started this business 12 years ago. During this time her business has become a stable source of income for her family. Yulia is an active, hardworking, and entrepreneurial person. She is always looking for something new and fresh to satisfy customer demand. Yulia lives with her husband and son in a small apartment.

Yulia would like to borrow 16,400 UAH to increase the assortment of her inventories. She hopes to receive additional profits and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en: Tungalag is 41 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Zavhan province in western Mongolia. She and her family live in a traditional Mongolian housing tent called a "ger." Her eldest daughter, Altanhuu, is in university and her younger two sons go to a local secondary school. Her husband operates a firewood trading business to supplement their earnings. She currently operates a shoe making business in her town. She produces a variety of traditional Mongolian shoes. Her products are very popular among their many customers due to their good quality and unique style. Tungalag started her business in 2000 after working as a shoe maker in a state factory for several years. Her products display traditional Mongolian customs that are popular with the people of this province. Tungalag is focused on the future and has many new ideas for her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She says, "All I want is to save enough money for my children's education." Tungalag is requesting a 1,000,000-tugrug loan to purchase fabrics and raw materials for her shoe making business.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and raw materials

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 30 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y su hija de quince dias de nacida en casa de sus suegros, ubicada en el caserio Quemazón, ditrito de Mórrope, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Usualmente trabaja como obrero agrícola, pero debido a que esta actividad no le ofrece la estabilidad que necesita instaló, hace un año, una pequeña bodega en casa de sus suegros, allí el vende abarrotes y diversos productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azucar. Aceite). Este negocio es de mucha utilidad para sus vecinos ya que no existen bodegas por la zona, y el pueblo mas cercano está a quince minutos de distancia.

Para atender la gran demenada por los productos que ofrece, Pedro se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compra de más productos y asi ampliar su negocio.

El es un joven muy conocido y estimado por sus vecinos y conocidos, los cuales lo consideran una persona responsable. Su más grande anhelo es darle a su hija una adecuada calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pedro is 30, married, and lives with his wife and two-week-old daughter in his in-laws' house. It is located in the town of Quemazón, in the district of Mórrope, one hour from the city of Chiclaylo. He usually works in agriculture, but because it doesn't offer him the stability that he needs, he set up a small grocery store in his in-laws' house a year ago. He sells groceries and various basic goods like rice, sugar, and oil. This business is very useful for his neighbors because there aren't any other grocery stores in the area. The closest town is 15 minutes away. In order to handle the great demand for his products, Pedro saw it necessary to request his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN so he can invest in the purchase of more products and expand his business. He is well-known and loved by his neighbors and other people who know him. They consider him to be a responsible person. His biggest wish is to give his daughter a good quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries and other basic goods to expand his business

loans.name: Predislindo

texts.es:
Predeslindo, de 47 años, es un hombre feliz y con muchas ganas de progresar. Vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposa Virginia (46) y sus 3 jóvenes hijos; Jessica (27), Gisela (23) y Joani (17).
De muy joven aprendió a fabricar muebles, al principio miraba a los maestros en los talleres y así pudo captar muy bien la técnica. Han pasado 20 años desde entonces y este oficio le genera muy buenas ganancias económicas, ya que por su experiencia tiene clientes que lo recomiendan con otras personas, pues las sillas, sillones, mesas y armarios que fabrica son muy buenos y resistentes.
Predeslindo está muy satisfecho porque ha podido salir adelante desempeñándose en un trabajo que le apasiona y donde trabaja solo, en la tranquilidad de su taller.
Como es un hombre de mucha proyección, tiene pensado para el futuro ampliar su negocio y contratar ayudantes para poder atender mayor cantidad de pedidos.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y está seguro que cumplirá puntualmente con el pago de cada una de sus cuotas, ya que quiere salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Para ello, tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de tubos, pintura, madera y demás materiales para lograr culminar con los pedidos de muebles que tiene.
texts.en:
Predislindo, 47 years of age, is a happy man and is eager to get ahead in life. He lives in his own house in company of her wife Virginia (46) and three young children: Jessica (27), Gisela (23) and Joani (17). From a young age, he learned to make furniture; in the beginning he would observe the master craftsmen in the workshops and was able to learn the technique very well. It has been 20 years now and this trade generates good profits for him; because of his experience, his customers recommend him to other customers, since his chairs, sofas, tables and armoires are of good quality and strong. Predislindo is satisfied because he has been able to get ahead working in a trade that he is passionate about and where he works by himself, in the peace and quiet of his workshop. Since he is a man that is always planning ahead, he plans to expand his business and hire assistants to fulfill a higher quantity of orders. This is his first loan with MFP and he is sure he will make his payments on time, since he wants to get ahead by working hard. For this purpose, he plans to invest his loan in buying tubes (metal furniture), paint, wood, and other materials in order to fulfill the furniture orders he has now.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials

loans.name: Miraluna

texts.en:
Miraluna B. is from the village of Cabu-an, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 31 years old. Miraluna is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Miraluna owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Miraluna has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Miraluna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Miraluna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Miraluna is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Miraluna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Beug Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Beug Fallou sollicite un prêt de 300 000 FCFA. En fait Beug Fallou est une expression wolof (la langue nationale au Sénégal)  qui signifie « Fans de Serigne Fallou » un grand marabout de la confrérie mouride (une confrérie musulmane fondée par Cheikh Ahmadou Bamba). C’est un groupement composé de 4 femmes avec comme présidente Madame Astou S.. 
Madame Astou S.  est âgé de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants qui ont 17 ans et 3 ans. Elle est commerçante et gère une table de légumes et divers produits alimentaires au marché de Notto, une communauté rurale située dans le département  de Thiès. Elle est dans ce métier depuis 1995  sous l’influence de quelques de ses voisines qui s’activait dans de petits commerce au niveau du marché. Avec cette activité, Madame Astou S. pense qu’elle a gagné beaucoup de connaissances au niveau de sa localité Gouye Diama  sise à quelques dizaines de kilomètres de Notto. Sa part du crédit va lui permettre d’acheter des poissons fumés, séchés et autres. Ainsi, elle pourra avec ses profits renforcer sa boutique d’alimentation  que sa fille gère à la maison.
Pour les autres membres du groupement en l’occurrence Madame Dior G., Madame Ndack N. et Madame Seynabou W., elles comptent avec leur part  comme Madame Astou S. équiper leurs tables respectives en produits car elles vendent les mêmes produits que la présidente au marché de Notto.
texts.en:
Beug Fallou is requesting a loan of 300 000 FCFA. Infact, Beug Fallou is an expression in wolof ( the national language of Senegal) which means "Fans of Serigne Fallou" a great marabout of the mouride brotherhood ( a muslim brotherhood founded by Cheikh Ahmadou Bamba). It is a group made up of 4 women with Madam Astou S. as president. Madam Astou S. is 39 years old, married and the mother of 2 children who are 17 and 3 years of age. She is a trader and runs a vegetables business on a table and various food products in the Notto market, a rural community located in the district of Thies. She's been in this business since 1995 under the influence of some of her neighbors who were into petty trading in the market. With this business, Madam Astou S. thinks that she has gained much knowledge in terms of her Gouye Diama locality situated about some 12 kilometers of Notto. Her part of the loan will enable her to buy some smoked, dried fish and other items. Thus, she will be able, with this profit, to strengthen her food shop that her daughter runs in the house. For the other members of the group, specically Madam Dior Gueye, Madam Ndack N., and Madam Seynabou W., they intend to stock their respectives tables with products with their part of the loan like Madam Astou S.,since they sell the same products as the president in the Notto market.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply products for sale

loans.name: Laumua

texts.en:
Laumua F. is 46 and married with 5 children.  She owns a business venture, selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Laumua has 3 years of experience in this business.  Laumua needs a loan of WST $1750 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 800 talas or US $333 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Laumua joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Laumua's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Laumua F. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.7 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Esmeraldas Yasmin

texts.es:
La señora Esmeraldas forma parte del Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúnen en la ciudad de Montecristi en la Provincia de Manabí en la costa de Ecuador, esta ciudad es reconocida por sus grandes artesanos que elaboran a mano muebles y sombreros en paja toquilla al igual que los detalles mas finos en tagua.

Al visitar el Banco Camino Al Progreso conversamos con la señora Esmeraldas de 41 años de edad esta casada lleva 37 ciclos en el banco, se dedica a la compra y venta de mariscos, para abastecer el negocio tiene que viajara hasta el puerto de Manta a unos 20 minutos de su ciudad natal, junto al esposo han sabido mantener el negocio, el es el encargado de hacer las compras en la pangas  en la madrugada dos veces por semana y en ocasiones cuando tiene mas pedidos y el pescado esta mas barato tiene que hacer algunas ventas y viajar hasta la ciudad de Quito a entregar a los clientes, cuenta la señora Esperanza que por esta época de semana santa el difícil conseguir a buen precio el pescado, es cuando mas caro está y no resulta porque no queda ganancias.

Nuestra socia Esperanza con este nuevo crédito invertirá todo en tiras de pescados, esta segura que se venderá todo aunque les quede poca ganancias lo importante  es no dejar el negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Esmeraldas is a member of the communal bank "Camino Al Progreso." They meet in the city of Montecristi in the Manabí province on the cost of Ecuador. This city is known for its great artisans who make furniture by hand and Panama hats as well as the finest details in tagua (a nut). When we visited the communal bank "Al Progreso" we spoke with Señora Esmeraldas. She is 41-years-old, married, and has been with the bank for 37 cycles. She buys and sells shell fish for a living. To stock her business, she has to travel to the port in Manta which is twenty minutes from the city of her birth. She and her husband have learned how to keep the business going. He is in charge of buying in the catfish early in the mornings, two times a week. And now and again, when has more orders, and the fish is cheaper, he has to make some sales and travels to the Quito to supply his customers. Mrs. Esmeralda tells us that during Easter week it's hard to get a good price on fish; it's when it's most expensive and isn't worth it because they don't make a profit. Our member, Esmeralda, will invest this entire loan in fish. She is sure that she will sell all of it even if she doesn't make much. The most important thing is to not let the business go.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish.

loans.name: Thav

texts.en: Thav T., 38, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Sa ang District, Cambodia, an area known for sugarcane plantations. She sells dried fish for an income of about $8 US per day. Her husband is construction worker, earning an income of $5 US per day to help cover the family expenses.  T. is requesting a loan of $500 US to buy more fish for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to send the children to a good school.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Ourch

texts.en: Ourch Y., 54, is a widow and resides with her husband and three children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known as the most populated city in the country. She is a tailor and earns an income of about USD 5 per day. One of her children is a bartender, earning an income of USD 4 per day to help cover the family expenses.  Ourch is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase supplements to run a food shop in front of her house. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy supplements to run a food shop

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe P. is from the village of pangabuan. She is 44 years old and married with four school-aged children. Fe owns a store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Fe from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La Señora Ana A. es docente jubilada  actualmente; cuenta con un negocio que se dedica a la venta de bebidas en general y otros productos de almacén y viendo la demanda de clientes también posee maxicarga y minicarga para teléfonos celulares. Cuenta con un negocio bien surtido y con una antigüedad de 5 años.

Actualmente estudia y está por terminar su tesis para ser Licenciada en Ciencias de la Educación. 
  

Con el crèdito  obtenido comprarà gaseosas  y cerveza  para  su almacèn
texts.en:
Sra. Ana A. is currently a retired school teacher. She has a business where she sells beverages and other grocery products. Seeing that there is demand among her customers, she also sells electronic loads for mobile phones in various denominations. Ana keeps her business well-stocked and has been in operation for five years.

She is currently studying and finishing her thesis so that she can earn a degree in Education.

This loan will be used to buy sodas and beer for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas & beer

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.fr:
Mère de 5 enfants, la plus âgée a 33ans et la plus pétite a 19ans, eelle a 6 pétits enfants. Commencée dans ce commerce depuis 1982, avec un capital de 40000f, elle vendait les sucettes glacées, les yahoourts et l'eau glacée en sachets.
 
Elle a niveau universitaire et enseignante de formation, elle se consacre a sa petite boutique q'elle a ouverte voilà 2mois.En dehors de quelques difficultés comme la rareté des produits et l'inflation des prix 
pendant les achats, elle est située dans une zone ou elle est seule a exercer cette activité.
 elle mise sur les produits éssentielles de consommation quotidiennes tels que sardines, pains, beurres, cafés, thé, chocolats, fromages,friandises, sodas sucrés, lots d'enveloppes,cahiers, stylos, crayons, paquets de sucres, boites de lait..... Par jour elle a une recette de 40000f et plus si elle a l'éssentielle des produits. Avec le prêt , elle veut atteindre son but en achétant: 2 cartons de sadines, des sachets des bonbons,2cartons des spaghettis, 1cartons de coneed beefs, 1 cartons de fromages, 1carton des pétites bouteilles d'huiles et de vinaigres et d'autres articles nécéssaires. 
 
Ces enfants sont grands et se débrouillent bien, une fille, la dernière est dans une école socio-sanitaire pour sortir assistante sanitaire. Si son activité prospère, elle veut construire une maison avec boutique pour ses enfants et soutenir sa fille à être une bonne infirmière et continuer avec HOPE pour toujours
texts.en:
Gertrude M. is a mother of five children, the oldest 33 years and the youngest 19 years old; she has six grandchildren. She went into business in 1982, with a sum of 40,000f, selling lollipops, yogurts, and ice water in packets. She has a university education and trained as a teacher, and has devoted herself to the small store she opened two months ago. Besides some difficulties such as the rarity of products and price inflation when purchasing, she is situated in an area where she is the only one in the business. She focuses on essential everyday consumible items like sardines, bread, butter, coffee, tea, chocolate, cheese, snacks, sodas, envelopes, notebooks, pens, pencils, packets of sugar, canned milk…. She has daily receipts of 40,000f and more if she has enough essential products. With the loan, she would like to reach her goal by buying: 2 cartons of sardines, sacks of candy, 2 cartons of spaghetti, 1 carton of corned beef, 1 carton of cheese, 1 carton of small bottles of oils and vinegars, and other necessary items. Her children are older and are doing well. One daughter, the youngest, is in a social-medical school to become a medical assistant. If her business succeeds, she wants to build a house with a store for her children, support her daughter in her nursing pursuits, and continue with HOPE.

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cartons of sardines, spaghetti, cheese, sacks of candy, packets of biscuits, butter, sausages, coffee, tea, chocolate.

loans.name: Ing

texts.en:
Ing N., 33, is married and lives with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She works at a local garment factory for an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband, who appears in the photograph, is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 4 per day.

N. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support her children’s study. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To enable her husband to buy a new motorbike for his business

loans.name: Roel

texts.en:
Mr. Roel B. is from the barangay of Labuyo in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. He is 30 years old and single. To make a living, he is engaged in direct selling of food supplements and other synthetic medicines. He is also an insurance underwriter and collector. He’s been in this business for 2 years and earns approximately PHP 5,000 a month through these activities. 

In 2009, Roel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roel has successfully repaid a loan amount of PHP 15,000 and is now requesting his third loan, for PHP 25,000, to purchase a side car for his motorcycle. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to better meet the basic needs of his family, to save for the future, make loan repayments, purchase insurance, and perhaps make business expansions. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a sidecar for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Elchin

texts.ru:
Elchin M. 39 let. Elchin Jenat i imeyet odnovo sina ktoromu 10 let on uchitsya v shkole i zanimayetsya sportom. Elchin yavlyayetsya IDP personom , on pereselenec iz Fuzuli, Seychas on projivayet v Fuzuli regione  derevnya Ahmedbeyli.

Elchin uje 7 let rabotayet taksistom. Etomu biznesu on nauchilsya u starsheqo brata i nachal on bizness po eqo sovetu, no v toje vremya on ochen polubit etu rabotu. Elchin seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chto bi kupit zapchasti dlya eqo taksi kotoriy isportilsya.
texts.en:
Elchin M. is 39 years old. Elchin is married and has a ten-year-old son who goes to school and plays sports. Elchin is an IDP (internally displaced person); he is a refugee from Fuzuli. Currently, he lives in the Fuzuli region in the village of Ahmedbeyli. Elchin has been driving a taxi for seven years. His older brother taught him the business and he began it with his brother’s advice. At the same time, he truly loves his work. Elchin currently needs 2000 AZN to buy parts to repair his taxi.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying car parts

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna B. is from the village of Calaran, Calamba. She is 59 years old and married with four adult children. To make a living, Lorna raises crops such as rice and vegetables to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. 

In 2002, Lorna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 45,000 PHP from PMPC which was used for personal purposes and is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP to be used for rice production. This will be the eleventh loan taken out by Lorna from PMPC. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for rice production

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Marjurie Antonia

texts.es: MARJURIE ANTONIA M. M.,Trabaja como Cajera Commema  en el Mercado Oriental de Managua es madre soltera de dos hijos y estos se encuentra en edad escolar ha trabajado tres creditos con ceprodel y estos han sido para el mejoramienrto de su vivienda.
texts.en: Marjurie Antonia Martin M. works as cashier at the commercial market Mercado Oriental in Managua. She is a single mother of two children of school age. She has been granted three loans by Ceprodel, and they have all been used to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: To improve the conditions of her house by changing the electrical wiring.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita G., age 63, offers motorcycle transportation services. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. She and her husband have four grown children and live in the village of Gata Daku Clarin, Misamis Occidental.
  
In 2004, Teresita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the seventeenth loan taken out by Teresita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret N. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala south region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Margret owns a cosmetic shop business, which she has had for one year.         

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase lotions and braids.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Margret hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Margret hopes to own a salon.   Margret is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by being cooperative with each other.

loans.use: to open another business

loans.name: Gualberta

texts.en:
Gualberta M., age 41, operates a specialized retail store where she sells dried fish to members of the local community. Gualberta has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 5,400 PHP a month. She and her husband live in the village of Cebunig, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. They have six school-aged children. 

In 2008, Gualberta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Gualberta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Gualberta is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Gualberta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her dried fish vending business

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar V. lives in Yerevan with her son, whom she brought up by herself. For more than 10 years Gohar worked in a shoe shop as a salesperson, and for about 14 years Gohar has run her own clothes trading business in different markets. Now, Gohar is renting a trading stall in the biggest Yerevan clothes market, where she manages her business.
 
Gohar sells only men’s clothes, and she says it is a correct choice, because the majority of offered merchandise in Armenian markets is women’s clothes, so she has a lot of regular customers. Once a month she imports clothes from neighboring countries to resell. 

For a long time Gohar has solved her family’s needs and paid for her son's education thanks to her business income. Owing to this education, now Gohar’s son has a job and he shares the family’s expenses with his mother.

Gohar seeks a loan of $3,000 to buy winter assortment of sweaters, blazers, sweatshirts, jackets, etc. for her shop.

loans.use: To buy winter assortment of sweaters, blazers, sweatshirts, jackets, etc. for her shop

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel M. is from Maquilao Tangub City. She is 33 years old. Ritchel is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Ritchel owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling rice in the local community. Ritchel has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Ritchel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ritchel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Ritchel is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Ritchel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase rice to sell

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine owns a business that sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, soaps and salt. She is 44 years old, married and has seven children who are between six and eighteen years old and three other dependents. All of them attend school. Her husband has no defined job. 

Justine has been selling rice, sugar, cooking oil, soaps, and salt for 16 years. Her loan will be used to buy more of these items to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house for her store, as she is tired of renting and she wishes to own a permanent site for her business. This is her plan for the future.

loans.use: To buy more home products to sell.

loans.name: Drissa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Drissa Konaté  est  âgé de 35 ans et vit dans une famille la grande famille traditionnelle  avec ses épouses, ses quatre enfants à N’godiarala,  un des villages de la Sous-préfecture de Fakola, Préfecture de Kolondièba, troisième région (Sikasso) de la république du  Mali. 
Pour mieux alléger sa pauvreté, Monsieur Konaté  adhéra au programme de prêt individuel de stockage et commercialisation de céréales de Soro Yiriwaso. Il  est à son cinquième prêt. Tous les quatre prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans aucune difficulté.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, il compte acheter,  400  kilogrammes de grains de fonio, 10.000  kilogrammes de maïs et 200 kilogrammes de mil qu’il stockera pour revendre en un moment où le prix sera plus intéressant. Il s’approvisionne dans  les  villages environnants et envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  50. 000  F CFA.
texts.en: Mr. Drissa Konaté is 35 years old and lives in a large traditional family with his spouses and his four children in N’godiarala, a village in the sub-prefecture of Fakola, prefecture of Kolondièba, in the 3rd administrative region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali. To alleviate his poverty further, Mr. Konaté joined the individual loan program at Soro Yiriwaso for stocking and marketing grains. He is on his fifth loan. The four previous ones have all been repaid without any problems at all. With this new loan, he intends to buy 400 kg of fonio seeds; 10,000 kg of corn; and 200 kg of millet that will be stocked up for resale when prices are better. He gets his supplies in surrounding villages and envisions making an average monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA.

loans.use: Buying grains

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish

loans.name: At's Group

texts.en: This group loan includes six people who are living in the village of Prey Kray in Takeo province. With their portions of the loan they will each improve their families' standard of living. The group is led by Mr. At O.. Mr. At O. is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land where he grows rice to sell to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Choem Born, is a seamstress in a garment factory. Through these activities, they support four children, two of whom are employed in garment factories; the others are attending local public schools. Mr. At O. wants to breed some pigs, but he does not have enough money to start the business. So Mr. At O. is requesting a loan to by some piglets and pig food to start this new business.

loans.use: To by some piglets and pig food for breeding to start a new business.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Sim S., age 38, earns a living as a fish catcher in Siem Reap province. Sim S. and her husband have been spending time fishing in and around Tunle Sap River for over ten years. They have five school-aged children. Because her income is just enough for the family’s daily expenses, her house is frequently cracking during the heavy rainy season. To solve this problem, she is requesting a loan of $200 to repair her old house.

loans.use: To repair her old house

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en: Eugene is 26 years old, and he is single. He sells phone accessories, lotions and perfumes, and he has operated this business for five years. He has been able to afford to buy his own house because of this business. He is requesting a loan in order to reinvest in his business and will reinvest the profits he hopes to make.

loans.use: Reinvesting in his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, oil, rice, toilet paper, flour, coffee, evaporated milk, and pasta to develop her business

loans.name: Mehdi

texts.ar: مهدي في عمر 52 سنة يعمل في بيع الخضار والفواكه له في عمله 7 سنوات متزوج وله 5 اولاد له تاريخ قديم مع المجموعة وقد كان يلقى الدعم الكامل من العائلةله زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه يسعى الى تحسين وضعه المادي والاجتماعي وتعليم اولاده بشكل جيد فهم كل اهتمامه ولكن ما ينقصه هو المادة الى تحسين وضعه يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء خضار وفواكه وزيادة أصناف جديدة له خبرة كبيرة في عمله وهو نشيط ويتميز بالنظافة والدقة في العمل
texts.en: Mehdi is 52 years old and makes a living by selling fruits and vegetables. He has seven years of experience in this business. He is married and has five kids. His a long history with al-Majmoua, and his family supported him during his last loan from al-Majmoua. He has customers from his community and from among his neighbors. He is trying to improve his material circumstances and social status. Additionally, he is trying to give his children a good education, as they are his number one concern in life. However, he lacks the resources needed to improve his and his family's living situation. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell, including new kinds of fruits and vegetables. He has a lot of experience in his work, and he is a hard-working individual. Not only that, but he stands out in his line of work due to the cleanliness of his store and his attention to detail.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for his fruit and vegetable business, as well as to increase the variety of fruits and vegetables available in his store.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 35 años, es una dichosa mujer que convive desde hace 15 años con Edwin, con quien tiene 3 hijos menores, a los que quiere mucho y educa en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Villa Visca. El trabajo al que se dedica desde muy joven es la agricultura. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, habas y arveja, los cuales siembra con ayuda de su esposo, quien además se dirige todas las mañanas al caserío de Tiambra; donde tiene pequeños sembríos. “Necesito sembrar en diferentes tierras para obtener sembríos de buena calidad”, afirma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son las temporadas de lluvia, pues no necesita regar sus cultivos. Más le disgusta las plagas que llegan con esa época del año. Su principal inconveniente es la falta de capital de trabajo, ya que necesita fertilizar constantemente sus cultivos. Pero está segura que con la ayuda de su banco comunal que le motiva a ahorrar, muy pronto obtendrá el dinero necesario para comprar varias cabezas de carneros, con los que está pensando incursionar en la venta de carne. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Visca”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada. Ana, invertirá el dinero del crédito en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico, que esparcirá en sus sembríos de papa.
texts.en:
Ana, age 35, is a cheerful woman who have lived with her partner, Edwin, for 15 years.  They have three minor children whom they love and educate in their own home located in the rural area called Villa Visca.  She has worked in agricultural since she was very young.  Her main crops are potatoes, lima beans and peas, which she plants with the help of her husband, who also takes care of the Tiambra rural area every morning, where they have a small patch of cropland.

"I have to plant crops in different areas of land in order to get good quality.", she claims.  What she enjoys most about her work is the rainy season since she does not have to water her fields then.  What she dislikes are the plagues that arrive every year in that season.  Her main difficulty is the lack of working capital which she needs to constantly fertilize her crops.  But she is confident that with the help of the communal bank, which motivates her to save, soon she will have enough money to buy several head of sheep and can begin thinking about going into meat sales.

She belongs to the "Villa Visca" communal bank and this is her first loan through MFP.  She is grateful for the support and opportunity she is receiving.  Ana plans to use the loan to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer which she will use on her potato crop.

loans.use: To buy several sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Sotogbé

texts.fr: Revendeuse de divers produits (marmites, bassines, plats,…….) depuis 1996  et mariée à un maçon, Mme Sotogbé a 42 ans et mère de 05 enfants. Elle s’approvisionne de temps en temps au grand marché de Lomé et revend à domicile à toutes les couches sociales. Avec ce second crédit elle veut sortir son activité de la maison  pour se faire connaître de la population et  accroître son commerce.
texts.en: Selling various items (pots, bowls, platters, etc.) since 1996 and married to a mason, Mrs. Sotogbé is 42 and the mother of five children. She buys her wares from time to time at the Grand Market of Lomé and sells the items out of her house, to people from all walks of life. With this second loan, she wants to bring her business out of her house so as to become known in the neighborhood and expand her little enterprise.

loans.use: to buy bowls and other household items.

loans.name: Zenzele Group

texts.en:
Sithembile is a 33-year-old single woman. She has 2 children, 4 and 9 years old. In the photo, she is pictured raising her right hand. 

Sithembile runs a clothing business in Kwa Zulu Natal of Empangeni, in South Africa. She explains that she has been in this business for two years. Her main business challenge is dealing with customers who do not want to pay on time after they purchase clothes on credit. In addition, she does not have a proper shelter from which to sell her goods. She also receives income from the government's child support grant.

Sithembile requested this loan through Women’s Development Businesses (WDB) and Kiva to buy clothes for resale. She says that the loan will help her generate profit and improve life for her and her children. She will use the extra income to help take care of her family. In the future, she sees her business growing. She thanks WDB and Kiva because their loan interest is much less than loan sharks (mashonisa).

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Wilfredo Rene

texts.es: El señor Wilfredo, es cliente antiguo de emprender, y también sacó varios créditos "kiva", debido a su actividad que es la reparación de vehículos el saca montos relativamente pequeños, en esta ocasión solicita para compra de material de construcción y especialmente para compra de calaminas para el techado de su casa propia, ya que por el momento él vive en el taller del cual paga alquiler, pero en el transcurso de estos años se compro un terreno en el que construye su vivienda, juntamente con su esposa, quien se dedica a la venta de lubricantes y apoya a su esposo, ellos tienen dos hijas quienes se encuentran estudiando en colegio de la zona, el señor Wilfredo es cliente responsable haciendo buen uso de los créditos solicitados, es muy trabajador y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is an old client of Emprender, and has also had several loans through Kiva.  Because his business is auto repair, he generates relatively small amounts.  

On this occasion, he requests funds to buy construction materials, especially corrugated iron for the roof of his house.  For the moment, he lives in his workshop, which is rented.  However, over the past few years, he purchased land where he is building his house along with his wife, who sells lubricants and supports her husband in his endeavors.  

They have two daughters who are studying in the area school.  Wilfredo is a responsible client who has made good use of the requested credits.  He is very hard working, and thankful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: buy construction materials.

loans.name: Gorgonia

texts.en:
Gorgonia is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has nine children.
 
Gorgonia has a shop that sells home-made ice cream in different flavors. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy raw ingredients for her ice cream.

Gorgonia has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Gorgonia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for home-made ice cream.

loans.name: Elizabeth Del Carmen

texts.es: Elizabeth, una mujer de 45 años de edad, con tres hijos de 17, 19 y 21 años respectivamente,madre soltera, originaria de Condega municipio de Esteli, de oficio comerciante. Fue criada por una señora que vivía en la Costa Atlántica, la cual le enseñó a trabajar y valerse por si misma. Doña Elizabeth tiene su negocio de venta de comida en el parque municipal de Condega, lo cual ha solicitado su préstamo para invetir en su negocio como es la compra de verduras, carnes, entre otros productos perecederos. En un futuro ella quiere tener un kiosko con el cual pueda ofrecer una mejor condiciones de infraestructura  a sus clientes y ampliarlo un poco más, para que le genere más ingresos y sacar adelante a sus tres hijos.
texts.en: Elizabeth is a 45 year-old woman with three children aged 17, 19 and 21.  She is a single mother who is a native of the municipality of Condega in Esteli province.  She was a maid for a woman who lived on the Atlantic coast, who taught her to work and stand on her own two feet.  Elizabeth has a business selling food in the municipal park of Condega.  She is requesting a loan to invest in her business so that she can buy vegetables, meat and other food supplies.  In the future she wants to have a kiosk where she can have a better facility for her customers and expand her business a bit more.  This way she could have more income and get ahead with her three children.

loans.use: to buy meat and vegetables

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Narcisa has a retail shop that sells coconuts for copra (the dried meat or kernel of the coconut). She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy coconuts to sell.

Narcisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts to sell

loans.name: Fidel Antonio

texts.es:
Fidel, se dedica a la siembra de pipián y maíz, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, él trabaja la agricultura desde hace 10 años, esta labor la aprendió en su hogar junto a su padre, en la actualidad le sirve para tener el sustento familiar.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono para la plantación de pipianes y para el maíz, pues está en época de fertilizar para que puedan dar una buena cosecha.
El propósito de Fidel es tener buenas cosechas y mejorarlas cada año, para que de esta manera también mejoren los ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Fidel plants pipian [a squash] and corn. He lives with his wife and 2 children. He has worked in agriculture for 10 years and learned the trade at home from his father. This currently serves as his family's livelihood.

He asks for a loan to buy compost for his pipian and squash plantations, since this is the season to fertilize in order to get a good harvest.

Fidel proposes to have good harvests and improve them each year so that he can also improve his family's earnings.

loans.use: to buy compost for the corn and squash plantations.

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es: La señora Verónica tiene un puesto de comida y se dedica a la venta de almuerzos; su esposo es empleado público. Con ambos ingresos logran mantener  a su familia. Verónica necesita el préstamo para comprar papa, arroz, aceite y verduras al por mayor para cocinar sus almuerzos y al mismo tiempo reducir costos. Es casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en alquiler ubicada en la zona  San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz. Esta es la cuarta vez que su crédito se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Verónica has a food stall where she sells breakfast. Her husband is a public employee. Both of these jobs provide income by which they can support their family. Verónica needs a loan to buy potatoes, rice, oil, and vegetables in bulk so that she can prepare breakfast meals and reduce her costs at the same time. She is married, has three children, and lives in a rental property located in the District of San Martín in the city of La Paz.

This is the fourth time that her loan has been referred to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, rice, oil, and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Phum

texts.en:
Mrs. Phum is a 42 year old married woman who currently lives in Kompong Speu Province. She is married with five children. Four of her children are single and one is married. Three of her children are employed in a variety of jobs making profit. 

Mrs. Phum works as a local farmer. She always grows rice crops and a few kinds of vegetables, and typically earns $2 USD per day. Mrs. Phum would like to request a loan from HKL and Kiva in order to purchase fertilizers and to buy some hogs for breeding. 

Mrs. Phum hopes that with the increase in income she will be able to expand her old house, to support her children with a high level of education, and to enlarge her crop-planting business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and buy some hogs for breeding.

loans.name: Saul Humberto

texts.es:
Saúl, está soltero, vive con padres, trabaja todos los días reparando e instalando llantas, porque administra una llantería, su horario de atención es de 7:00am a 5:00pm, además tiene un taller de estructuras metálicas.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de llantas usadas, para el negocio, esto le mejorara el negocio, teniendo la capacidad para atender la demanda.
El sueño de Saúl es terminar la construcción de su vivienda y el local del negocio.
texts.en:
Saúl is single and lives with his parents. He runs a tire shop where he works every day fixing and installing tire from 7AM to 5PM. He also has a metal shop. 

Saúl is currently seeking a loan to buy used tires, which will improve the business by allowing him to meet demand. Saúl's goal is to finish construction on his house and shop.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Pearly

texts.en:
Pearly is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 
Pearly has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell in her store.
Pearly is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Pearly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Cipriano

texts.en:
Cipriano is a married man who is blessed with four children, all of whom attend school. For the last nineteen years, he has been quarrying to make a living. He also farms to increase his income. 

In the next five years, he wants to become the supplier of vegetables and building stones in his region. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy insecticides and fertilizer. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to embrace the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy insecticides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Blanca Adriana

texts.es: Blanca Adriana tiene 43 años, su actividad es la venta de comercios. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio. Inicio con fondos propios ya que tiene bajo su cargo a 3 hijos menores de edad. Ella ofrece sus productos de manera ambulante y en su vivienda ya que algunos clientes conocen la amplia variedad de productos que ofrece. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de polvos, cremas, tratamientos, pintura de uñas, pintura de labios, tratamiento y otros mas.
texts.en: 43 year old Blanca Adriana sells goods. She has had her business for more than 5 years. She began with her own funds as she had three young children in her care. She sells her goods door to door and from her home and her clients know the wide variety of products that she offers. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy powders, creams, treatments, nail polish, lipstick, and other things.

loans.use: to buy powders, creams, treatments, nail polish, lipstick, and other things.

loans.name: Geronedes

texts.en:
Geronedes is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Geronedes has a shop that sells bananas and coconuts. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy coconuts and bananas to sell.

Geronedes has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Geronedes hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en: Valentina is widowed. She has a retail business selling men's clothing at the Yulana market in Pavlograd town. She has been in this business for 3 years  only. Valentina has plans to develop her business and sell shoes along with clothing. She offers great client service and attracts clients with her prices and the good location of her kiosk. Valentina would like to borrow 6,000 Ukrainian grivna to purchase men's sweaters.

loans.use: to purchase men's sweaters.

loans.name: Adelma

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra: Adelma; La socia tiene 65 años de edad, la socia es casada; La socia tiene 2 hijos ; La socia sigue siendo docente del nivel secundario,la socia tambien se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa,ella vende ropa para niños,la socia vende polos,chompas y pantalones,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa y mejorar en su trabajo como docente en el nivel secundario . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa para como polos,chompas y pantalones al por mayor.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: This member is Adelma. She is 65 years old and married with two children. The member is still a high school teacher and also sells children's clothing such as polo shirts, sweaters and pants. She works from 8a.m. to 6p.m. and through her business she gets her children ahead. The member wants to expand her clothing sales business and to make progress in her work as a high school teacher. She requests the loan in order to purchase clothing such as polo shirts, sweaters and pants by wholesale. The member is glad to get the loan and promises to make her repayments on schedule.

loans.use: to purchase clothing such as polo shirts, sweaters and pants by wholesale.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a 39 year old married woman with seven children. She works in rice production. Her husband is also a farmer who helps her to cultivate their family's land. 

Laila wants to give her children a good life. She will do anything to lift them out of poverty. This is why she has asked for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and rice seedlings. 

Laila believes that this loan will be a tremendous help to her in increasing the yield from her farm.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and rice seedlings.

loans.name: María Irene

texts.es:
María Irene forma parte del Banco comunal “Ilusión y una Esperanza” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Ella se dedica a la confección y arreglos de ropa, desde hace dos años.
Comenta que de lunes a viernes, durante las mañanas trabaja de manera dependiente y durante las tardes se dedica a su negocio, a veces cuando no alcanza a entregar todos sus pedidos de confección trabaja los días sábados.
