María arrienda un local que habilitó como un taller de confección, ahí cuenta con tres máquinas de coser; una máquina de coser con puntada recta, una máquina de coser overlock y una maquina bordadora. 
Sus clientes son diversos, desde personas particulares que solicitan algún arreglo en sus prendas, hasta empresas y colegios, en los cuales debe entregar ropa al por mayor.
Con el crédito comprará insumos para su negocio, entre hilos y género.
Las metas en su negocio son industrializarse, para esto necesitaría comprar nuevas maquinarias.
María vive junto a su marido y sus tres hijos de 13, 11 y 6 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel personal son independizarse, para esto su negocio debe ser sostenible en el tiempo.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. 
Comenta que con las capacitaciones ha aprendido a llevar la contabilidad de su negocio de mejor manera.
Respecto al grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte, se siente muy cómoda, ya que son unidos, responsables y programan actividades juntos. 
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
María Irene is a member of the Ilusión y una Esperanza communal bank in the city of Talca.  She has been making and altering clothes for two years.  She says that Monday through Friday she works as an employee during the mornings, and in the afternoons she devotes herself to her business.  At times, when she has not completed all of her sewing orders, she works on Saturdays.

María rents a place that she equipped as a sewing shop.  She has three sewing machines there; one machine to sew a straight stitch, one overlock sewing machine, and an embroidery machine.  She has diverse customers from private individuals who request alteration of their clothes to businesses and schools, where she needs to deliver the clothes wholesale.

She will use this loan to buy supplies like thread and material for her business.  Her goal for her business is to become industrialized.  In order to so she would need to buy new machines.

She lives with her husband and their three children; ages 13, 11, and 6.  Her personal dream is to become independent.  Her business needs to be sustainable over time for this to happen.

She is very content and grateful for the support given by Fondo Esperanza because it has allowed her to invest in her business.  She says that through the trainings she has learned to keep her business accounts in a better way.  In regards to her communal bank, she feels very comfortable because they are united, responsible, and schedule activities together.

Talca is located in Maule region in central Chile. It is the administrative, economic, and cultural hub of the region as well as the most important city in Chile’s Central Valley. There is a curious saying in Chile, the phrase “Talca, Paris, and London”. Among the many legends that explain the derivation of this phrase, some say it was originally spoken by an Englishman who said “Talca looks like London”, referring to the abundant fog that frequently covers the city during the winter season, similar to the British capital.

loans.use: to buy supplies like thread and fabric for her business.

loans.name: Mireya De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Mireya  vive con su familia en la maravillosa provincia de Limón la cual marca una gran diversidad cultural: con una población predominantemente negra y con importantes rasgos de la cultura indígena costarricense, la afro caribeña, blancos y chinos, cada grupo le aporta a la zona su estilo propio. Esta provincia tiene hermosas lugares con arenas blancas, playas y palmeras y exuberantes parques nacionales que protegen bosques húmedos tropicales y arrecifes de coral, así como centenares de especies de flora y de fauna en vías de extinción. El parque nacional Tortuguero, contiene la muestra más grande de bosque húmedo tropical protegido y aquí usted podrá recorrer sus canales y ríos, observar la flora y la fauna, apreciar el desove de las tortugas marinas y tener la oportunidad de observar a más de 300 especies de aves dentro de las que se encuentra la lapa verde, el pavón y los tucanes. En esta zona se llevan a cabo importantes investigaciones científicas y se ha convertido en un punto especial para el turismo científico y ecológico.
Hace unos meses Mireya  desea tener seguridad en su local para asi poder salir adelante con su negocio, dedicarle más tiempo, para asi brindarles a los vecinos de la comunidad  prendas de calidad. Con el ingreso que obtenga de este negocio le dará también una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Es por esto que Mireya  está solicitando un crédito por el monto de 597,000.00 (quinientos noventa y siete mil colones), para ponerle verjas a su tienda de ropa americana y de esta manera llegar a alcanzar sus metas y obtener más ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia.
Mireya  es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Batán, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Y están felices porque los resultados han sido muy buenos y la Empresa ha ayudado a muchas mujeres a trabajar en sus diferentes negocios.
texts.en: Mireya lives with her family in the marvelous province of Limón, marked by great cultural diversity with a predominantly black population and with important features from the indigenous Costa Rican, Afro-Caribbean, white and Chinese cultures. Each group contributes its own style to the region. This province has beautiful places with white sand, beaches and palm trees and exuberant national parks that harbor tropical rain forests and coral reefs, along with hundreds of species of endangered flora and fauna. Tortuguero National Park contains the largest stretch of protected tropical rain forest and there you can travel its canals and rivers, observe the flora and fauna, watch sea turtles laying eggs and have the chance to see over 300 species of birds including the green macaw, great curassow and toucans. Important scientific research is carried out in this area and it has become an exceptional spot for scientific and ecological tourism. For several months Mireya has been wanting to improve safety at her shop location in order to proceed ahead with her business, dedicating more time to it so that she may offer quality articles of clothing to community residents. With income derived from this business she will also provide a better quality of life to her family. For this reason Mireya is requesting a loan in the amount of 597,000 colons in order to install a security grill at her American clothing store and thus come to achieve her goals and earn a greater income to get her family ahead. Mireya is a member of the communal bank of Batán, one of the 150 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. They are happy because their earnings have been very good and the Bank has helped many women to work at their various businesses.

loans.use: to increase safety at her shop by installing a security grill.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a 28 year old married woman with three young children. The oldest child is 7 years old. Jessica's husband works as a fisherman.

Jessica has had a sari-sari store business for 6 years. She sells items like canned goods, rice, noodles, coffee and sugar. Jessica earns about 5000 PHP per month with her store. Jessica also helps her husband sell fresh fish and crabs int the market. Jessica works hard to support her family.

Jessica has requested this loan to buy fishing nets and more items to sell such as canned goods and rice. Jessica hopes for her businesses to grow.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and more items to sell such as canned goods and rice.

loans.name: Semilina

texts.es: Semilina es socia del Banco Comunal Urubamba, tiene 44 años, tiene una tienda de ropas en Huaytará, es madre soltera de  una hija, y es socia de Finca Peru desde hace 8 años, comenzó con poco capital y poco a poco fue creciendo, ser madre soltera no es fácil pero ella pudo salir adelante con su hija, las capacitaciones le ayudaron a poder criar bien a sus hija y en la dirección de su negocio, con las capitaciones aprendió la puntualidad y la responsabilidad, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para su negocio, lo que anhela es poder terminar de construir su casa en Huascahura.
texts.en: Semilina is a member of the Urubamba communal bank.  She is 44 years old, and has a clothing store in Huaytará.  She is a single mother with one daughter, and has worked with Finca Peru for 8 years.  She started out with little capital and gradually her business has grown.  It isn’t easy being a single mother, but Semilina has managed to get ahead with her daughter.  Finca’s training has helped her to raise her daughter well, and has also helped her with her business.  The training has taught her to be punctual and responsible.  Semilina will use the loan to invest in purchasing clothing for her business.  Her wish is that she can finish building her home in Huascahura.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for her business.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana es un mujer de 42 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con sus 2 hijos, a quienes son su principal razón en la vida, lamentablemente por diversas razones se separó de su pareja, desde entonces ella dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo estudiar una carrera de alta costura que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver novelas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Chicharrón de Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Ana trabaja como obrera en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia sus labores de campo, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño, dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Ana se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el inicio de la construcción de su vivienda, de esta manera ella tendrá un pequeño módulo donde podrá vivir con sus hijas, así ella espera poder seguir trabajando y esforzándose para terminar de construir su vivienda y con ello poder brindarles mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia.

loans.use: Para realizar el inicio de la construcción de su vivienda.

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en: Consolee is 55 years old. She is married with 6 children aged between 17 and 34 years, two of whom attend school. She owns a shop and has been in a business for 21 years. Her husband is a businessman. With the loan, she would like to buy more cooking oil, rice and millet to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, rice and millet to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa has been making sandals for years now, and she works very hard to bring in income for her family. This entrepreneur sells her sandals in Guayaquil but also travels outside the city to market her items. She works every day from 9am until 6pm and hopes that she can earn enough to open a professional looking shop in the front of her house. Rosa believes that if she can exhibit the items better and allow people to window shop, she will make more sales and earn higher profits.  Ms. C. is 46 years old and has two children. Her family lives in a very poor part of town and their house is made of bamboo canes. Rosa’s wish is to earn enough money so that she can provide a decent home for her family and educate her children. 

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Rosa believes that if she can exhibit the items better and allow people to window shop, she will make more sales and earn higher profits.

loans.name: Mwamba

texts.en: M. sells food goods such as fish, eggs, tomatoes, milk, sugar, salt, canned foods, and other food items. He began selling in 1996 and signed a loan contract with Hope in 2004. M.’s clients have increased about three times since 2004. With a loan of $800, M. plans to increase his stock in food goods in order to meet the demand in his neighborhood. M. is married and has three children.

loans.use: He wants to triple his stock to meet the increasing demand for his food items.

loans.name: Khanam Gul

texts.en:
Khanam Gul lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She always wants to help her family to have a good business for and to be a good business dealer in the future.

She wants to take a group loan for her son who has a retail food business. He wants to buy extra materials like cigarettes, matches, baskets, bags of sweets and bars of chocolate. She is very happy that she can help her family. She would like to thank AFSG for supporting her.

loans.use: To buy matches, baskets, bags of sweets, bars of chocolate

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.es:
Olga is married with four children, aged 6, 11, 13 and 16; they were the motivation when she created her own business eight years ago. Her husband works for a construction company and his salary could not cover the cost of all the needs of the family. Olga, as an enterprising woman, began to sell cleaning supplies to help her husband with the costs of the home and their children's education. Little by little she has been improving her business, with greater variety of products. She runs her business out of her garage and has been refurbishing it in order to better serve her clientele.

In order to continue growing, Olga asks for a loan of $375 that she will use for the purchase of merchandise to have a greater variety and to answer the requests of her customers. She promises to repay this amount in just three months. You can be an important part of the growth of this business and help Olga and her family. They are grateful for your confidence and your help.

Translated from spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, de 6, 11, 13 y 16 años de edad, ellos fueron el motivo por el cual inició su propio negocio hace ocho años, su esposo labora en una empresa de construcción y su salario no podía cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia, Olga como es una mujer emprendedora empezó a vender productos de limpieza para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar y de la educación de sus hijos. Poco a poco ha ido surtiendo mejor su negocio, con más variedad de productos, ella realiza sus ventas en la cochera de su casa y ha estado acondicionándola para darle un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Para continuar creciendo, Olga solicita un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para tener un mejor surtido y cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en solo 3 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y ayudar a Olga y a su familia, ellos agradecen tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase of cleaning supplies merchandise  - Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia and her husband José have a small carpentry shop. They employ a 14 year old and a 16 year old as assistants. They make all kinds of average quality furniture.

They have two children, 4 and 2 years old, and live with Celia's parents in the Pedro Domingo Murillo district of the city of El Alto.

The loan will be used to buy a TUPY Circular carpentry machine that will help them increase their production and satisfy customer demand.

This is Celia's third loan with Impro. Her first two loans were granted in March and November 2006 and have been repaid in full. It is exactly this responsible repayment of previous loans that makes her eligible for another.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Celia y su esposo José, tienen un pequeño taller de carpintería, empleando a dos jóvenes de 14 y 16 años como ayudantes. Ellos fabrican todo tipo de muebles de mediana calidad.

Tienen dos hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad y viven en la casa de los padres de Celia en zona Pedro Domingo Murillo de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito solicitado será destinado a la compra de una maquina TUPY Circular de carpintería que le ayudara a incrementar su producción y poder satisfacer la demanda que tiene en su mercado.

Es el tercer crédito con Impro, los dos primeros créditos fueron concedidos en Marzo y Noviembre de 2006 y a la fecha están completamente pagados. Precisamente este buen comportamiento de pago le faculta para poder acceder a otro préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase work tools

loans.name: Sibi

texts.fr:
Sibi A., age 55, is a widow and was born in Lomé. She is a dressmaker and has five dependents to care for. She opened her shop in her home and proves by her fine work that she has mastered her business. She is more and more in demand, but financial means are very limited for meeting customer expectations on a priority basis. Thus, she is requesting financial support in the amount of $600 to buy a sewing machine. This will enable her to increase her production capacity in order to better server her customers. Her income will increase and therefore improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Veuve A. Sibi, âgée de 55 ans, est née à Lomé. Elle est couturière et à sa charge 5 personnes. Elle a ouvert son atelier dans la maison et fait preuve d’une parfaite maîtrise de son activité à travers son travail bien fait. Elle est de plus en plus sollicitée mais les moyens financiers sont très limités pour répondre impérativement à sa clientèle. Pour se faire, elle sollicite un appui financier de $600 pour acheter une machine. L’acquisition de cette machine lui permettra d’accroître sa capacité de production afin de mieux servir sa clientèle. Ce qui augmentera ses revenus et facto améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Buluh Sari Group

texts.id:
In live, our society does not depend on our own individual, but as a social creature we depend on each other. By this principle, several people of Pangkung Buluh village, created a group by the name of: "Buluh Sari ”. This name was chosen since they live in the village of Pangkung Buluh. The Administration consisted of: Ni komang Darmini Chairperson, Ni Luh Wisadi secretary, and NiKomang Nariyati as cashier. This group activity goal is to increase group's living standard. Activities include: Savings & Borrowing; Volunteer work; and raising pigs in each member's house. In raising pigs this group so far are only doing it the traditional way, so that results are not maximal. To maximize results, the group has requested The Dinari Foundation help to work side by side with the group, provide training, besides loan to increase pig farming capital. Though Dinari's assistance the group plans to raise pigs of superior type and to buy Quality feed, so that results would be pigs at market's standard. Each group member needs capital of Rp1,100,000 (Translator's note: 1US$ fluctuates between Rp9000-9500); to buy 4 piglets at Rp250,000/each and feed of Rp100,000. After 5 months group raising, the group will sell collectively, coordianted by administration working together with Dinari for marketing, so that the group could get best price. With this kind of working together, this group could increase income, and group's living standard increase.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Dalam kehidupan bermasyarakat kita tidaklah bisa hidup hanya tergantung kepada individu kita sendiri tetapi sebagai mahluk sosial kita harus saling tergantung antara satu orang dengan yang lainya. Berdasarkan hal tersebut beberapa anggota masyarakat yang terletak di Desa Pangkung Buluh membentuk suatu kelompok yang diberi Nama Kelompok ” Buluh Sari ”. Kelompok ini diberi nama seperti itu karena berada di desa Pangkung Buluh dan mereka membentuk kepengurusan yang diketuai oleh Ni komang Darmini , Sekertaris Ni Luh Wisadi dan bendhara, NiKomang Nariyati. Kelompok ini dalam kegiatannya melakukan berbagai macam kegiatan yang tujuannya adalah untuk meningkatkan tarap kehidupan kelompok. Adapun kegiatannya itu meliputi kegiatan Simpan Pinjam , Kerja bakti dan kegiatan memelihara ternak babi di rumah masing masing anggota kelompok. Dalam pemeliharaan ternak babinya angota kelompok selama ini melakukannya denga memelihara secara tradisional sehingga dalam hasil yang diperoleh belumlah maksimal. Untuk memaksimalkan hasil usahanya kelompok ini mengajukan permohonan kepada Yayasan Dinari guna nantinya dapat mendampingi kelompok dalam hal pengelolaan kelompok dan juga pelatihan – pelatihan yang diberikan disamping pinjaman dana untuk menambah modal usaha ternak. Melalui pendampingan Dinari kelompok berencana untuk memelihara bibit babi jenis unggul dan membeli pakan yang berkwalitas sehingga akan menghasilkan babi yang sesuai dengan standar pasar Masing –masing anggota kelompok membutuhkan dana sebesar Rp. 1.100.000,- dengan perincian , membeli bibit 4 ekor @ Rp. 250.000,- dan Rp. 100.000.- untuk membeli pakan. Setelah 5 bulan masa pemeliharaan kelompok akan menjual babinya secara bersama sama dengan dikoordinir oleh pengurus bekerja sama dengan Dinari untuk pemasarannya sehingga kelompok akan mendapat harga yang terbaik. Dengan kerjasama seperti ini maka kelompok dapat meningkatkan penghasilannya dan tarap hidup kelompok dapat ditingkatkan. .

loans.use:
To buy pigs of superior type and Quality feed

Membeli bibit babi jenis unggul dan pakan berkwalitas

loans.name: Thi Bac

texts.vi:
Mrs. Bắc, 33 years old, has 2 children. Both are in school. While her husband works as a construction worker and a general laborer she tends a small general store at home and raises a few pigs. The modest income keeps her family’s economy stable. She is happy to be eligible to take out a loan. Weekly repayments fit her financial situation well. Se hopes to get the loan soon.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Bắc 33 tuổi, chị có 2 con đang đi học. Chồng chị là thợ xây và chủ yếu là làm thuê tại làng. Chị ở nhà vừa bán hàng tạp hoá, vừa chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập của chị tuy ít ỏi nhưng cũng ổn định. Chị rất vui mừng khi được tham gia vay vốn vì chị có thêm vốn để hỗ trợ cho chăn nuôi. Chị thây hình thức hoàn trả theo tuần rất phù hợp với gia đình và mong sớm nhận được vốn vay.

loans.use: To purchase food for pig

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is a forty-four year old mother of five children.  After her husband death about twenty six years ago, she had to struggle to raise her children alone.  
Gilda has a small business selling fried bananas, chicken, meats and natural juices.  She has a well established clientele. 
Now, the entrepreneur wants to expand her business.  She will use her loan to purchase a freezer to keep the meat and juices cold.  That way, Gilda will be able to better preserve the meat and not have to buy ice every day.  Gilda hopes that someday she’ll be able to buy her home.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer to preserve meat and other goods with which the entrepreneur prepares fried food

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
Mrs. Florinda is a working mother of a family who, despite their permanent residence in the city, managed to acquire a small cow a few years ago to help out with the well-being of her beloved family. Eugenia, the little cow, provides a lot of milk every day, and Florinda goes to her cousin's house near the city where the cow lives so that she can bring back this precious liquid and sell it in the city. Due to the rhythms of her job, she has constant customers thanks to the purity of this milk. Florinda's wish is to acquire some land where she can grow forage for her cow and alfalfa for her newest residents, a large number of guinea pigs that very quickly began being bred and sold in the Sunday market of Huancayo. Your important help will contribute to solidifying this new little breeding center of Florinda's.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Florinda, es una trabajadora madre de familia que a pesar de su permanencia constante en la ciudad ha podido adquirir una pequeña vaca hace varios años para colaborar con el bienestar de su querida familia.Eugenia, así llama a su vaquita, le provee de mucha leche diariamente y ella se desplaza a la casa de su prima cerca de la ciudad en donde permanece la vaquita, para llevar a comercializar este preciado líquido a su ciudad. Debido al ritmo de su trabajo tiene clientes constantes por la pureza de la misma.El deseo de Doña Florinda, es adquirir terrenos de cultivo para sembrar forraje para su vaquita y alfalfa para sus nuevos inquilinos, una importante cantidad de cuyes que hace poco a adquirido para reproducirlos y venderlos en la feria dominical de Huancayo.Tu importante ayuda contribuirá a la consolidación del pequeño centro de crianza de Doña Florinda.

loans.use: Purchase of land for growing forage and alfalfa for her little animals

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is 22 years old and is a married woman. Rukia is a cloth seller and owns a small salon which she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 8am to 3pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more inventory for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba is 40 years old and is married with 2 children. Habiba owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2000. Everyday, she works from 5am to 6pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Luisa  Reyna

texts.es:
In the sector of Somotillo of the city of Chinandega, Luisa R. has devoted herself to the sale of clothing on the street for the past six years in order to support herself and her home.

Since she began this business, she has been able to provide for her home. To do so she has depended on the support of the loans made by Ceprodel. Today she needs to purchase merchandise. More specifically, she is searching for the support of Ceprodel in order to be able to buy shirts and pants that she will sell in her area.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Luisa Rodríguez se dedica desde hace seis años al negocio de venta de ropa ambulante con el objetivo de llevar a su hogar de habitación el mantenimiento para salir adelante y poder subsistir.

Desde que inició este negocio de venta ambulante ha logrado suplir las necesidades de su hogar y para ello se ha apoyado de los créditos proporcionados por Ceprodel. Hoy en día su necesidad es la compra de la mercadería y es por esto que ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para la compra de camisas y pantalones para comercializarlos en su sector.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Juliet Namukwaya `s Group

texts.en:
N. Juliet is 23 years old and married with two children, a three-year-old and 
a 6 month old infant.  For the past three years, she has operated a profitable second-hand clothing business, purchasing high quality women’s clothing from a large open-air market in central Kampala, and selling it to women in Kalerwe, a distant urban neighborhood.  Each month, she is able to make a profit of about 150,000/= (Ugandan shillings, a little less than $100 US).  One of the things that makes business difficult is that the wards and town council want a lot of taxes from her on many different things.  However, her business is running and growing, she says.  

She has been a member of MCDT since 2002 and has received numerous loans.  With a new loan, she will continue to buy clothing for her business.  She would also like to get her own house, and perhaps some day she will get her own car.

loans.use: To stock more clothes

loans.name: Niceligaki's Group

texts.en:
Niceligaki has owned a business cooking and selling food in Arusha since 2001. She is divorced with two children, ages 8 and 11. She works from 6:00am to 2:00pm daily and generates a monthly profit of approximately $90.

Niceligaki has previously taken out two loans from BRAC Tanzania. She paid back both loans successfully and on time. She hopes to use this current loan to open another business. She will share the loan with her group members, one of whom sells clothing. The other two group members both work in livestock.

loans.use: To open a new business cooking and selling food.

loans.name: Soaphy

texts.en: Mrs. Soaphy P. is  a 48-year-old widower who sells groceries, including biscuits, candy, oil, and ingredients for cooking food. She also makes Khmer cakes to sell. She has been selling since 2001, earning about US$3.00 per day. She has two children, both of whom are students and who live in Compong Kdei Commune, Siem Reap Province.  Because of increasing customer demand she wants to satisfy her needs. Hence, Mrs. Soaphy seeks a loan of US$500 to purchase more grocery stocks to sell. The rest she will use for Khmer cake making.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery stocks for sell and the rest use for Khmer cake making

loans.name: Sapolaneh Group

texts.en:
Aminat B., Fatmata B., Aminata K. and Fatmata K. have all teamed together in a group called Sapolaneh. They have successfully repaid previous loans from Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) and are now applying for a fourth loan. This, like their previous loans, will help them in improving their businesses and therefore improving the living standards for them and their dependents.

Aminata (pictured at left) is the leader for this group. She was born in Mile 91, a small town in the Tonkolili district, north of Sierra Leone. She is 25 years old and married with two children; one child is in primary school and the other is too young to start school.

Aminata has been selling cottons for three years. With her previous loan, she was able to buy 15 bales of cottons at a village called Bamoi (at a cost of Le 28,000.00 per bale). With this loan, Aminata will increase the amount of cottons she buys to 25 bales. Her aim now is to buy these cottons from Bamoi at a cheaper rate, and then supply her colleagues here in Makeni. This will allow her to make more of a profit, which, she said, means happiness for her.

loans.use: Buy more bales of cottons

loans.name: Ban

texts.en: Mrs. Ban K. S. is a villager in Cheur TealSrut Kroum Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. She is a 51-year-old widow with five children, three of whom are employed in different businesses while the rest attend the local school. Since her children's work place is too far from the family home, they usually spend a large portion of their income money on transportation. To save money, Mrs. Ban K. S. is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike for her children, thus hoping to reduce her family's expenses.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
En el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León la señora Veronica C. desde hace 15 años se ha dedicado a su negocio de elaboración y venta de comida el cual es comercializada todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana. Se caracteriza por ser una excelente cocinera ya que ha logrado acaparar varios clientes que le visitan diariamente.

Con el compromiso de atender a dichos clientes, la señora Veronica al ver la necesidad de adquirir la materia prima para preparar los alimentos ha decidido acudir a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de dicha materia prima para elaborar los alimentos y continuar atendiendo su negocio.
texts.en:
For the past fifteen years Veronica C. has run her own food production business in La Terminal – a market in the city of León that is open very early in the morning every day. She is known as an excellent cook and has succeeded in attracting several customers who come to her daily. With the commitment to serve said clients, Veronica sees the need to acquire raw material to prepare the food and has decided to go to Ceprodel to get a loan that will allow her to purchase said raw material to produce food and continue to serve her clients.

Translated from Spanish by HannahLily P, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Mastora

texts.en:
Mastora lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married and lives with her own nuclear family. She works in tailoring now and she can also work in embroidery. For a long time, she was involved in embroidery but during the last 2 years, she has been working in tailoring and she has some good numbers of customers. She wants to make some changes in her working there and since she needs more working capital, she wants to take a loan.

Now she has applied to take out an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani with a term of 12 months to buy necessary materials to further her business with more success and help her family.

Mastora is very happy with this loan process. She has plans within the next few years to have a big shop with lots of workers. She said, "I will continue my partnership with Kiva and AFSG in future."

loans.use: To  buy necessary materials for working as a seamstress

loans.name: Jennilyn

texts.en:
At a very young age, Jennilyn R. decided to get married. Now at 27, she still doesn’t have a baby like the other wives in their town. However, she still hopes to have a child soon. What she focuses on now is managing her business to support her future family. Jennilyn liked the CEVI microfinancing program and joined their program. She believes that by partaking in the loans CEVI offers to people, she will not just earn a living, but also save money for their future.

Jennilyn needs a loan to purchase additional merchandise for her store. She is renting a stall in the public market, which is very accessible and open to the people. She has chosen the best market place, a good venue. 

She is requesting a loan for additional capital for her business. This is also to purchase the goods she would be selling in the market. Jennilyn believes that this year is a good season for market vendors like herself. Her good marketing style is her edge to sell her wares. 

CEVI constantly provides credit assistance to Jennilyn. Aside from that, she availed the trainings and insurance coverage that CEVI offers to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise to sell in her store

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.es:
Guadalupe recibe préstamos de EDAPROSPO desde hace 3 años. Antes para mantener su negocio, una tienda de abarrotes, gaseosas y cervezas, sacaba préstamos de su banco, pero le parecieron mejores las condiciones de los préstamos de EDAPROSPO.

Antes de tener su propia tienda Guadalupe alquilaba un stand en el mercado. Trabajó allí durante cuatro años, y su esposo todavía se ocupa de este negocio.
Sus ganancias en parte las ahorra para el futuro en un banco, y lo demás lo usa para cubrir los gastos de la educación de sus hijos menores, un chico de trece años y una niña de cuatro.

A sus cuarenta años Guadalupe ahorra rigurosamente para construir un futuro más seguro por sus hijas, y con tiempo ampliar su bodega, hasta tener una fotocopiadora para proveer un servicio más en su tienda.
texts.en:
Guadalupe has received loans from EDAPROSO for the past three year. She got a loan from her bank so that she could maintain her business, a store for groceries, soft drinks & beer. She used to get loans from her bank until she found out that the loan terms with EDAPROSO were much better.

Before having her own business, Guadalupe used to lease a stand at a market. She worked there for four years and her husband is still in charge of the business. She puts part of her earnings aside in a bank account, and she uses the rest to cover the costs of the education of her youngest children, a son who is three years old, and a daughter who is four years old.

At her forty years of age, Guadalupe works hard to make money to build a stronger and more secure future for her children, and also to make her business grow She would even like to have a photocopier to provide yet another service at her store.

(Translated by Sonia of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Food Items To Sell At Store

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
A member of Furaha loan, Salome has been a rice seller in the Usariver neighborhood of Arusha for four years, currently earning an average monthly profit of $135 working daily from 11:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more rice for her business, hoping to thereby increase her profit and grow her business.

Salome, 28, is married and has a one-month-old child.

loans.use: To buy more rice for her business.

loans.name: 03-Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Group 03 - Đông Sơn is made up of five women from the Đông Sơn commune in Thanh Hoa City, approximately 150 km south of Hanoi.  
 
* Ms. Lê Thị Thảo is the group leader and was born in 1957.  Her husband, Mr. Đỗ Văn Dung, was born in 1953 and works as a professional home painter.  They have four children, two daughters and two sons.  Her two daughters are married and both of her sons work full time, one in construction and one in painting like his father.  Ms. Thảo used her previous loans from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to invest in vegetables and fish for resale.  With this loan, she plans to continue investing in her vegetable and fish business but hopes to use a portion of her loan to diversify and begin raising chickens.  This is her fourth loan from FPW and she is borrowing 6.000.000 VND (~$340 USD) with a loan term of two years. 

The other members in the group are also each borrowing 6.000.000 VND (~$340 USD).
* Ms. Ngô Thị Hạnh is 40 years old and plans to invest in her fish and vegetable resale business.
* Ms. T. Thị Loan will use her funds to purchase a cargo-bicycle to offer transport services for people wishing to move heavy items.
* Ms. Lê Thị Mùi wishes to use her loan to invest in her breakfast store specializing in bánh cuốn (ground pork and mushrooms rolled in a thin rice sheet), a specialty in Northern Viet Nam. 
* Ms. Đỗ Thị Nho is borrowing to invest in her drink sales business.


-----------------------------------------

*Phường Đông Sơn thuộc thành phố Thanh Hóa, tỉnh Thanh Hóa . Tỉnh Thanh Hóa cách Hà Nội 150km về phía Nam. Nhóm 03 ở phố 5 thuộc phường Đông Sơn có 5 thành viên ,chị Lê Thị Thảo làm nhóm trưởng, chị sinh năm 1957, chồng chị là Đỗ Văn Dung, sinh năm 1953,làm nghề thợ sơn. Gia đình chị có 4 người con ,2 con gái đầu đã lập gia đình,1 con trai làm nghề xây dựng,1 con trai làm nghề sơn. Các kỳ trước chị vay vốn về để buôn rau và cá, kỳ này chị vay vồn để mở rộng thêm hàng rau và mua thêm gà về nuôi. Chị đang vay chu kỳ 4 ,mức vay là 6.000.000VNĐ (~340 USD), thời hạn vay là 2 năm .Các thành viên khác trong nhóm có cùng mức vay như chị.
*Chị Ngô Thị Hạnh năm nay 40 tuổi,chị vay vốn để buôn bán cá và rau.
*Chị Đỗ Thị Nho vay vốn để bán hàng giải khát.
*Chị T. Thị Loan vay vốn để mua xe ba gác về chở hàng thuê..
*Chị Lê Thị Mùi vay vốn về để đầu tư hàng bánh cuốn sáng.

loans.use: to invest in food and drinks for resale, a cargo-bicycle and restaurant businesses.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 53 year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their ten children. Ali has been selling agricultural products in his truck since 1993. His clients can be anybody.

Ali has been a microcredit client for eleven years now and has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him improve his work and diversify his merchandise. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital. Ali decided on starting his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his work by attracting more clients.

Ali requested a loan of 2000 U.S. dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and do some maintenance work on his truck.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and do some maintenance work on his truck.

loans.name: Mrs. Sareourn Saoem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eighteen people living in Sdau Kanlaeng village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Sareourn Saoem is a 38 year old village bank president. She owns a small business as a vegetable middlewoman. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more vegetables to resell and earn more profit to support her family. Mrs. Sareourn Saoem is a widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the other is attending the local school. 

One member in this group loan is an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those with end-of-term loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase of cloth and dye and other necessary items to make our products

loans.name: Khalida Muhammad Afzal Group

texts.en:
My name is Khalida and my husband is M. A., We both have been living in Borewala, Pakistan for the past 25 years. My husband runs a grocery shop in the community. He has four years of experience in this business. I also operate a sewing clothes business to share the financial burden. I’m applying for a loan to buy groceries to diversify my husband’s grocery shop. I’m the group leader of six other women.

Shakeela wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Nasreen Kosar wants a loan to buy material (dry fruits, cooking oil and sugar) for her sweetmeat selling business. Gulzaran wants a loan to buy decoration pieces to sell. Sajida Aziz wants a loan to buy stationary (pens, pencils and notebooks) to sell. Abida Parveen wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell. Naseem Akhtar wants a loan to buy cigarette packs to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy groceries for grocery shop.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence O. sells cooked foods. She is married with four children and is 40 years old. She hopes for the loan amount of N120,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Thou

texts.en:
Thou S. is an old woman of fifty-five years who lives in Pursat Province. She is married with four children, three of whom are married and have already started new homes and the other one is studying in high school. Her husband died of senility years ago.

Since 1979, she has been cultivating various crops. In the past, she has always hired a villager’s cow to help plow a field. She right now hopes to reduce this expense by using a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL to purchase a pair of cows so she will be able to use them to plow her farmland.

loans.use: To purchase a pair of cows to plow her land

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 32-year-old single man without children. He sells building materials. He is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more building materials to sell. He sends his thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Ndiuka C Group

texts.en:
Edwick is a member of the Ndiuka borrower group,she is 48 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 5 children.Her children are aged 24,22,18,14,10 years.

 Edwick started her own business selling local beer 7 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 80,000 Tsh.

 This is Edwick`s first loan from BRAC.She requested loan amount 200,000 in order to buy more commodities to her business.

With the profit she gain from the use of this loan Edwick hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Agusta is another member of the same borrower group she requested loan amount 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities

loans.name: Kimber Group

texts.es: El grupo Kimber está formado por Marbely de los Ángeles R. E. de 26 años, Tomasa Petronila P. R. de 64 y Teresa Suhey V.
texts.en: The Kimber Group consists of Marbely de los Ángeles R. E. (age 26), Tomasa Petronila P. R. (age 64), and Teresa Suhey V.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Shade

texts.en: Shade sells plastics like bowls, cups, baskets, etc. in her community in Lagos State, Nigeria. Folashade is 45 years old and married with five children. She has been in her business for a long time. She hopes for a loan of 140,000 nairas to purchase more plastics to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics to sell

loans.name: Ziada

texts.en: Ziada A. is a Tanzanian married woman. She runs a beautiful Salon at Yombo Makangarawe ward in Dar es Salaam. The business equipment is purchased from wholesale and retail shops. She has been in the business for five years and uses her business income to meet her family's daily demands and for working capital. She has two workers and plans to expand the business by buying more salon machines. She needs a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to meet the business demand.

loans.use: To buy more salon machines

loans.name: Junet

texts.es:
Juneth tiene 28 años y vive en su apacible hogar con Willy, de 37 años, y con sus pequeños hijos; Edilma de 14 y Arnol de 5 años.
Ella se dedica al bordado de hermosas figuras en chompas de lana, desde hace 5 años, tiempo en el cual se animó a realizar esta actividad en la tranquilidad de su casa, lo cual que le proporciona creatividad para formar estas figuras que toman vida en cada chompa que termina.

Una amiga le enseñó este arte del bordado en chompas, y desde entonces, trabaja sin parar. A Juneth le hacen grandes cantidades de pedidos y tiene dos semanas para entregar las chompas bordadas, además considera este negocio rentable ya que sus principales herramientas son sus trabajadoras manos, agujas, lanas y toda su imaginación. También le ha enseñado el bordado a su hija Edilma, quien continuará con el legado artístico de su madre. Para el futuro piensa instalar una tienda de ropa o una surtida librería. 

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos y trabajar con mucho esmero en su banco comunal. Además, para el futuro, piensa solicitar más créditos para lograr cumplir las metas que se ha trazado en la vida. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará materiales para seguir con sus bordados y otra parte lo invertirá en el negocio de su esposo, que vende ropa en las distintas provincias del Perú.
texts.en:
Juneth is 28 years old and lives in her cozy home with Willy, 37, and their young children: Edilma, 14 and Arnol, 5. For the past 5 years she has embroidered beautiful designs on wool sweaters, work which she is able to conduct in the peace and quiet of her own home, which provides her with an environment where she can be creative in producing these designs that seem to come to life on each sweater she completes. A friend taught her the art of emboidery and since then she has worked at it non-stop. Juneth receives a large number of orders and she must complete the items in two weeks. She considers this a profitable business since her main tools are her own hard-working hands, needles, wool, and all of her imagination. She has taught her daughter Edilma to embroider so she will continue with her mother's artistic legacy. For the future she would like to set up a clothing store or a well-stocked book store. This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to be punctual with her rapayments and to work diligently with her communal bank. Also, for the future, she intends to request more loans in order to reach the goals she has set for herself. With the funds she is requesting on this occasion, she intends to purchase materials to continue her embroidery and part of it she will invest in her husband's business which is clothing sales in various provinces of Peru.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for her embroidery.

loans.name: Rafig

texts.en: Rafig was born in 1964, and he is married with two children.  He lives in the Fuzuli region. Rafig has run a furniture sales business for five years. Now he is requesting a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy more furniture to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy more furniture

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is a 47-year-old entrepreneur from Novaliches, Quezon City. She lives with her husband Emiliano, 47, a cable guy, and their three children.

She owns and manages a computer shop catering to internet surfers, gamers and mostly students.  She has been in this business for five years.  Elizabeth makes about $650 a month.  She enjoys dealing with customers of all ages and from different walks of life.  Customer traffic peaks in the afternoon after classes and on weekends, she says.  

Elizabeth is now on her sixth loan cycle since joining the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative.  She has been enjoying many benefits from being a member.  She is currently in need of funds to restore and update some of her computer units for the convenience of her clients.  She applied for a 8,000 PHP loan with CCT to address this need.
 
She hopes to open another computer shop branch in another area. 



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Upgrade of computers

loans.name: Tari Mai

texts.en: Mrs. Tari Mai M. lives in Thecho Village. Thecho is located in the Lalitpur district. Thecho is one of the developing village of Lalitpur and most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming. Tarimai M. lives in a single family with her husband and one son. Her son is studying in grade 8. Both Mrs. M. and her husband, Mr. Aananda M., are engaged in making brass religious statues. They make different types of statues according to the orders they get. They fulfill all the needs of the family with the income from their work making statues. Now Mrs. M. is requesting a loan of Rs 30000.00 to buy different types of raw materials to use for brass religious statues.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Inna

texts.en:
Inna is married with two children. She has a business that sells various kind of food. She started this business 15 years ago with one small table at the market. Today Inna has two kiosks at the market and a small store that sells food items in bulk for other vendors. Inna has very strong entrepreneurial skills. Her business story is a great example for her friends and colleagues to follow.

Inna would like to borrow 14,700 UAH to increase the assortment of food she sells. She hopes to increase her sales during the coming Christmas season.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of food to sell

loans.name: Engelina

texts.en: Mrs. Engelina M., 30 years old, is married and is a resident of Sumirap, Tangub City. She operates a sari-sari store (local convenience store). With the support of her husband, who is a carpenter and mason, she was able to open this little business three years ago. She is able to make at least 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month through the business. This income is so helpful to support her family, which includes four children of whom three are now of school age. She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) a year ago because she is very interested in PMPC's products and services. For her third loan, she was given the privilege to borrow an amount of 8,000 PHP to provide capital for her existing sari-sari store. The future income from this loan will be used for the family's daily basic needs and for her weekly repayments in the cooperative. She is also making extra savings for her children’s future needs, especially for their education.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is 53 years old. She is a wife with two children. Through her hard effort, all of her children graduated from the junior high years ago and are now working on their own. Efua owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, and skimmed powdered milk. She also sells onions, spices, and peppers from her shop. She deems it a great opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc. to increase her inventory. Efua hopes to improve her sales to enable her to save more of her earnings for the future.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia P. is a 47-year-old married woman who lives in Payao Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by raising hogs and chickens.

Eugenia’s husband is gainfully employed but also helps her run the business. They have four children who are between 14 – 20 years old. They are all currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Eugenia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1996 of July in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by raising hogs and chickens. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000 from her business activities.

Eugenia is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 24,000 was used to fund operations of her hog and poultry business, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 20th loan in the amount of PHP 25,000, which she intends to use to continue supporting the operations of her hog raising and poultry businesses.  Eugenia is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience sells dried fish at retail prices to her customers. Dried fish is used in the preparation of mouthwatering Nigerian soup. The demand for her dried fish is high in her community.

She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 50000 to purchase more dried fish to sell.

Patience is 40 years old and married to a commercial driver and they are blessed with 3 children. Her children attend school and this gives her joy. She hopes to lift her business and family above poverty. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: William De Los Reyes

texts.es: El señor William tiene 1 hijo de dos años de edad, es casado. El señor William anteriormente solicito un préstamo para compra de medicamentos, ahora está solicitando este nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de medicamentos veterinarios, ya que el señor sale a vender a la zona norte del país y además ahora está saliendo a vender al Caribe, ya que compro una moto y le permite movilizarse con mayor facilidad. Cabe señalarse, sus productos los compra en Managua al por mayor para obtener mejores precios y obtener mayores ganancias. Don William dio inicio a su negocio hace ya 5 años, buscando una fuente alternativa de ingresos para brindarle manutención a su familia. Poco a poco fue haciéndose de inventario y fue de esta manera que consiguió sus clientes que ahora solicitan pedidos grandes. Este crédito será invertido en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercancías, ya que desea surtir con una mejor variedad de productos para ofrecer distintas mercancías en la búsqueda de vender más. Su sueño continua siendo convertirse en un distribuidor de mercancías veterinarias al por mayor.
texts.en:
William is married and has a 2-year-old son. He requested a prior loan to buy medicine. Now he is asking for a new loan to buy veterinary medicines because he travels to the north of the country to sell them; he is now also traveling to the Caribbean coast too because he bought a motorcycle that makes it easier for him to move about. It is worth mentioning that he buys his products in Managua at wholesale to get better prices and sell for higher profits. William started his business 5 years ago seeking an alternative source of income in order to feed his family. Gradually, he acquired more inventory and customers who now place large orders with him. This loan will be used to buy larger amounts of product because he wants to have a wider variety of stock available in an effort to sell more. He continues to dream with becoming a wholesale veterinary products distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy veterinary medicines.

loans.name: Tupuai

texts.en:
Tupuai  F. is 29 and single with no children.  She owns a business venture, selling both food & daily use products in the local community.  Tupuai  has 5 years of experience in this business.  Tupuai  needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Tupuai  joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Tupuai 's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Tupuai  F. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.87 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Club De La Amistad Group

texts.es:
La Alcancía Comunal club de la amistad está conformado por 9 socios comprometidos con el préstamo, todos son responsables y puntuales en sus pagos así lo demuestra su record crediticio.

La presidenta Giovanna se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, decidió hacer esto porque necesitaba apoyar en casa con los gastos familiares, así que una amiga la ayudo a ingresar a este negocio.. Ella está contenta porque les brindan charlas de belleza y puede aportar  a su hogar.
La mayoría de la socias tienen bodegas con las cuales pueden aportar en la economía familiar, Tal es el caso de Judith con los ingresos de su bodega pudo ayudar a su esposo, y juntamente abrieron una tapicería en casa, además el esposo se dedica al planchado y pintura de autos. Después de muchos inconvenientes ella está contenta con los pequeños negocios que tiene.
Leonarda se dedica a la venta de comida en la puerta de un colegio, hace mucho tiempo, ella es una socia de edad madura así que es muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos. Además ella cría y vende animales en un  terreno  rural de su propiedad.
El grupo cursa el ciclo 15 y están agradecidos con el préstamo.
texts.en:
"La Alcancía Comunal", is a friendship club conformed by 9 members committed to the loan, who are responsible and punctual with their payments according to their credit history.

The president, Giovanna, sells beauty products from catalog. She decided to do so as she needed to help with the family expenses so a friend introduced her to this business. She is happy because she gets training on beauty and can contribute at home. The majority of the members have general stores and contribute to the family economy. This is the case of Judith who helped her husband with the earnings from her store and together they set up an upholstery at home, and her husband also irons and paints vehicles for a living. After many inconveniences she is pleased with the small businesses they own.

Leonarda has been selling food outside a school for a long time, she is an elderly member who is well-known and respected by her neighbors. She also raises and sells animals from a rural plot she owns. The group has been together for 15 cycles and is grateful for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann owns a corn field that is 1 hectare and ¼ rice field.  She’s 29 years old and works at her rice and corn farming business in Banga, South Cotabato.  She started her business way back in 2008.  With the income she receives from her farm, the financial problems in sustaining the needs of her family are met.  

She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to access a loan for her farm.  She requested the amount of 6,000 Php as additional capital to finance her business.  With this amount, she can buy fertilizers, seeds, and other farm supplies.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine B. is from the village of Brgy. Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 56 years old, widowed and has 3 adult-aged children. Josephine owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Josephine has been involved in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Josephine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Josephine is requesting a new loan, her third, of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia M. is from the village of Tuyabang Alto. She is 42 years old, married and has 2 grown children. To make a living, Patricia owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Patricia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC, and is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be Patricia’s 9th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a very supportive and caring lady. She not only takes care of her own family, but also of her relatives as well.  She sells clothes. She takes orders from her neighborhood and fills them by buying fabric from the big cities like Faisalabad and Lahore. She is also a very good mother, taking care of her children and carrying out her responsibilities as a housewife.   



She is applying for a loan for her cousin who will use it to buy an auto rickshaw. Naseem’s cousin is jobless but he needs regular income to support his family.  With the help of a rickshaw, he will start his own transport business which will enable his family to live in a better financial environment.

loans.use: to purchase an auto rickshaw

loans.name: Gulbadam

texts.en: Gulbadam Q. is a 50-year-old woman who sells different clothes and home products in the bazaar of Agsu. She is married and has three children. Gulbadam started her business in 2008 and her income was about 50 Azerbaijani manats (AZN), but her professionalism and good taste brought her a lot of customers as well as good profit. Now her monthly turnover is 200 AZN and she wishes to increase it to 400 AZN. For this purpose, she applied for a loan of 1000 AZN to purchase more products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia P. is from the village of Wadya, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 58 years old. Lydia is widowed and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lydia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products, and also selling electronic loads for cell phone users in the local community. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Lydia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Lydia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & provide working capital.

loans.name: Anatalia Manigo's Group

texts.en:
Anatalia M. is from the village of Tigdok in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old and the group leader of this 4-member group loan offered by PMPC. With a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Anatalia M.'s Group.

Anatalia is married and has 1 adult child. She has been running a general store for over 15 years, earning ~1500 PHP a month. She will use her portion of the group loan to purchase more products for her shop.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more product for her store.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias N. is 39 years old and owner of a butchery business in Kisimani, Mombasa. Elias is single and has been in the business for nineteen years. His main clients are residents of Kisimani in Mombasa, Kenya.  This is Elias's  second loan. With this loan, he would like to expand his butchery business by increasing the variety of meat he sells. Elias wants to open up a new butchery with the anticipated profits and expand it in the future.

loans.use: To expand his butchery business and increase the variety of meat he sells

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old and is married with two children.

He is a hairstylist and has owned a barbershop since 2000. He is well-experienced because he's been engaged in this profession since his youth. He has a good reputation and is well-known in his community.

He is requesting a loan of $2,000 from Kiva partner CHF-ACSI. He wants to invest it in renovating and redecorating his shop.

loans.use: To renovate and redecorate his barbershop

loans.name: Visión Hacia El Futuro Group

texts.es:
El grupo Visión hacia el Futuro está con formado por cinco mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas  una de ellas es Raquel M. quien vende ropa, zapatos y comida desde hace 10 años. Ella invertirá el crédito para reforzamiento de su negocio.   

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Arling E. vende prendas, Karla O. es cortera, Lisbeth  C. vende ropa y sabanas y Carol L. comercializa ropa y comida rápida.
texts.en:
The group "Visión Hacia el Futuro" (Vision Towards the Future) is comprised of 5 hardworking women. One is Raquel M., who has sold clothing, shoes and food for the last 10 years. She will invest her loan to strengthen her business. The other group members are Arling E., who sells undergarments, Karla O., a hair stylist, Lisbeth C., who sells clothing and bed linens, and Carol L., who sells clothing and fast food.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business merchandise, such as clothing, shoes and food.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: Rigoberto tiene la edad de 50 años, es casado, y vive con su esposa y un hijo de 17 años que son su mayor prioridad. Él quiere comprar una vaca lechera para su propio consumo y si sobra para la venta de leche. Cuenta con el repasto para tenerla cuidada y su leche la usara para autoconsumo y venta para obtener una ayuda económica adicional para la familia. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. También, él no ha realizados otros préstamos en bancos estatales. FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es más baja. Él tiene el deseo de brindarle a su hijo la educación necesaria para que sea en el futuro una persona preparada y pueda enfrentar de manera más fácil la vida.
texts.en: Rigoberto is 50 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and 17 year old son, who is his first priority. He wants to buy a dairy cow for his own use and if there is anything left over, to sell the milk. He has the pasture to take care of it and he will use the milk himself and to sell to have an additional financial support for the family. This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. In addition, he has not taken out loans in state banks. FUDECOSUR gave him he loan more easily and the interest rate is lower. He wants to offer his son the education he needs to that in the future he can be prepared and face life in an easier way.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Carmela's Group

texts.en:
Carmela S. is from the city of Gango Ozamiz City. She is 32 years old. Carmela is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Carmela is single. To make a living, Carmela owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling ready to wear clothing (RTW)  like short pants, blouses and other items in the local community. Carmela has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Carmela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Carmela is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Carmela from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Domitila

texts.en:
Domitila is a married woman who has three children, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a vegetable selling business for the past eight years, selling potatoes, green vegetables and fruits to her neighbours and passersby. Domitila faces a challenge of competition from other vegetable stall operators. She hopes to expand her business in the future. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans. With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase tomatoes, fruits and sukuma wiki(green vegetables).

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, fruits and sukuma wiki(green vegetables).

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei sells men's clothing at the central market in Melitopol town. He's been in this business for seven years. His kiosk has a good location, and he offers affordable prices and a large assortment. All these factors help Sergei run his business successfully. Sergei would like to borrow 10,000 Grivnas to purchase more inventory. 

Sergei is married. He hopes to make additional income to continue fixing the house where he and his wife live.  Sergei’s goal is to continue developing his small business further.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Tabriz

texts.ru:
Tabriz G. 45 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Tabriz yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda i seychas projivayets v Fuzuli regione vmeste s semyoy. Oni jivut v obshejiteye v kotorom imeyut odnu komnatu.

Tabriz uje 9 let kak chinit isporchenniye mashini. Tabriz seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit instumenti i aparaturu dlya toqo chtobi chinit mashini.
texts.en:
Tabriz G. is 45 years old.  He is married and has two children.  Tabriz is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).   He is a refugee from the city of Fuzuli who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his family.  The all live in a single room in a dormitory.

Tabriz has worked as an auto mechanic for nine years.  Tabriz now needs 2000 AZN to buy tools and instruments to repair automobiles.

loans.use: buy tools and instruments to repair automobiles

loans.name: Erdenesuvd

texts.en:
