Erdenesuvd is 20 years old.  She lives in “Marshall town” in a one-bedroom apartment with her mother and younger daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her mother works at Mongol Alt LLC and her younger sister attends a local secondary school. 

For a living, she owns and operates a jewelry business.  At the same time, she has been studying at the University of Science and Technology since 2009.  With the earnings, she has been paying her tuition fee.  She recently passed a driving test and obtained her driving license. She is requesting a loan for 1,200,000 MNT to increase her business.

loans.use: To increase business

loans.name: Camlus

texts.en:
Camlus J. E. is a married man. His wife stays at home to take care of the household chores and they have one child aged three years old. His business is located at the busy Kakamega town. Kakamega is the region in Kenya known for production of sugar cane and it is well known as the sugar belt region.

Camlus is a mechanic and does vehicle repairs for the local people. He has been doing this business for five years now and has three employees. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that there are many people in the area doing the same kind of business as his so customers are spoilt for choice. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy spare parts to grow his business and meet the customers' demands. He hopes to own a garage some day and provide employment to many people. He also hopes to give his child a good education to the university level. He describes himself as ambitious and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabougnouma est composé de trois femmes mariées et d’une   célibataire, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Ces  femmes se sont connues par des relations de commerce, de parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci d’avoir un font de roulement et faire beaucoup d’achat, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela pour faire le commerce d’habits et de chaussures tel ADIARA C.. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce  prêt ADIARA C., compte acheter, 40 paires de chaussures de qualités différentes pour les femmes et les enfants. 
Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes de Bamako pour les revendre  en détail et en gros, au comptant et à crédit, dans le marché de Bougouni. 
Avec ce prêt ADIARA C. espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70.000 FCFA  qui sera utilisé dans leurs activités.
texts.en:
The Sabougnouma group is made up of three married women and one single woman; they average 26 years of age with an average of two children each. They live in traditional extended families with their brothers, sisters, co-wives, children and husbands. These women live in the Torakabougou neighborhood of the town of Bougouni (the Republic of Mali's third administrative region). They met each other through business contacts, relatives and neighbors. 

With a view to having a good working capital and buying large quantities of goods, they decided to join the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso. Some of the women, such as Adiara C., aim to trade in clothes and shoes. They are on their fifth group loan and all the previous loans have been repaid in full.

With this loan, Adiara C. is planning to buy 40 pairs of differing quality shoes for women and children. She gets her supplies from wholesalers in Bamako to resell them retail and wholesale, for cash and on credit in the market at Bougouni. With this loan Mrs C. is hoping to make a monthly profit of 70,000FCFA, which will be used for her business.

loans.use: Purchase of shoes

loans.name: Nicodemus Kioko

texts.en:
Nicodemus Kioko M. is 41 years old and married to Margaret. They have two children who are in school. 

He has been selling furniture for 17 years in Shaurimoyo estate, which is highly populated and thus provides many customers. He earns a monthly profit of KES 18,500.

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by an old acquaintance and he is applying for his second loan of KES 80,000. He plans to use the entire amount to buy timber for making chairs, worth KES 60,000; and velvet materials, worth KES 20,000. 

With the profit earned, he plans to add more stock.

He hopes to open a big furniture shop in the future and to give the best education to his children.

loans.use: To buy materials for making chairs

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a married woman who lives in Puerto Princesa City, Palawan. She earns her living by operating 2 businesses: a butcher shop and a mini-pharmacy. Her husband, Jerry, 45 years old, earns his living as a vendor. This couple has 3 children who are between 12 and 23 years old.

Diana joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she hoped for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon and through her own efforts, Diana has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to buy various meats, sausages and chicken so that she can continue to save up for the future and for her children's education. Diana is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase various meats, sausages and chicken

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a married woman who lives in Danao City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  pig fattening and basket weaving.  Her husband Roel, who is 37 years old, works as a motorcycle driver to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have five children who are between 7 and 11 years old. Marites joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marites has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 11,400 uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to buy livestock supplies so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and house renovation. Marites is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase more livestock supplies

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en: Jean de Dieu is 31years old. He has 3 children who are ages 1 to 7 years. He owns a shop in which he sells various products such as salt, candles, etc. He is requesting a loan in order to reinvest in his shop and make more profits. With the profits he plans to feed his family.

loans.use: To reinvest in his business selling salt, candles and general supplies.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy, de 26 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Wilder de 28 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Antony de 5 y Eduard 2 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Trabajando todos los días arduamente en sus cultivos, Nancy trata de cambiar la vida que actualmente lleva, poniendo todo su esfuerzo siembra continuamente plátanos, cacao y café, productos que vende en el mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki, ya que es ahí donde mejores precios obtiene. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus siembras de las plagas, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus cultivos hasta el mercado donde los vende, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. En adelante, espera mejorar sus productos y así obtener mejores precios. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, siente que este crédito le será muy beneficioso en su crecimiento como agricultora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y solidaria. Con los seiscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Nancy, age 26, is a very kind and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house with her 28 year old husband, Wilder, and their two dear children.  Antony is five, and Eduard is two.  She wishes to give them a better quality of life.

By working arduously on her crops every day, Nancy tries to change the life she now has.  She continuously puts all of her effort into her banana, cacao, and coffee crops.  She sells these products at the market in the city of Pichanaki.  That is where she gets the best prices.

What she likes best about her work is taking care so that pests do not infest her crops.  She has been doing this activity for five years.  She considers the most difficult part to be taking her crops to the market where she sells them.  The sacks she takes them in are very heavy.  Later, she hopes to improve her products and get better prices.

This is her second loan with MFP.  She feels that this loan will be very beneficial to her growth as a farmer.  She is a supportive and very active member in her communal bank.  She will use the requested 600 soles to buy more fertilizer to improve her crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Lun

texts.en: Ms. Lun was born in 1979. She is single and she lives alone. She is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land where she can grow rice. She sells part of the rice and with the rest of the rice, she supports herself. Aside from farming, she is a seamstress in a garment factory which is far away from her house. So she needs a motorcycle for transportation to work, but she does not have enough money to buy one. Ms. Lun would like to ask for a loan to buy a motorcycle for personal transportation.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to drive to work.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo, reside en El Transito, departamento de San Miguel, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y crianza de ganado,  vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 26 y 28 años de edad, él trabaja desde hace muchos años, aprendió de su padre y hoy día realiza sus propios cultivos, para mantener a su familia.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, ya que son parte importante para sembrar el maíz, este préstamo será una gran ayuda para iniciar bien los cultivos.
Gerardo quiere mantenerse en el negocio de la comercialización de maíz, por lo que se esmera todos los años a realizar una buena siembra y tener una buena cosecha y abúndate.
texts.en:
Gerardo resides in El Transito in the Department of San Miguel. He grows corn and raises cattle. Gerardo lives with his wife and two children, ages 26 and 28. He has worked for many years and learned his trade from his father. Today he has his own farmland that helps to support his family.

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, which are an important component for growing corn. The funds will be a great help to getting his crop off to a good start.

Gerardo wants to maintain his business of selling corn, so he strives every year to produce a good crop and have a successful and abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: El señor Daniel trabaja como chofer propietario en la línea de radio taxi “GOLD”. El crédito lo requiere para realizar un mantenimiento completo de su vehiculo, esto para desempeñar con mayor seguridad su trabajo. Vive en alquiler la misma esta ubicada en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz  es soltero y no tiene hijos. Es primer crédito con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Daniel works as an owner-driver on the GOLD radio taxi line.

The loan that he needs is for complete maintenance on his vehicle in order to do his job with greater safety.

He rents where he lives in the Alto San Pedro zone in the city of La Paz.  He is single, and he does not have children.

This is his first loan with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance on his taxi.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est composé des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, coépouses, enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier Dialanikoro de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
A travers les relations de commerce et de parenté elles se sont connues. 
Dans l’intention de faire des stocks  et de traiter avec les grossistes, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela pour la première fois. 
Avec ce prêt Diatou  compte acheter, 500Kg de maïs, 400kg de petit mil et 200kg de fonio auprès des fournisseurs des villages environnants de Bougouni. Elle effectue sa vente en détail, au comptant et à crédit, dans le grand marché de Bougouni. 
Avec ce prêt Diatou compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000 FCFA  qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is made up of married women who on average are 34 years old and have 4 children. They live in enlarged traditional married family homes with their brothers, sisters, co-wives, children and husbands. These women live in the Dialanikoro neighbourhood of the town of Bougouni, (the third administrative region of the republic of Mali).
They met through family and business ties.
With the intention of making stock reserves and dealing with wholesalers, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and this for the first time.
With this loan Diatou hopes to buy 500kg of corn, 400kg of pearl millet and 200kg of fonio from the suppliers of the villages surrounding Bougouni.She makes her sales as retail, for cash and credit in the big market in Bougouni.
With this loan Diatou plans to make a monthly profit of 15.000 FCFA which she will re-invest in her business.

loans.use: purchase cereals

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Angel tiene 23 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y los hijos, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SEÑOR DE LA SALUD, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Soloma, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz

Miguel se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz y arroz, es una tradicion en la familia dedicarse a la agricultura las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos  y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar una bomba de riesgo y una desgranadora de maiz.

Le gusta hacer deporte y bailar en las fiestas de carnaval.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel, 23, is married and lives with his wife and children in the Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos.

The communal bank "SEÑOR DE LA SALUD" is located in the Soloma District in Echeandia Canton.  This group is involved mainly in agriculture, growing short-cycle crops such as corn and rice.

Miguel grows corn and rice as part of a family tradition.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas and sells his crop at the daily fairs, especially the one on Sunday.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.  He is hoping the loan will help him economically in acquiring everything he needs.  He is up against challenges such as insect plagues and plant illnesses, as well as climate variation.  His dream is to buy a spray pump and corn husking machine.

He enjoys sports and dancing at the carnival festivities.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Xom Ngoai-1-6 Group

texts.en:
Phuong was born in 1980. She lives in Xom Ngoai village with her husband and two children. She and her husband sell birds, and she also grows vegetables and flowers. She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 Vietnamdong (VND). 

Phuong has participated in SEDA since 2011. In the last cycle, she borrowed 5.014.000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6.758.000 VND to grow vegetables and flowers. 

Phuong is the leader group of five-member group loan. About the other members in her group:

Phuong is 31 years old and has two children. She sells clothes in the market and wants to borrow 6.758.000 VND to expand her shop.

Oanh is 28 years old and has three children. She wants to borrow 6.758.000 VND for her small business.

Sam is 55 years old and has four children. She wants to borrow 6.758.000 VND to expand her shoe store.

Ha is 30 years old. She wants to borrow 6.758.000 VND to buy stainless steel for producing doors.

loans.use: to grow vegetables and flowers

loans.name: Maira Arelis

texts.es:
María, de 28 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de León, es soltera, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Ella inicio en esta actividad hace  años por medio de sus hermanas mayores que también se dedica a este negocio .Ella vende al por mayor y al detalle viaja de Honduras a Nicaragua para traer mercadería como ropa y zapatos para vender, otras zonas en la cuales  comercializa su producto es en Managua, frontera con Honduras, también tiene un venta instalada en la casa de su abuelita y los demás productos los comercializa de manera ambulante. A ella le gustaría comercializar su producto en Chinandega. 
Solicito el crédito para compra de mercadería tales como ropa, camisas, pantalones, zapatos y sandalias. Ella tiene un proyecto el cual es vender camisas con dibujos alusivos a la cultura de Nicaragua, camisetas para ello necesita comprar materia prima para trabajar, desea expandir su negocio vender al por mayor, incluso quiere viajar a Panamá a comprar mercadería para vender en Nicaragua. Su próxima meta es comprar un vehículo para distribuir su mercadería, hacerle mejoras a su pequeña tienda.
texts.en:
María is 28 years old and lives in the city of León. She is single and a merchant by profession. She works selling general merchandise. She started this business several years ago, thanks to her older sisters who also work in this business. She sells both wholesale and retail, and she travels between Honduras and Nicaragua carrying merchandise such as clothing and shoes to sell. Other places where she sells her products include Managua and the border with Honduras. She she also has a sales stand installed in her grandmother's house, and she sells the rest of her products as a mobile vendor. She likes to sell her products in Chinandega.
 
She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise such as shirts, pants, shoes, sandals and other clothing. She currently has a project to sell shirts with designs related to Nicaraguan culture. For these shirts, she needs to buy raw materials to work with. She wants to expand her business selling wholesale, and she would even like to travel to Panama to buy merchandise to sell in Nicaragua. Her next goals are to buy a vehicle to distribute her merchandise and to make improvements to her little store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as shirts, pants, shoes, sandals and other clothing.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita is 57 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Bernardita works very hard to provide for her family.

Bernardita runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like soft drinks and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Bernardita has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sugar, soap, candy, snack foods, etc. 

In the future Bernardita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like soft drinks and other groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia  de 29 años vive en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 8 y 13 años respectivamente. Allí y tiene un negocio llamado Salón de Belleza D! Lucy, donde además de ofrecer servicios de mejoramiento de la imagen personal y profesional de sus clientes, ofrece asesoramiento de imagen  y la venta de productos de belleza.  Su experiencia mercantil inició desde sus 15 años de edad, cuando para generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar, inició el negocio de venta de mercancía variada, posteriormente se capacitó en cosmetología y belleza y emprendió su gran aventura empresarial, cuando abrió las puertas de un  pequeño  salón de belleza. Su sueño es tener una casa propia e independencia entre su vida familiar y empresarial, pero su gran desafío es su insuficiente capital de trabajo para lograrlo rápidamente. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva con el cual comprará productos de belleza e insumos, como champoo, enjuagues, alicer, cosméticos, pinta uñas etc.   Con ello asegurará un stock en su oferta de los productos que más vende en su  salón y por los cuales le piden asesoría; esto es justamente lo que hace que su inversión sea exitosa, pues conoce muy bien su mercado y como impactar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Lucia, aged 29, lives in the city of Cartagena de Indias with her spouse and two children aged 8 and 13 respectively. 

She has a business there called Beauty Salon D! Lucy, where in addition to providing services to improve her customers' personal and professional image, she offers image consulting and sells beauty products.  Her commercial experience began when she was 15 years old, when to generate revenue for the upkeep of her home, she started a business selling general merchandise.  She subsequently trained in cosmetology and beauty, and began her big entrepreneurial adventure when she opened the doors to her small beauty salon. 

Her dream is to own her own home and to have separation between her family and business life, but her biggest challenge is having insufficient working capital to achieve this quickly.  This is the reason that she is looking for a Kiva loan with which to buy beauty products and supplies, such as shampoo, rinses, straighteners, cosmetics, nail polish and so on.  This will ensure a supply of stock in her salon of her best-selling products and those products about which she is asked for advice.  This is precisely what makes her investment is successful, as she knows her market well and how it impacts her earnings.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and supplies, such as shampoo, rinses, straighteners, cosmetics and nail polish.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA 3”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dominga; ella tiene 44 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de golosinas y también vende choclos, ella tiene un puesto en la puerta del mercado de Urubamba donde trabaja desde las 3:00 p.m hasta las 9:00 p.m,y en las mañanas la socia trabaja en la municipalidad de Urubamba en el área de guardería, por medio de este trabajo y negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de golosinas y venta de choclos y mejorar e su trabajo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar golosinas como chupetes, caramelos, galletas y gaseosas y también para comprar choclos al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This loan applicant belongs to the “SAYHUA 3” Community Bank. This bank is located in the Urubamaba district in the Urubamba province in the department of Cusco. This member is named Mrs. Dominga. She is 44 years old, married and has four children. She varies her daily activities between a business selling candy and another one selling corn. She has a booth at the entryway of the market in Urubamba, where she works from 3:00pm until 9:00pm. In the mornings she works near a school in the town of Urumbamba. Because of these businesses she is able to help her children progress. She would like to expand her businesses and thereby improve her sales. She is asking for a loan to buy candies such as lollipops, caramels, cookies and soda. She would also buy corn wholesale. She is happy to have this loan and promises to pay her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy candies such as lollipops, caramels, cookies and sodas and also to buy wholesale corn.

loans.name: Kiyomiddin

texts.ru: Киёмиддин проживает в районе Яван. Возраст 29 лет. Женат. Имеет одного ребенка. Его жена домохозяйка. Образование среднее. Киёмиддин занимается торговлей мужской одежды и обуви. Этим видом деятельности он занимается более года. Кредит берет для покупки сезонной спортивной одежды и обуви для продажи. Он хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Kiyomiddin lives in the Yavan Region. He is 29 years old. Married, with one child. His wife is a homemaker. He has secondary education. Kiyomiddin sales men’s clothing and shoes. He has been in this business for over a year. He is taking out a loan in order to buy seasonal sportswear and shoes for resale. He would like to expand his stock.

loans.use: to buy seasonal sportswear and shoes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tables for fixing up her place of business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Arlene has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Arlene is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Dolores Isabel

texts.es:
Dolores, tiene cincuenta y cinco  años de edad, es separada y solo una persona depende de ella.
 Una de las necesidades que atraviesa ella, es la urgencia de comprar mercadería para su negocio. Es  por este motivo que acude a ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita mejorar sus condiciones económicas y poder competir con la competencia y tener un negocio estable con un buen inventario. Es su  noveno préstamo con ceprodel, agradece a la institución ya que con este nuevo préstamo podrá tener mejores ingresos para su familia
texts.en:
Dolores, age 55, is separated from her spouse and has one person who is dependent on her. One of the urgent needs she has at the moment is to buy merchandise for her business. For this reason, she has approached CEPRODEL in order to benefit from a loan which will allow her to improve her financial conditions. This will enable her to complete in the marketplace and have a stable business with a good inventory.

This will be her ninth loan with CEPRODEL. Thanks to the institution, this new loan will allow her to have more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as used clothing and basic grains.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio Cesar tiene 49 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio, Julio tiene 3 hijos de 16, 21 y 27 años. El no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera profesional ha sido por este negocio que el mantiene a su familia. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de bolsos, calzado, cosméticos, sabanas, prendas de oro y plata.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is 49 and sells general merchandise. He has had this business for three years. Julio has three children, ages 16, 21 and 27.  He didn't have the opportunity to study for a professional career, and it has been through this business that he supports his family. 

The purpose of the loan is to buy purses, shoes, sheets, as well as gold and silver items.

loans.use: To buy purses, shoes, cosmetics, sheets, as well as gold and silver items.

loans.name: Huruma 1 Group

texts.fr:
Causiku est une commerçante âgée de 57ans qui habite au Quartier Buyenzi de la Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle fait le commerce de tomates depuis son âge de 15ans. Elle n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Elle est veuve avec 3 enfants dont 2 sont a l’école. 
Le crédit Kiva  de 360,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de tomates à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« HURUMA 1».
texts.en:
Causiku is a businesswoman of 57 who lives in Quartier Buyenzi in Bujumbura. She has been selling tomatoes since the age of 15. She never attended school. She is a widow with three children of whom two are enrolled in school. 

The Kiva loan of 360,000 Burundi francs that she is receiving will permit her to grow her working capital so as to buy large quantities of tomatoes for resale so that she can make a lot of profit. 

Causiku is a member of the community group called "HURUMA 1".

loans.use: to grow her working capital so she can buy large quantities of tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa pertenece al banco comunal “Tesoritos del Manu” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Salvación provincia de Manu departamento de Madre de Dios. 

Carmen Rosa tiene 40 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, ella nació en la ciudad de Ica  y desde hace varios años atrás que se vino a vivir a la ciudad de Salvación y fue por motivos de trabajo. Carmen Rosa es profesora y enseña en un instituto de educación de la ciudad. Ya son varios años que se dedica a enseñar y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

En esta oportunidad Carmen Rosa requiere el préstamo para gastos personales, para comprar muebles y artefactos. 

Carmen Rosa agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa belongs to the “Tesoritos del Manu” communal bank.  The bank’s meetings take place monthly in the city of Salvación in Manu Province, Madre de Dios Department.

Carmen Rosa is 40 years old and is in a common law relationship; she has a son.  She was born in the city of Ica and came to live in Salvación several years ago due to work.  Carmen Rosa is a teacher and she teaches in a school in the city.  She’s been teaching for many years and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

On this occasion, Carmen Rosa needs a personal use loan; that is to buy furniture and appliances.  Carmen Rosa is grateful for and values the loan and commits to make her monthly installment payments.

loans.use: to buy furniture and appliances.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Celso Serapio

texts.es:
Celso sigue participando en el banco comunal “Las Palmeras” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Celso vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. 

Actualmente, Celso sigue dedicándose a la chatarrería. Ya son varios años que se dedica a brindar servicio y le va muy bien. Celso requiere el préstamo para comprar cosas de segundo uso como por ejemplo planchas, televisores, monedas, ollas y otras cosas mas. 

Celso se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Celso continues participating in Las Palmeras Communal Bank of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.  Celso lives in the city of Cusco where he carries out his work.

Currently Celso continues working in junk.  He has been offering this service for several years already, and it's going very well for him.

Celso needs the loan to buy second-hand articles such as irons, television sets, coins, pots, and other things.

Celso is grateful for the opportunity this gives him and he also is committed to making his payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy second-hand items.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is 23 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Madelyn operates a fishing business, selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. She has been in this business for three years. Each month, she earns 2,800 PHP. 

Madelyn is requesting a loan for 4,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fishing equipment such as hooks and nets. She has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Madelyn hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment such as hooks and nets.

loans.name: Ana Yesenia

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su esposo, no tienen hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, este negocio lo tiene desde hace un año, lo hace por medio de revistas de AVON, ESIKA, y otras que le dan la oportunidad de generar sus propios ingresos, ella visita casa por casa ofreciendo los productos, este negocio lo inicio por necesidad para ayudar a su esposo y tener una mejor solvencia.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de cosméticos de revista: maquillaje, lápiz de ojo, labiales, lociones, también comprara ropa, blusas, faldas, pantalones, para tener en esta temporada que se acerca de navidad, o si fuese mejor alcanzar a venderlas en este tiempo antes de que llegue la fecha.
Los sueños de Ana son que con el negocio logre crecer, poder mejorar la vivienda de las ganancias que obtenga y por medio de los préstamos estabilice su situación.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband.  They do not have any children.  Ana's business is selling cosmetics.  She has been in this business for one year.  She makes her sales through AVON, ESIKA and other catalogs.  These give her the opportunity to make her own income.  She makes her sales door to door, offering her products.  She started her business through necessity, in order to help her husband and improve their financial situation.  

Ana is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics: makeup, eyeliner, lipsticks and lotions.  She will also buy clothes, blouses, skirts and pants so that she has products available during the Christmas season.  She would like to sell her produce before Christmas.  

Ana's dreams are to grow her business and improve her home with the profits that she makes.  Through her loans, she plans to stabilize her situation.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, make-up, eyeliner, lipsticks and lotions

loans.name: Rosa Nieve

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Proyecto 2003 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 59 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tuvo cuatro hijos, pero dos de ellos fallecieron, sus  dos hijos que aun tiene ya son mayores de edad e independientes, con ella vive una nieta que es como su hija la cual tiene 15 años de edad y estudia en colegio.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa, allí  vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres además de productos de bazar y papelería, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h30 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su nieta le ayudan en su trabajo cuando está desocupada de sus clases y tareas. Tiene más de 5 años con su negocio y  gracias a su tienda a salido adelante.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, detergentes, legumbres y productos para regalos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace más de 8 años  y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido y confiable. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The communal bank Proyecto 2003 [Project 2003] meets every 15 days in the district of Jaramijo (Manta). The location is known for its beautiful beaches that line the coast of this lovely place. Here, the majority of the inhabitants are hard workers and make their living by fishing. 

In this place we meet Rosa who is 59 years old. She is separated and had four children from the relationship, though two of them have passed away. The two children she still has are adults and independent. She lives with a granddaughter who is like a daughter to her. She is 15 years old and studies in school.

Rosa has a grocery store in her home where she sells all kinds of products like rice, sugar, oils, detergents, and vegetables in addition to office supplies and stationery. She works everyday from 6:30am to 9:00pm, and sometimes until much later. Her granddaughter helps her in her work when she is not busy with her classes and homework. Rosa has had her business for more than five years and thank to her store she had gotten ahead. 

She will use this loan to supply her store more. She is going to buy rice, sugar, detergents, vegetables and gifts. She has been in the communal bank for more than eight years and she likes it because the group is very united and trustworthy. 

Her goals are to continue forward with her business and to grow her business more each day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, detergents, vegetables and gifts.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилором жительница города Турсунзаде. Ей 21 год. Она не замужем. У нее среднее образование. На сегодняшний день она занимается торговлей приправы. Кредит берет для покупки семян и приправ.
texts.en: Dilorom is a resident of the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 21 years old and not married. She has secondary education. At this time she sells spices. Dilorom is taking out the loan to buy seeds and spices.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and spices.

loans.name: Señor De Huanca Group

texts.es:
La señora Aydee nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. (En la fotografía la señora Aydee está levantando la mano). 

Es la segunda veces que visitamos al banco comunal y encontramos a las mismas personas pero invitaron a una persona ósea de lo que eran 12 socios ahora son 13 socios. La mayoría de los socios siguen dedicándose a los mismos negocios como por ejemplo venta de animales menores como cuyes, venta de comida, venta de  abarrotes, venta de tejidos y venta de miel. Ya son varios años que los socios solicitan préstamos de la Asociación Arariwa y les va muy bien gracias a los pagos puntuales realizan los socios.

En esta oportunidad volvimos a entrevistar a la socia Aydee que se dedica a la brindar servicios de lavandería pero adicionalmente ahora se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir.

Aydee requiere en esta oportunidad el crédito para hacer mantenimiento de las maquinas lavadoras y para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo detergentes, blanqueadores, perfumes y otras cosas más.

La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.

(Dos de los socios faltaron a la reunión y la junta directiva les concedió permiso).
texts.en:
Aydee was born in the city of Cusco and lives in the same city where she was born. (In the photograph, Aydee is raising her hand.)

This is the second time we are visiting the community bank and are finding the same people but they invited another person so what was 12 people is now 13 members. The majority of the members continue to dedicate themselves to the same businesses, for example, selling young animals like guinea pigs, selling food, selling groceries, selling weaving and selling honey. For many years the members have requested loans from Arariwa Association and it has been going well thanks to the punctual payments that the members make.

At this time, we return to interview Aydee who is dedicated to providing laundry services but additionally now she is dedicated to selling clothing.

Aydee needs, at this time, the loan to maintain the washing machines and to buy materials for her work like detergents, bleach, perfumes, and other items.

The majority of the members live in the city of Cusco where they perform their jobs. Cusco is known for being a very touristy and commercial area, for its traditional festivity, Inti Raymi, and because you can find one of the seven wonders of the world, Machupicchu.

loans.use: to purchase detergent, bleach, perfumes, and others

loans.name: Laabal De Bantagnel 02 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe laabal  été créé le 24 Août 2011 lors de l’inauguration leur Banc villageois. Ce  groupe est composé de 12 membres qui  vivent dans un même quartier. Leur  activité principale est le petit commerce. Ces femmes sont très dévouées dans leurs activités.

Madame Ousmane (assise à l’extrême droite), est responsable de groupe, elle est veuve, est âgée de 62 et prend en charge ses six enfants. Elle est très active dans la transformation des produits locaux particulièrement l’arachide, elle est aussi vendeuse de bois de chauffe qu’elle achète dans les villages périphériques de son quartier.

Avec son nouveau prêt elle compte acheter des graines d’arachide pour la transformation en vue de la vente.

Les bénéfices de cette activité lui permettront de mieux prendre en charge sa famille au niveau sanitaire et alimentation
texts.en:
The group Laabal was created on August 24, 2011 at the inauguration of their <i>banc villageois<i/>. This group comprises 12 members who live in the same district. Their main work involves small-scale commerce. These women are very devoted to their businesses. 

Ms. Ousmane (seated at the far right in the photo) is the group's official. She is a widow and 62 years old, and she has six children to support. She is very active in processing local products, particularly peanuts. She also sells firewood, which she purchases from the villages surrounding her district. 

With her new loan, she intends to buy some peanuts to process with the aim of selling them. 

The profits from this business will enable her to support her family better with regard to sanitation and food.

loans.use: to buy peanuts to process for resale

loans.name: Ste Famille 1 Group

texts.fr: STE FAMILLE 1 est un groupe  est composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Denise, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 43 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Denise est mariée à un certain Hypolite. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Denise vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par Denise et son mari. Denise vend du charbon de bois, des savons et des galettes à son domicile et par la technique de distribution depuis sept ans environ. Denise s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Denise sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe STE FAMILLE 1, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des savons, du charbon de bois et des galettes.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will have a bigger shop. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.  The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Abla

texts.en: She is a Hawker. A very ingenous cooked food seller who plies her trade in 16 villages daily. She cooks yam, rice, fufu(pounded cassava mixed with plantain), banku(steamed corn meal. With the support of an assistant they trek and sell their cooked food to members of these 16 communities. Abla has been involved in this business for the past 27 years. She would like to have a permanent structure in place where she can sell her cooked food. After participating in TEACH lending sessions she has developed a business plan with a 5-year perspective and she has the firm conviction that if she  is able to receive a bigger loan she will locate and expand her business which would be strategic due to the fact that her community is located on  a major highway which will attract clients including haulage carriers and other long distance passengers in addition to the 16 communities she is already providing her serves.

loans.use: PERMANENT BUSINESS PREMISES

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 37 years old and married with three children. She lives in the Vituka area of Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. Irene sells kerosene retail using a hand-driven fuel pump which draws kerosene from a tank dug into the ground. She has been in this business for more than five years.

Most people in the area use kerosene as fuel for cooking and boiling drinking water. The area has no public water services, so people depend on water from shallow wells. Waterborne deseases are common, especially cholera and amoebic dysentery.

Irene plans to improve her business by adding another storage tank, which will act as a cushion against stockouts. Stockouts are not desirable in business, as they may chase away customers. Irene does not want to lose her customers as she has built a long-term relationship with them. She needs a capital boost of USD 1,200.

loans.use: Purchase an additional kerosene storage tank.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a mother of three, all of whom are in secondary school.  She is a retired teacher.  She started her business in 2002 after retiring.  She bought the posho mill with her benefits.  She is also a fish monger.  Her fish stall is just next to her posho mill.  She is the chairlady of her local church’s women's organization.  She also participates in the countrywide illiteracy eradication programme where she teaches elderly illiterate women of the area. This is her second loan with PEMCI, but her first with Kiva. The first loan enabled her increase her stock, and with the second loan she intends to grow her fish business. She plans to buy fish in bulk directly from the fishermen. Through her business, she has been able to contribute to her church organization.  She has also brought milling services to the area as the locals used to go far to get the service.  She has brought development in general to the community. She is well worthy of Kiva partners' support.

loans.use: Buy Stocks of Corn and other cereals for Milling and sell to local institutions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Boost Up Her stock

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Doña Gloria belongs to the Ricardo Palma Communal Bank of the Calleria district, Ucayali Department. She is 40 years old and has 3 children. Five years ago and with the idea to support her partner, she was looking for work without any success until Manuela Ramos give her an option to invest on a business. With the first loan of 300 soles (approx. $94 US), she opened a small pantry on her neighborhood because there was none at that time.

Since the loss of her partner's job, both of them take care of the business. Their objective is to have a minimarket, so people can find everything they need.

The Manuela Ramos' loan of 2, 300 soles(approx. $729 US) will be used to expand and be able to offer and sell a variety of products. She will buy at wholesale prices: 3 sacks of rice, 5 boxes of milk, 2 boxes of tuna, 2 sacks of potatoes, 1 containe of yogurt, 3 packs of noodles, and 10 containers of eggs.

Gloria is very happy to work with her husband and they not only share the business together but the house chores and their responsibilities with their children as well

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Gloria pertenece al Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma, del Distrito de Callería, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 40 años, y es madre de 3 niños. Hace 5 años, con la idea de apoyar a su pareja buscaba trabajo sin embargo no consiguió hasta que Manuela Ramos le dio la oportunidad de inversión y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 (US$ 94.00 aprox.) aperturó una pequeña bodega dado que en ese lugar no existía ninguna. A raíz de la pérdida del trabajo de su pareja, ahora, ambos atienden el negocio y su objetivo es tener un pequeño minimarket, para que las personas puedan encontrar de todo. El préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,300 (US$ 729 aprox.) será utilizado para ampliar y vender varios productos. Comprará al por mayor 3 sacos de arroz, 3 sacos de azúcar, 5 cajas de leche, 2 cajas de atún, 2 sacos de papa, 1 paquete de yogurt, 3 paquetes de fideo, 10 casilleros de huevo. Gloria esta muy contenta de trabajar conjuntamente con su esposo y no solo comparten el negocio sino también las labores de la casa y obligaciones con los hijos.

loans.use: Buying food products to provide for the daily needs

loans.name: Elvia Patricia

texts.es:
Since she got married, Elvia Patricia, along with her husband, decided to start a business that she could run while he was at work. However, the children and expenses affiliated with the house don’t allow for them to save any extra money in order to start a business. So it was with much effort that three months ago, Elvia began selling car oil and lamp coverings out of her house and little by little their products have expanded.

Elvia turns to you for help in getting a loan for $925 in order to remodel her business and in order to purchase more articles to sell. Elvia is available to pay back the loan in 6 months so that she can establish her business and grow little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

Elvia Patricia, desde que se casó planeó con su esposo poner un negocio que ella atendería mientras su esposo trabajara. Sin embargo los hijos y los gastos de su casa, no les permitían ahorrar para poder establecer un negocio. Así fue que hace tres meses comenzaron con mucho esfuerzo a vender aceites para motor y plafonería en su casa y poco a poco han ido metiendo más producto.

Elvia acude a ustedes para pedir un préstamo de US $925 para poder remodelar el negocio y para comprar más artículos para vender. Elvia está dispuesta a pagar el préstamo en un plazo de 6 meses para que así ella pueda estabilizarse como una empresa que puede crecer poco a poco.

loans.use: Remodel business and purchase materials to sell

loans.name: Ken

texts.en:
Mrs. Ken M., 28, has been married for 10 years. Her husband is a construction worker and fisherman. They have four children, ages 4-11, three of whom are attending the local school. Ken and her sister learned to weave several years ago from a neighbor. After working for a year, their skill level was good enough to start weaving independently. Now they've been weaving on their own for three years and each has a loom.

Ken is requesting her first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $200. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials, sewing thread ,and pay for the preparation of her loom. Previously, her mother has borrowed from Maxima to assist her daughters with purchasing materials and buying them looms. Now, Ken M. wants to be more independent and borrow on her own.

loans.use: Buy silk materials and prepare loom

loans.name: Eni Luz

texts.es:
Eni is a sweet teacher who has, along with her dear husband, been imparting her knowledge to students in a small educational center in her community. Besides teaching, she sells ice in the evenings, thanks to the help of an icemaker she was able to obtain after much hard work. Years ago, she and her husband dedicated themselves solely to teaching children in their community for a living, but after the arrival of their own beloved children, their expenses increased considerably. Because of these events, they thought that starting an ice-making business would be quite lucrative in their city with its hot climate. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase an additional ice maker, so that they can meet the demands of their new customers. Eni’s family awaits your generous help.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Eni, es una dulce profesora que imparte sus conocimientos en un pequeño centro educativo de su comunidad, en compañía de su querido esposo, además de su desempeño en esta actividad por las tardes se dedica a ofertar hielo a sus clientes gracias a una máquina que obtuvo a base de mucho esfuerzo.Años atrás ella y su esposo se dedicaron únicamente a impartir sus conocimientos a los niños de su comunidad, hasta que hubo tiempos en los que los gastos se incrementaron considerablemente debido a la llegada de sus dos queridos hijos; por esta razón pensaron que poner un negocio con este servicio sería muy rentable debido al caluroso clima de su ciudad.Su petición atiende a la necesidad de adquirir una máquina más a fin de abastecer los pedidos de sus nuevos clientes, quienes a recomendación de sus vecinos vienen acercándose con una enorme lista de peticiones.La familia de Eni espera vuestra generosa ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase an additional ice maker

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more meat and make improvements to his shop

loans.name: Dolly

texts.en:
Dolly lives in the Parta Alta neighborhood in the city of Tarapoto, San Martin. She owns a general store where she sells a variety of products. She has many loyal customers who are happy they don’t have to walk into the center of town to buy what they need. Dolly also provides credit to trusted clients who get paid monthly, such as teachers and nurses.

Dolly is 41 years old, happily married and has two children that are still dependent on her and her husband. She started the business 14 years ago because she enjoys working and wanted to help improve her family’s economic situation. She started the store in the living room of her home with $100 and a table. The store is now stocked with a variety of popular goods that she keeps in display cases and refrigerators. Although she would earn more money if she sold cigarettes or beer, she does not stock these products because she believes they are bad for her community.

A member of the community bank Las Orquideas, Dolly is requesting a loan of $350 to repay over 6 months. With the loan she would restock some items and buy a new shelf to help organize and display her products. In the future she plans on sending her children to university and buying a copy machine.

loans.use: She would like to buy a new shelf and restock some products

loans.name: Ro Teng I Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sary P. is 50 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom attends school while the other is working and can generate approximately $2 of income per day. She is a subsistence farmer and her husband, Mr. Manel O., is a government officer. Mr. Manel O. normally earns approximately $1.75 per day, but he sometimes assists his wife in the field when he is not fulfilling his duties as a government officer. As cultivatable land is now harder to come by and less fertile, Mrs. Sary P. and her group are seeking a loan to buy more seeds and fertilizer for their field so that they can grow (and sell) crops.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer to grow crops for sale.

loans.name: Sam

texts.fr:
Sam is a technician and his work consists of decoding and repairing cell phones. He is single and has no children but is the guardian of his nephews, of whom the eldest is no older than twelve. They all attend school. This loan is enabling him to renew his suppling stock of cell phone handsets.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Sam est un technicien et son travail consiste à décoder et réparer des portables .Il est célibataire sans enfant mais a en charge ses neveux dont le plus âgé a moins de 12 ans et qui vont à l’école. Ce crédit lui permet de renouveler son stock de fourniture de pièces de portables.

loans.use: To renew his stock of cell phones

loans.name: Anvar

texts.en: U. Anvar is 20 years old. In spite of his young age, he supports his parents and younger brothers and sisters. For the last two years Anvar has been providing taxi services with his car. Anvar is a very diligent young man. His main purpose is to make the client happy. Anvar is ready to work day and night in case his customers need his services. He gets up early and goes to bed late as to not lose any clients. At the same time he raises cattle. Anvar buys calves on the market at low prices, feeds them and then resells at the same market at a more higher price. His wife and little brother help him with feeding and looking after the calves. In order to be able to provide the services of higher quality Anvar would like to fix his car. For this he needs to purchase spare parts. He requests 1000 $ US Dollars for the term of 6 months. Part of the loan will be spent purchasing calves in order to expend his business. Anvar thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to manage the loan with accuracy in time.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for fixing of the car and calves.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina U. is married. She is a small entrepreneur from Beregovo, and sells women’s and children’s clothing in the central city market. She started this business 5 years ago. Presently, Irina has about $2000 in inventory. His current income is about $400-600 each month. 

Irina’s business is self-sustainable. It has passed different formation stages: survival, growth and excellence in creating innovations and productivity. Today she is requesting a loan for 1500 Grivnas to re-stock her merchandise for summer season. This will help her generate additional income with new clothing products and increased sales. 


(Note: this is a short term “express” loan that will be paid back in one month.)

loans.use: To increase seasonal variety of inventory

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice K. is 33 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City. She is a fashion designer. She learned this business for 4 years and she has been designing clothes for the past 11 years. She is a LAPO client. Eunice needs the loan amount of US$ 525 to buy more tailoring materials and clothes for sale. She says thank you to Kiva lenders and Lapo.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials and clothes for sale

loans.name: Alsafa

texts.en: Alsafa was born in 1978. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli town. Alsafa has settled in the Fizuli region in the Mahmudlu village. He is single. Five years ago, he started a business in clothing and shoe sales. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy shoes and clothes to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy shoes and clothes

loans.name: Librada

texts.es:
La Sra. Librada Benítez de 32 años de edad está casada hace 8 años con el señor Hugo Acosta de 33 años, el matrimonio cuenta con dos hijos de 12 y 5 años respectivamente, el primero está en el 7mo grado y la otra está en el pre - escolar

La señora Librada se inició en este negocio hace 4 años con la ayuda de su esposo que es funcionario de la Policía Nacional siendo su cargo actual Sub Oficial Inspector con una antigüedad de 14 años.

La señora cuenta con clientela formada y además tiene su propia vendedora, que le ayuda a que cada día crezca más su negocio y con eso aumentar su ingreso mensual Solicita este préstamo para compra de mercaderías como jeans para damas y caballeros, remeras, blusas, conjunto para criaturas, camisas, ropa interior y otros. Así tendrá mas variedad y con eso aumentará su Stock de mercaderías para poder ofrecer otras alternativas a sus clientes
texts.en:
Mrs. Librada B. is 32 years old. She has been married for 8 years to Mr. Hugo Acosta, who is 33 years old. They have two children, 12 and 5 years old. The first is in the 7th grade and the other is in pre-school.

Mrs. Librada started this business 4 years ago with the help of her husband, who is a member of the National Police, with his current position being the Sub-Officer Inspector with 14 years of seniority.

Librada says she has formed a clientelle and also has her own saleswoman, who helps her as her business grows more every day and with this her monthly income increases.

She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as jeans for women and men, t-shirts, blouses, outfits for babies, shirts, underwear, and more. As such she will have more variety and with this she will increase her stock of merchandise to be able to offer other alternatives to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jeans for women and men, t-shirts, blouses, outfits for babies, shirts, underwear

loans.name: Khat

texts.en: Mrs. Khat P. was born in 1961 and now lives in Chamlak Be Village in Takeo Province. She owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn her living. On the plantation, she faces a small problem because her field is infertile which is affecting her crop. To solve this problem, Mrs. Khat P. would like a loan of $250 to buy fertilizers to ammend the field and make the crop more productive. She hopes to increase her rice revenue with this new loan. Her husband, Mr. Run Thorn, repairs bicycles in the local village. Her husband appears with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to ammend her field and increase crop productivity.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
La señora Viviana es socia del Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” del centro poblado de Chimbo del distrito y Provincia de Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 36 años de edad y es madre de 4 hijos que estudian, es casada. Ella trabaja sola en la crianza de animales menores (ovejas, chanchos, etc) Con el primer préstamo de S/.  300 .00 nuevos soles compro chanchitos para engorde y al que sigue dedicándose.

 Ahora desea iniciar un nuevo negocio, y con el préstamo que obtendrá de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles  comprara Golosinas y galletas para vender por mayor en la ciudad de Tacna.
 Su meta es que sus negocios salgan bien para obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Señora Viviana is a member of the communal bank "Espíritu Santo" (Holy Spirit) in the town of Chimbo in the district and province of Yunguyo-Puno. She is 36 and is the mother of 4 children, who are in school. She is married. She works raising smaller animals (sheep, pigs, etc.). With her first loan of 300 nuevos soles, she purchased young pigs to fatten. She continues doing this work. Now she would like to start a new business, and with this loan of 800 nuevos soles, she will purchase candy and cookies to sell wholesale in the city of Tacna. Her goal is that her businesses do well so she can make more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase candy and cookies wholesale

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes S. is 44 years old. She is married and has ten children. Three of the children are currently in school. She has manufactured palm oil from palm nuts for 20 years now. She produces the oil and supplies it to food vendors so they can prepare their meals. She will use her loan to buy more palm nuts and an electric milling machine so she can produce the palm oil in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business and increase her income so she can support her husband, provide food for her family, and finance her children’s education. She belongs to the community group called Born Again Trust Group. Her picture was taking during their group meeting. Members in this group guarantee the repayment of the loans for one another.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts and an electric milling machine

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Mrs. Phun M., 50, and her husband Mr. Nen Net, 58, live on an island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1978 and have eight children: five daughters and three sons. Five of her children attend school, one child is married and lives outside the family house, and two children are silk weavers.

Phun has been a silk weaver since 1980, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished product to a middleman who then takes it to sell at market in Phnom Penh. Her husband used to farm, but now he has stopped and assists his wife in the weaving business.

Phun is requesting a loan of $150 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Kudzo

texts.fr: B. Koudjo est un monsieur qui habite le quartier  de tokoin wuiti, il est un revendeur de friperie et ce depuis 2000, il s’approvisionne au marché d’assiyéyé à Lomé, il n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de chez wages et sollicite son premier crédit pour  acheter 05 balles de chemises, 02 balles de pantalons et des chaussures.Il est un célibataire sans enfants
texts.en:
Mr. Koudjo B. lives in the Tokoin Wuiti neighborhood, and has been reselling used clothing since 2000. He gets his supplies at the Assiyéyé market in Lomé. He never got a loan from Wages before, and is now seeking his first one to buy 5 bales of shirts, 2 bales of trousers, and shoes. He's single and without children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 5 bales of shirts, 2 bales of trousers, and shoes

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 49 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife. Mohammad has owned a coffee shop since 1999. He sells all kinds of coffees, teas and Nescafe. Mohammad is special because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients can be anybody, but mostly his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital. He has requested a loan of 1200 US Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw materials and merchandise for his coffee shop. This is the first time that Mohammad has requested a loan. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by opening a restaurant.

loans.use: Mohammad would like to purchase raw materials and merchandise for his coffee shop.

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Ch ị Lỗ Thị Đường, 44 tuổi, s ống ở M ê Linh - H à Nội cùng chồng và 3 con. Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2000. Hiện nay chị  Đường đang làm nghề thu mua phế liệu  và chăn nuôi tại nhà còn anh  Thường chồng chị làm nghề say sát. Đây cũng là những công việc đem lai cho gia đình chị thu nhập 6.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay thêm 15.000.000 để đầu tư , xây dựng lại chuồng trại mở rộng chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Ms. Duong Thi L. is a 44 years old woman in Me Linh, Hanoi. She lives with her husband and three children. She joined the TYM fund in 2000. At the moment, Ms. Duong buys back scrap metal and raise livestock, while Mr. Thuong, her husband, grinds raw rice. All businesses bring in about 6,000,000 VND per month. Ms. Duong wants to borrow 15,000,000 VND to renovate the stable.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovate the stable

loans.name: Añoranza Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento AÑORANZA se encuentra en ciclo 6, está formado por 10 clientes, pertenecen a la zona D. Llojeta, la mayoría D. las socias se dedica al comercio.
Carmen M., es la líder del grupo desD. sus inicios, ella tiene una pensión, donD. también venD. material D. escritorio, bebidas, frutas y también cuenta con una fotocopiadora. La señora Carmencita tiene visión futurista, demuestra bastante responsabilidad y compromiso con su grupo y sus compañeras.
 Arminda M. es otra integrante del Banco que refleja rasgos D. liderazgo, ella tiene el negocio D. bazar librería, es una persona muy alegre y emprendedora, además ella se dedica a la dotación y comercialización D. los productos Herbalife. 
Nelly Alarcón cuenta con un almacén y punto D. llamadas entel en la parada del micro 31.
Maria Eugenia Yujra  se dedica a la venta D. CDs y DVDs. Y cuenta también con una librería bazar.
Rosmery T. cuenta con su tienda D. barrio y se dedica a vender también verduras y frutas.
La señora Maria  O. es cocinera y su negocio es el D. venta D. comidas cerca al colegio Ignacio Calderón.
Beatriz Eliana Q. es otra integrante antigua del Banco y se dedica a la venta D. ropa.
Jacinta C. es integrante nueva del banco, ella junto a su esposo  se dedican a la producción y venta D. ladrillos.
Vicente M.  tiene su carnicería en su mismo domicilio en la avenida Max Fernandez.
Y el señor Javier Santos G. tiene su pequeña microempresa D. recojo D. basura.
La principal característica D. este grupo es su sencillez, humildad y transparencia, y todas se conocen D. hace varios años y lo principal es que también son amigas y compañeras D. puestos D. venta porque todas  tiene sus negocios y sus domicilios  concentrados en la parada del Micro 31, lugar donD. existe bastante movimiento económico, y es ahí donD. se lleva a cabo las reuniones D. repagos
texts.en:
The entrepreneurial bank Añoranza is in its 6th year of operation and is maD. up of 10 people from the Llojeta area. Most of the members work in commerce. Carmen M. has been the group leader since the very beginning and runs a small restaurant from which she also sells office supplies, drinks and fruit and keeps a photocopier. Carmen is forward-thinking and shows a strong sense of responsibility and commitment towards her colleagues. Arminda M. is another group member who displays leadership qualities and runs a store selling general and office supplies. She is a very cheerful and enterprising individual and also makes a living supplying and selling Herbalife products. Nelly Alarcón runs a grocery store and an ENTEL (a telecommunications company) phone booth at the 31 bus stop. Maria Eugenia Yujra sells CDs and DVDs and also runs a store selling general and office supplies. Rosmery T. runs a local store and also sells fruit and vegetables. Maria O. is a cook and sells food near the Ignacio Calderón school. Beatriz Eliana Q. is another longstanding member and sells clothing. Jacinta C. recently became a member, and she and her husband make a living producing and selling bricks. Vicente M. runs a butcher’s shop from his home in Avenida Max Fernández, and Javier Santos G. runs a small garbage collection company. The group is characterized mainly by its simplicity, modesty and openness. Everyone involved has known each other for years and their foremost priority is that they work together as both friends and colleagues, as all of their businesses and homes are based around the 31 bus stop, where quite a lot of economic activity takes place and where their loan repayment meetings are held.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grocery supplies (rice, oil, noodles, etc)

loans.name: Yong

texts.en: Mr. Yong Y. lives in Speu village in Takeo province. He is a cow middleman. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it by purchasing more cows for his business. He hopes to increase his income and improve his family's lifestyle. His wife, Mrs. Some Sory, is a farmer who owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice. Mr. Yong Y. is a 35 year old father of two children who are three years old and one month old. His wife is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more cows for current business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To raise poultry

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 57 years old and is married to Roberto S.. They live in the village of Cabaruan Naguilian, Isabela. They have four children who are now all married. Her eldest child died when was 31 years old. Her second child, Joey, is 37 years old, next is Jomel who is 34 years old and the youngest, Jay, is 33 years old. Her children, unfortunately, were not able to study in high school because of financial difficulties. 

Clarita cuts hair in the village where they live. It is her main source of income, which has really been helpful in financing their daily needs. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 4,000 to both add some needed supplies to her shop and start up a poultry business. She has run a poultry business before but she became ill and had to sell off all of her chicken to pay for her medication. Clarita is now the one sending her grandchild in high school since his father already passed away. She is now fine theurth year high school and she dreams to finish her studies up to college. Clarita is hoping to have her poultry business back again to able support the studies of her grandchild while also doing her hair cutting and dressing service.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Orgildalai

texts.en:
Orgildalai B. lives with his wife and two-year-old daughter in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family lives in one bedroom of his cousin's three-bedroom apartment in the city. Since 2007, Orgildalai has operated a small printing shop where he mainly makes large advertising posters that are often displayed on the streets of Ulaanbaatar. His previous experience working for a large printing company has attracted some regular clients. The photo shows Orgildalai with the metal rods he uses to create large advertisement posters.

His chief financial goal is to buy his own house so that his family does not need to live in a tiny bedroom in someone else’s apartment. He requests a loan to purchase ink and paper for his printing business.

loans.use: To buy ink and paper for his business.

loans.name: Tdo 2 Nabagoza Joyce Group

texts.en: N. Joyce is aged thirty-two years old, married and blessed with four children who are all schooling. She has been operating a business selling used clothing for three years so far. She is using the loan for purchasing used clothing for sale; that is to say, various types of clothing such as skirts, dresses, blouses, shirts, trousers, etc. The loan is really adding value to her business because she is now able to buy in big volumes. N. Joyce is an encouraging business lady whose dream is to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: For purchasing used clothing for sale, such as skirts, dresses, blouses, shirts, trousers, etc.

loans.name: Omiraw Group

texts.en: Omiraw is the group leader of Omiraw group. There are two members in this group. They both want loans to expand their businesses so they are requesting a group loan in the amount of 20000 Afghani. Omiraw will apply the loan to her carpet weaving business. Madina will use the loan to help with her husband's fruit and vegetable cart. They are very thankful to Kiva lenders for their support of all entrepreneurs.

loans.use: For expanding their businesses.

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel S. is from the village of Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 44, married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Angel owns & operates a business providing transport services to local community members. Angel has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 1994, Angel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angel repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from GDMPC. Angel is requesting his second  loan of 10000 PHP, which he will use to repair his vehicles for better service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair his vehicles for better service

loans.name: Bernie

texts.en:
Bernie C. is a 39-year-old rice farmer who lives in Banga, South Cotabato, Mindanao. He is the father of three children, the eldest being 10 years old. In addition to growing rice, he also owns a small basic store in their location. This has helped his family to supplement their income.

Bernie has requested a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). He will use the loan to pay for a farm laborer and fertilizers.

It was November 2008 that he first joined CEVI. He said he likes the program and the staff and that is why he has stayed with CEVI for quite a long time now.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for a farm laborer

loans.name: Oliya

texts.en:
Oliya is 51-year-old widow who lives with her two children. She is a hard-working woman who has always found a way to pay for her family's expenses. Every day, for the whole day, she tends to her general store, and that is how she contributes to her household's economy. Nine years ago, Oliya opened her own general store where she sells all sorts of manufactured products. Oliya works every day to support the education of her children. She is request this loan to increase her merchandise and stock her store, as it was in the beginning, with a variety of products.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule.
