It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy manufactured products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Acheter des produits de beauté, des mèches et un séchoir

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna P. owns a one-hectare rice field in Norala, South Cotabato. Now, at the age of 47, she manages a rice farming business. It is the main source of income for her family. She has 5 children; the eldest is 20 years old. She provides for the education of her children through farming.

It's a big help for her to join Community Economic Ventures, Inc. because she will be helped in financing her farm business with a low interest of 2 percent per month only. She's requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to sustain her business.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Alaskar

texts.en:
Alaskar was born in 1973. He lives in the Fuzuli region. He is married and has two children. Four years ago he started this business. He plays a drum at weddings. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to improve his business.

Alaskar also plays other musical instruments. He would like to buy a synthesizer to improving his business.  Since now he only plays a drum at weddings, a synthesizer other smaller musical instuments increase his product offerings for weddings which, he hopes, shall increase his income.

"I can play not only drum, but I don't have good income enough to purchase other musical instruments for improving my business."

"The people will invite me to weddings not only to play on my drum, but I will play the synthesizer other instruments also, and I will be in more demand and get better income."

loans.use: to improve his business

loans.name: Nisar Ahmad

texts.en:
This is Nisar Ahmad son of Z. K.. He lives in Jalalabad city in district 3 Th. He is 32 years old, married, and has two wives. He owns a spare-parts shop. He sells spare parts and also does repairs. Through the income from his business he supports his family.

When Nisar Ahmad was informed about the loan process that is supporting the people, he came to AFS and requested a loan of 50,000 Afghani to buy essential materials and to expand his business.

Nisar Ahmad hopes to progress his business after taking the loan. He looks for new changes in his business and he is sure that he will repay his loan on time and will request his second loan after he has soon completed repaying his first one.

Nisar Ahmad would like to thank both Ariana Financial Services (AFS) and Kiva lenders who support people around the world.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts

loans.name: Lukia

texts.en: Lukia is a 47-year-old married woman with five children between 10 and 20 years of age. All her children go to school. She owns a three-room house where she is staying with three people. Lukia doesn’t take care of additional family members. The family has no access to electricity but has piped water and gets three meals a day. She incurs transport costs to and from buying new and second hand clothes at Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. She doesn’t pay rent for her business.  She works in a semi-urban area, which is on the outskirts of Kampala, because she moves door to door selling her clothes. She works seven days a week. She receives an average of 10 customers a day and sells to all categories of people at both retail and wholesale.  Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees for her children. Her major business challenges are transportation and the rainy season, which hinders her to reach her customers. She has been in this business for 10 years and with MCDT for 12 years, servicing her 30th loan working with the same group mates. Lukia joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second hand clothes and new clothes. She is hoping to see her business grower bigger, start selling wholesale only and getting a permanent business premise.

loans.use: To buy bales of used and new clothes

loans.name: Happy Sisters Group

texts.en:
Saybah C. is a leader of a group of two borrowers called Happy Sisters. She is 38 years old and is married with 3 children aged 9-18 years old, and one has an educational level of 7th grade and the rest drop-outs.

Saybah is not literate, due to poverty.

She and her family live in the Buzzie quarter and work in central Voinjama city, the capital of Lofa county, northern Liberia .

Her business is a bar and restaurant. She sells prepared food and drinks to NGO workers in central Voinjama, in Voinjama city, Lofa county, Liberia. Saybah has been running this business for 8 years, and hoping to improve by having a bigger restaurant in the near future. She serves her customers with good manners in order to encourage them to continue patronizing her business. 

Saybah needs this loan to purchase rice, drinks, oil and more ingredients to improve her business. 

She dreams of building a house of her own.

loans.use: To purchase rice, drinks, oil and more to improve business

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda C. lives in the biggest Barangay (village) of San Jose De Buenavista, province of Antique. The most common livelihood of people in their Barangay is agriculture. Some are into rice planting businesses while others have livestock raising businesses.

With Vanjie’s previous loan requested through ASHI, she has been able to start raising cattle and supporting her rice planting business. These are raised just in her wide backyard where the land is covered with green grass and surrounded with rice plants. Once her cattle have been given a period of time to grow, they will be sold and the profit will be as much as double the capital (the same as the rice).

However, incomes in these kinds of businesses are seasonal, as well as the income of her husband, who is a farmer also. That is why Luzviminda thought of the need to have more savings so that she can provide her family with their daily needs. 

Through ASHI and its partnership with Kiva, Luzviminda would like to request a much larger loan amount to grow her business and to be able to have more profits as well as savings. For her business to be the greatest provider of money for her family, she needs to invest more capital in it.  She hoped that her savings would someday be enough to support the education of her three children, whose ages range from 10 to 19 years old.

Her eldest child, who no longer goes to school, is working as a cook in one of the fast food restaurants in town. His income is too small to be able to help his mother.

loans.use: To purchase cattle for fattening.

loans.name: María De Los Santos

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora María de los Santos G. se dedica a su actividad de venta de frutas ofrecidas por ella misma en unos canastos donde coloca los perecederos.

Ella tiene 29 años de dedicarse a este negocio y en este lapso ha logrado llevar a cabo su trabajo con el que suple las necesidades de su hogar. El crédito que ella está solicitando será invertido en la compra de las frutas  como lo son las naranjas para así mejorar su actividad y suplir las necesidades de su hogar.
texts.en:
At the wholesale market in the city of Managua, Sra. María de los Santos G. sells fruit from baskets used for holding perishable items. She has been in this business for 29 years and has succeeded in her work, which allows her to meet her household needs. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy fruits, such as oranges, in order to improve her business and provide for household necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit

loans.name: Jehad

texts.en:
Jehad is a promising cook in Kfeiret village in Jineen district. Two years ago he started his cooking project to provide weddings and engagement parties with catering services.

Jehad is a 37-year-old husband and the father of an eight-year-old son. His late father left him a small monthly income which doesn't cover living expenses so he thought of starting this promising job.

A loan from FATEN is what Jehad needs to expand his business since, through his two years in business, he found how successful it is. He needs this money to buy more cooking equipment as well as to hire a staff of cooks to help him in high seasons which is usually spring and summer.

Jehad is known for his nice disposition, his commitment and his good, tasty cooking.

loans.use: To buy cooking equipment and to hire cooks

loans.name: Ankadignongongné Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe  Ankadignongongné ont en moyenne  39 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Wela, un des villages relevant de la sous-préfecture de Konobougou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de produits alimentaires tels les condiments alimentaires,  les céréales, les articles de boutiques (lait, sucre, thé etc.)  et les fruits et légumes.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les  3 prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe Ankadignongongné sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  1bidon d’huile alimentaire, des poivres, des tomates fraîches, des oignons, des aubergines, des paniers de grains de céréales et quelques  paniers de fruits et légumes. 
 Elles s’approvisionnent à Bamako (capitale du Mali) et  à Konobougou. Elles effectuent leurs ventes, à Wela, au marché de Konobougou ville et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 7.500FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Ankadignongongné group are on average 39 years old, with two children, and living in traditional extended family groups in Wela, one of the villages in the sub-prefecture of Konobougou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women met through family ties. They are in the business of buying and selling food such as condiments, cereals, fruits, vegetables and other items (milk, sugar, tea, etc.). Having properly repaid their last three loans, the Ankadignongongné women are on their fourth group loan which will be used to buy a cannister of cooking oil, peppers, fresh tomatoes, onions, eggplants, baskets of grains and cereals, and baskets of fruits and vegetables. They buy supplies in Bamako (the capital of Mali) and in Konobougou. Sales are done in Wela at the Konobougou city market and in surrounding trade markets. Transactions are done in cash, retail, and on credit to male and female customers. They expect a monthly income of 7.500CFA for each member, to be used for expenses related to health, food, and school fees, with the rest reinvested in their business.

Translated from French by Flavia Garcia (vol), Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food for sale

loans.name: Anita Maria

texts.es:
Anita M. de 36 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su esposo es albañil con el tiene 2 hijos. 

Anita inicio hace 6 años atrás vendiendo almuerzo a sus vecinos, aunque no era mucho lo que ganaba decidió invertir sus ahorros en el restaurante. 

Con ayuda de la inversión ahora tiene un restaurante a las afuera de su casa. Trabaja desde las 06h00 hasta las 23h00 todo los días. Los platos que vende son los típicos del Ecuador como arroz con pollo, guatita, caldo de bola, caldo de pata etc.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar carnes, arroz, legumbres para su restaurante. En el futuro quiere tener muchos mas clientes y así darles un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Anita M., 36, lives in a periurban area of Paraíso de Guayaquil. Her house is cement and has all basic services. Her husband is a brick layer and they have two children. Anita started selling lunches to her neighbors 6 years ago. Although her earnings weren't large, she decided to invest her savings in a restaurant. With help from this investment, she now has a restaurant outside her home. She is open for business from 6am until 11pm every day. She sells typical Ecuadorean dishes like: rice and beans, guatita (stewed beef tripe in peanut sauce), caldo de bola (green plantain dumpling soup), caldo de pata (a broth containing chunks of boiled cow hooves, considered a delicacy by locals and believed by hopeful men to increase virility), etc. She will use the funds to buy meats, rice and vegetables for her restaurant. In the future, she would like to have many more customers and to provide better service to them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For rice, meats and vegetables.

loans.name: Minerva Teriki

texts.en:
Minerva Teriki P. is 22 and single with 1 child ( year-old).  She owns a business venture, selling both food & daily use products in the local community.  Minerva has 3 years of experience in this business.  Minerva needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Minerva joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Minerva's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Minerva Teriki P. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.4 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.3 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.3 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Luz Y Esperanza 4,5 Group

texts.en: Miguelina plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling candles of the dead (candles that people burn to honor their deceased relatives). She will use the profit to help with her goal of finishing remodeling her home and plans to add a musical element to her business – helping her customers celebrate their deceased relative with music. Miguelina is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. Miguelina is the coordinator of her group Luz y Esperanza ("Light and Hope"), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago, an areas known for its tobacco production where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and three children. Miguelina thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy candles

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Sum L., 50, is a widow who lives with one of her children in Takeo province. She sells fruit at the local market to earn a living and is able to make about US $3 profit a day. Her son is a local teacher. He teaches at state school and makes US $6 a day.  

Sum L. wants to have more income to help raise her standard of living, so she is asking for a loan of US$ 1200 to purchase a car so that her son can operate a taxi. Her son will resign from being a teacher soon and start running a taxi instead. (Sum L. is pictured with her son at home.)

loans.use: To purchase a taxi.

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en:
Mr. Sophoin M., 29, and his wife, Mrs. Sophois Thuch, 30, have been married since 1989.  They have two children: one son and one daughter, both in primary school. They live along national road number one, about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sophoin has been driving a motor remorque (a motorbike with a trailer at the back) taxi for ten years. He drives goods and people from his village to Phnom Penh City and back. His wife is a farmer.  His motorbike is old and does not work properly, which has upset his business. So, he is asking for his first loan, in the amount of $500, to purchase a new one.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Nhat

texts.en: Nhat H. N. was born in 1977. He is married with a son who is five years old. He and his wife have income. His wife is a worker in Thang Long industrial park. He is a mechanic and they have a shop. They had been doing this job for 10 years. They have a monthly income of about 5,000,000 VND. He has participated with Kiva partner SEDA since 2009 and repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, he wants to borrow 5,450,000 VND to invest in the shop.

loans.use: To invest in the shop.

loans.name: Va

texts.en:
Va S., 30, is married and lives with her husband and a child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for its palm products. Her husband appears in the photograph.

S. is employed at a garment factory for an income of USD 1.60 per day. Her husband is a taxi driver, earning an income of about USD 6 per day. S. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a new car for her husband’s business.

In the future, S. would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her fourth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a new car for her husband's taxi business

loans.name: Euphrasie

texts.fr: A. Euphrasie est née en 1985 et vit depuis sa naissance au quartier Koutongbé à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Mariée à ZINSOU Benoît, Euphrasie a un enfant qui n'est pas encore scolarisé. Grâce au revenu issu de son activité, Euphrasie arrive à subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de son enfant. Euphrasie n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Depuis trois ans, Euphrasie mène comme activité la vente de vêtements à la devanture de sa maison. Euphrasie s'approvisionne au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo et aussi à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Euphrasie a déjà obtenu une fois de prêt à ALIDé et a bien remboursé le prêt. Euphrasie souhaite agrandir son étalage et réussir son plan financier. C'est pour cette raison que Euphrasie sollicite un autre prêt, en vue de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
A. Euphrasie was born in 1985 and has been living since birth in the Koutongbé district in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin.  Married to Zinsou Benoît, she has one child who is not yet in school.  Thanks to the revenues from her business, she manages to support herself and her child.  Euphrasie attended primarily school only.  For three years, she has been running a business selling clothing in front of her house.  She gets her supplies at the Ouando market in Porto-Novo and also in Cotonou.  She has already had a loan from Alidé and has repaid it.  She wishes to expand her display of goods and to make her financial plans successful.  For these reasons, Euphrasie is requesting another loan to satisfy her customers further.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothing

loans.name: Nhorn

texts.en: Nhorn M., 28, is married and resides with her husband and a young child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She is employed at a local garment factory for an income of USD 2.50 per day. Her husband transports water to supply his village, and he is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 7 per day. Nhorn M. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a trailer to transport water for the people in the village. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a trailer to transport water supply.

loans.name: Ramado

texts.en:
Ramado B. is from the city of Dapitan. He is 44 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, he owns and operates a business, selling general clothing to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately $225 a month from this activity.

In 2008, Ramado joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Ramado is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be his 6th loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Reality Group

texts.en:
Miaseme K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of three borrowers called Reality. Miaseme is 27 years old, single, and was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support.

For 5 years, she has been selling slippers in Clara Town in Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her LRD 20,000 portion of this LRD 50,000 business loan to buy more slippers.

She describes herself as jovial and easy-going. Her dream is to improve her business, make a profit, and open a petroleum filling station.

loans.use: To buy more slippers for resale

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice A. is a single mother of four children, who lives and works within the Githurai area in Nairobi. She normally sells vegetables to middle and low income clients, which includes kale, cabbages and other green vegetables. She has been in this business for eight years now and she takes home a profit of Kshs 1,100 per month.

Eunice joined Kadet after introduction by another client and this will be her first loan, which she will use to add more stock of vegetables for resale.

She hopes to expand her business further in future.

loans.use: To add more stock for her vegetable business.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua A. sells foodstuffs and maize at Elmina. Efua has not been to school. She is married and takes care of three children. Her husband is into galamsay (gold mining in rural Ghana). Efua has been in this business for twelve years. She responsibly helps her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more of her goods for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to educate her children.

loans.use: buy more of her goods for sale

loans.name: Kleber Rolando

texts.es:
Kleber Rolando R. L. tiene 25 anos. Vive con sus padres en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijo de 5 anos.    

Kléber es un socio de la ventanilla rural Progreso Comunitario, que está ubicada a dos horas de Chillanes. Son 11 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de cacao o tienen sus propios pequeños negocios.

Kleber se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva cacao. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en Babahoyo. Solicita el credito para invertir y mejorar sus cultivos de cacao (pora, rosa). Con el apoyo del préstamo podria tener una mejor producción y mejorar su situación de vida y economia. Su sueno es comprar un terreno para sus cultivos. Se desafia por las enfermedades que se caen sus cultivos, por ejemplo el ¨mal de machete.¨ 

Le gusta pasar su tiempo libre jugando el boli, el futbol, y le gusta participar en las fiestas de su comunidad, en especifico uno que se llama la festival del Senor de la Divina Justicia.
texts.en:
Kleber is 25 years old and lives with his parents in Chillanes canton, Bolivar province.  He has a 5-year-old son.

Kleber is a member of the Progreso Comunitario (Community Progress) rural bank, located 2 hours from Chillanes.  There are 11 members in total, who in their majority cultivate cacao or have their own small businesses.  Kleber, too, is in agriculture, cultivating cacao.  He makes his purchases and sells his crop in Babahoyo.  

Kleber is requesting a loan to invest in improving his cacao crop (of two types: pora, rosa).  With the help of the loan, he can improve production as well as his economic situation and his life.  His dream is to buy a plot of crop land.  The challenge is the infirmities that befall his cacao trees, for example, the “mal de machete” (machete illness).

Kleber enjoys spending his free time playing the game of boliche and football (soccer), and participating in community fiestas, especially one called “La Festival del Senor de la Divina Justicia” (The Festival of the Lord of Divine Justice).

loans.use: BUYING SUPPLIES TO CULTIVATE CACAO (CHOCOLATE)

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en: Clarita G. is from the village of Barangay Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 50 years old, married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Clarita owns and operates a business selling fish in the local community. Clarita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month from these activities. In 2006, Clarita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Clarita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Clarita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Clarita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Gereltod

texts.en:
Mr.Gereltod is 35 years old and lives with his wife and infant daughter in a small house where he operates his catering business in Ulaanbaatar,the capital city of Mongolia. Few years ago he sold his house to buy a suitable place to open a catering business. 
Mr.Gereltod used to work in a restaurant as a kitchen assistant for a many years and has gained a lot catering experience. Then he decided to open his own catering business. Currently he runs the business together with his wife and his elder sister. In the photo with him is his wife, infant daughter and his elder sister. He has chosen good location for the business and it is one of the most crowded place in the city and many of his customers are taxi drivers.  The daily earning is 50,000 to 120,000 MNT

He is a  very hard-working and optimistic person and is requesting a 900,000 MNT loan to purchase more kitchen equipments for his catering business such as a tables, chairs, refrigerator and some supply materials.

loans.use: to purchase more kitchen equipments for his catering business such as a tables, chairs, refrigerator and some supply materials

loans.name: Gora

texts.fr: Monsieur Gora M. est un menuisier ébéniste qui travail dans la fabrication de meubles dans la ville de Mbour. Il a une expérience de prés de 13 ans dans le domaine. Monsieur M. est un jeune qui vit avec ses parents et sollicite ce crédit pour l'acquisition de nouveaux matériaux pour renforcer son atelier ce qui lui permettra d'anticiper sur ses commandes
texts.en: Mr. Gora M. is a carpenter who works builds furniture in the city of Mbour. He has almost 13 years of experience in the business. Mr. M. is a young man who lived with his parents. He is asking for a loan in order to acquire new materials to strengthen his workshop, which will enable him to better handle customers' orders.

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Elle est mariée et a 4 enfants en charge. Elle est âgé de 43 ans.  Pour améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants, elle gère comme activité génératrice de revenus, la vente de sachets,sucres et les aromes. Elle achète souvent au grand de Lomé pour se procurer des marchandises et revend au marché local d’akodessewa. Elle est dans cette activité il y a de cela 12 ans. Pour satisfaire plus de clients, elle sollicite ce prêt.
texts.en: Akossiwa M. is married and has 4 children in her care. She is 43 years old. To improve her children's living conditions, she runs an income-generating activity selling powder packets, sugar, and flavours. She often buys her goods at the grand market in Lomé and re-sells them at the local market in Akodessewa. She has been running this business for 12 years. She is seeking this loan to satisfy more customers.

loans.use: To buy powder packets, sugar, and flavours

loans.name: Bisiti

texts.en:
Bisiti is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has been operating a fresh water selling business for the past three years.  Neighbors are her potential customers. Bisiti faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to own a big water tank in the future. 

With the Kshs 15,000, she wants to purchase a water tank. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank

loans.name: Pasalisa

texts.en:
Pasalisa I. is a 38-year-old lady. She is single and has one child, aged 14, whom she hopes to give a quality education to the university level. 

Her business is located in the busy Kakamega town. Kakamega is the region in Kenya known for production of sugar cane and it is well-known as the sugar-belt region. She sells vegetables, e.g. kale, onions, green vegetables and others, to the local people. She has been doing this business for seven years now and has one employee. 

She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is that there are so many other people in the area doing the same kind of business as hers, so customers are not loyal as they are spoiled for choice. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more vegetables to expand her business and meet customer demand. She hopes to grow her business to a wholesale one and, in the future, diversify into clothes sales. She describes herself as focused and a lady who never gives up.

loans.use: Vegetables

loans.name: Angel Eduardo

texts.es:
Ángel tiene 33 años de edad y vive junto a su esposa e hija de 6 años de edad. Juntos residen en el distrito de Paiján, una zona agrícola y comercial que se encuentra localizada en la provincia de Ascope, región La Libertad, a más de dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

El cuenta con un negocio de alquiler de trajes y disfraces para todo público. Su negocio tiene bastante acogida ya que es bastante conocido en el rubro, además su local de atención se encuentra situado cerca del centro de su distrito. El nos comenta que la temporada en la que cuenta con más pedidos es durante la temporada escolar. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le sirven para sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

Ángel desea adquirir más trajes y disfraces para poder contar con un surtido stock durante la próxima temporada escolar. El desea adquirir su mercadería durante estas fechas ya que el precio suele ser bajo. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Ángel is 33 years old.  He lives with his wife and six year old daughter in the Paiján district.  It is an agricultural and commercial zone in the Ascope province in the La Libertad region.  It is over two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

He has a business of renting outfits and costumes to the public.  His business is well-received because it is well-known in the area.  Also, the place where he waits on customers is located close to the center of his district.  He tells us that he gets the most orders during the school year.  The income he gets from this business activity helps him to get ahead with the family finances.

Ángel wishes to get more outfits and costumes to be able to be well-stocked during the next school season.  He wishes to get more merchandise during these times because the price is generally lower.  In order to achieve his objective he believes it is advisable to request a loan from Edpyme Alternative for 1,500 soles.

loans.use: To get more outfits and costumes to be able to be well-stocked during the next school season

loans.name: Mi Barquito Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mi Barquito lo conforman María Luisa L. M., Rosa Emilia L., María Auxiliadora Rivas, Engracia M. Reyes y Vilma C. Bonilla cinco mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora L. M. de 36 años propietaria de una pequeña pulpería desde hace 4 años el cual desea convertir en una miscelánea.
Ella inicio vendiendo sandalias y zapatos para sacar a delante a sus tres hijos de 6, 9 y 12 años los cuales iniciaran pronto a clases.
Rosa L. de 32 años vende cosméticos y zapatos desde hace tres años, María Rivas vende productos Avon con el fin de tener un ingreso extra además de su trabajo, Engracia M. comercializa cosméticos y ropa y Vilma C. realiza nacatamales comida típica a base de cerdo, hielos y helados.
texts.en:
The “Mi Barquito” (My Little Boat) group is comprised of María Luisa L. M., Rosa Emilia L., María Auxiliadora Rivas, Engracia M. Reyes, and Vilma C. Bonilla.  They are five dedicated and hard-working women.

Mrs. L. M., age 36, is the coordinator of the group.  She has had a small grocery store for four years, and she wishes to convert it to a general store.  She started out selling sandals and shoes in order to get her three children ahead.  Her children are 6, 9, and 12 years old, and they start classes soon.

Rosa L., age 32, has been selling cosmetics and shoes for three years.  María Rivas sells Avon products in order to have an extra income in addition to her work.  Engracia M. sells cosmetics and clothes.  Vilma C. makes “nacatamales”, a typical dish made from pork.  She also makes ices and ice cream.

loans.use: Basic grains

loans.name: Terbish

texts.en: Terbish is 52 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They all live together in small house on their plot of land. His daughter attends university. His wife is retired. Terbish has operated a taxi service in city for the past ten years. He has gained a lot of experience over the years, and is a trusted driver for many customers, saying, "My family’s living conditions have improved a lot since I started running the taxi service and I provide a good education for my daughter until she graduates from university." He is requesting a loan to increasing his business capital and purchase some spare parts for his car.

loans.use: To increase working capital and purchase spare parts for his car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes and clothing materials to sew coats

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a forty-eight-year-old married woman with seven children.  She has her own house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She is the bread winner of the family and her dream is setting up a sustainable income-generating activity and educating her children.

For thirty years she has been into farming, running a large banana plantation despite challenges in price fluctuations.  Agnes desires to venture into livestock and poultry.  She needs this loan to clear her farm and buy chickens.

loans.use: To clear farmland and buy chickens

loans.name: María Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora María D. es socia del banco comunal Feria Libre, vive por el sector de Miraflores en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza de su centro histórico, su belleza natural, su variedad en la gastronomía la que cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños por su gente que es muy amable y cordial.

Doña María tiene 46 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos de 24, 22, 21, 19, 14 y 12 años de edad, su primer hijo es discapacitado, su segunda hija trabaja y ayuda en la economía del hogar, su tercer y cuarto hijo estudian en el colegio y trabajan, su penúltima hija estudia en una academia de costura y su ultimo hijo se encuentra en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como guardia de seguridad, tienen una casita propia que es de madera.

La Señora. María vende comida, esta actividad la realiza hace 20 años, labora de domingo a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, también se dedica a la cría de gallinas y cuyes.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 3 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales para la construccion del techo de su nueva casa que esta construyendo.
 
Su meta es  comprarse un vehiculo.
texts.en:
Sra. María D. is a member of the Communal Bank “Feria Libre” (Open Fair). She lives in the sector of Miraflores in the city of Cuenca. This city is known for the richness of its historical center, its natural beauty, and the variety of cuisines that captivate the palates of locals and foreigners alike. The people are extremely friendly and cordial.

Doña María is 46 years old, married, and has six children (ages 24, 22, 21, 19, 14, and 12). Her oldest child, a son, is disabled. The second child, a daughter, works and helps with the household finances. Her third and fourth children, both sons, attend college and work. The next to last child, a daughter, attends a sewing academy. The youngest, a son, attends high school in the city. Her husband works as a security guard. They own a small home made of wood.

Sra. María has been selling food for twenty years. She works Sunday through Sunday from 6am to 6pm. María also raises chickens and guinea pigs. She has been a member of the Communal Bank for three years. Her new loan will be invested in the purchase of materials to build the roof of her new house which is currently under construction. Her goal is to buy a vehicle.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build the roof of her house.

loans.name: Kou's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is made up of four members who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes in order to improve their family's standard of living.
Mrs. Kou is the group leader who has been selected by the other members. She was born in 1974 and is a mother of three children who attend a local public school. Mrs. Kou is a pig breeder who earns a profit to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Bang, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he grows rice to support his family, and he is also a construction worker. Currently, Mrs. Kou has a problem because her husband’s workplace is far away from their house. So to improve this situation, Mrs. Kou is requesting a loan to buy a new motorcycle for her husband to travel to work. Mrs. Soem and Mrs. Pheap are group guarantors, so they are shown in the picture.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for her husband

loans.name: Delcy

texts.es: Delcy, de 23 años es una trabajadora madre soltera. A pesar de su corta edad, tiene muchos objetivos, pues su motivación es su hijo Renzo, al que cuida en un cuarto que alquila en el caserío de Villa Visca. Desde hace 2 años, comenzó a sembrar papa, alverja y maíz en terrenos arrendados que se ubican a las afueras de su localidad. Todas las mañanas en compañía de su pequeño Renzo se dirige a cuidar de sus cultivos, donde encuentra paz y las fuerzas para salir adelante, sabe que el camino por la agricultura es muy difícil pues no tiene apoyo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder sacar la maleza que crece entre sus cultivos. “Gracias a Dios, tengo habilidad en la comercialización de mis cosechas. Obtengo buenas ganancias en la venta a los mayoristas del mercado de Tarma”, afirma.  Su principal dificultad es no contar con un capital de trabajo, “con el tiempo y las buenas dediciones lo lograré”, menciona con una sonrisa en el rostro. Por ahora sus planes son adquirir un terreno agrícola propio para que pueda obtener mayores ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Visca”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera lograr sus objetivos. Delcy, muy pronto cosechará papa de la variedad “única” y “amarilis”, por ello con el dinero solicitado comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico y fertilizante natural, para esparcirlo en su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Delcy is 23 years old and is a hardworking single mother.  Despite her young age, she has many goals.  Her son Renzo, whom she cares for in her rented room in the Villa Visca settlement, is her motivation.  Two years ago she began raising potatoes, peas, and corn on rented land located on the outskirts of her area.  Every morning, in company of her little Renzo, she goes out to care for her crops.  Here she finds peace and the strength to get ahead.  She knows that the farming path is very difficult, but she has no other means of support.

What she enjoys most about her work is being able to remove the weeds from among her crops.  “Thanks to God, I am able to sell my harvest.  I have good earnings by selling to the wholesalers in the Tarma markets,” she says.  Her main challenge is not having any working capital.  “Eventually and with dedication, I will achieve this,” as she says with a smile on her face.  For now her plans are to acquire some farmland of her own so that she can obtain better earnings.

She is part of the “Villa Visca” communal bank and this will be her first loan through MFP, which she expects will help her meet her goals.

Delcy will harvest her potatoes soon.  She will use the money from this loan to buy sacks of organic and natural fertilizer to spread on her next crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Yamilet Del Socorro

texts.es:
Tener su propio local en el que pueda vender sus productos es el sueño de Yamilet del Socorro J. C. quien a sus 48 años de edad es una luchadora incansable que desde hace algunos años inició con su negocio ambulante en el que vende salpicones y cremas, entre otros productos a las afueras de un colegio.  

Su negocio le permite sostener su hogar conformado por 5 hijos menores de edad, los cuales dependen de ella y su esposo. Yamilet se ve enfrentada día a día a las dificultades del clima, puesto que por ser una vendedora ambulante el invierno llega a afectar sus ventas. 

Actualmente, esta emprendedora necesita de un préstamo para comprar su carpa, arreglar su carrito en el que exhibe sus productos y comprar mayor variedad de surtido como frutas, snacks y otros dulces que le permitan incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Yamilet del Socorro J. C. is 48 years old and her dream is to have her own locale in which to sell her products.  She is an untiring fighter who several years ago starting street vending salpicones and cremas (fruit and juice treats), among other products, outside a school.

Her business makes it possible for her to support her home which consists of five minor children who depend on her and her husband.  Yamilet faces daily weather challenges because, as a street vendor, winter affects her sales.

This entrepreneur currently needs a loan to buy a tent, to repair her sales cart that she displays her wares in and to buy a variety of stock items like fruit, snacks and other sweets that will allow her to increase sales.

loans.use: to buy a tent, repair her cart and buy merchandise like fruit, snacks and other sweets.

loans.name: Hermes

texts.es:
Hermes es un cliente de 48 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus dos menores hijos en una comunidad rural ubicada a 8 Km. Del distrito de Tambogrande –Piura.  El lugar donde vive Hermes no cuenta con los servicios básicos de luz, agua y desagüe y  esto es lo que lo motiva a mejorar su calidad de vida.

Hermes se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino. Actualmente cuenta con 22 ovejas a la cuales cría hasta tener el tamaño y peso ideal para comercializarlas al mejor precio en el mercado local. Adicionalmente,  Hermes es agricultor. Cuenta con una parcela, herencia de su padre, en la cual siembra mango y limón. Hermes cosecha limón semanalmente y la venta de este le genera buenas ganancias, pues cuenta con clientela establecida en su zona.

Hermes solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado. Así como, en la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para su cultivo de limón. Esto le permitirá mejorar las condiciones de ambas actividades.

Hermes ha trabajado con nuestra entidad y ha cancelado puntualmente sus pagos. Este crédito le sería de gran utilidad y él estaría muy agradecido de concedérselo.
texts.en:
Hermes is a 48 year-old client who lives with his wife and two dependent children in a rural community which is located 8km from Tambogrande district - Piura.  Hermes does not have basic services of electricity, water and sewerage.  This is what motivates him to improve his quality of life.  

Hermes raises and sells sheep.  He currently has 22 sheep which he raises until they reach an ideal size and weight and then sells for the best price possible in the local market.  Hermes is also a farmer.  He has a plot of land, which he inherited from his father, where he grows mangos and lemons.  He harvests his lemons every week and his sales make him good profits as he has an established customer base in his area.

Hermes is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which he will use to buy balanced feed for his animals.  He will also buy manures and fertilizers for his lemon crops.  This will allow him to improve both businesses.

Hermes has previously worked with our institution and repaid loans on time.  This loan will be of great use to him and he is very grateful to be receiving it.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora María Elena es un persona muy responsable y trabajadora, desde hace 4 años  adquirió su vivienda de interés social que por lo regular en este país las casa son muy pequeñas. María preocupada por el bienestar y confort de sus dos pequeños desea construir un cuarto más en la parte de enfrente para tener mayor espacio, primero quiere iniciar con los cimentos y poco a poco terminar su cuarto. Para poder realizar su proyecto necesita capital para comprar lo necesario para comenzar su construcción.
texts.en: Sra María Elena is a very responsible and hardworking woman. 4 years ago she acquired her home. Like most homes in this country, it is very small. Maria is worried about the well-being and comfort  of her two children and would like to build an additional room on the front of her home in order to have more space. She wants to start with the foundation and finish the room little by little. She needs capital in order to buy the necessary materials to begin construction and eventually complete this project.

loans.use: build a foundation for a new room on her house.

loans.name: Lukovani

texts.en:
Lukovani has operated in the transport industry in Naivasha town for the past three years. He also plants sugarcane, to sell, on his farm. He is 33 years old, married to Susan, and they have three children. 

Lukovani was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his third loan. He has repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to plant sugar cane on his farm and to sell the cane after its maturity. 

In the future, Lukovani hopes to buy a taxi which he will operate in Naivasha town. The taxi business is more profitable, compared to motorbikes.

loans.use: to plant sugarcane on his farm.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es: Narciso de 54 años reside en la localidad de Palcamayo. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su madre Manuela de 95 años, a quien cuida y desea brindar una mejor vida. El trabajo al que se dedica Narciso es la cerrajería, su negocio es muy concurrido ya que es de los pocos que se dedica a esta actividad en su pueblo, todos los días desde muy temprano empieza a atender a sus clientes, quienes conociendo la buena calidad de sus trabajos, no dudan en encomendarle el arreglo de sus cerrojos, planchas metálicas, tubos para puertas y estufas metálicas. Según afirma lo que le genera mayor rentabilidad es la estufa que vende a un promedio de S/. 500 nuevos soles cada una. Hay momentos en los que le llega mucho trabajo, y para entregar sin demora contrata a personas quienes le ayudan en su labor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es ayudar a sus clientes cuando pierden sus llaves, ya que ven en él a su salvador, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que esperar clientes todo el día en su tienda. En adelante, espera seguir trabajando con las mismas fuerzas, con el único fin de sobresalir en la vida. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen María” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde está contento de saber que tendrá el apoyo financiero que tanto necesita. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Narciso de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de materiales para la construcción de objetos metálicos.
texts.en:
Narciso is 54 years old and lives in the town of Palcamayo.  He is noted for being a simple and hardworking man.  He lives in a rented house with his 95 year old mother, Manuela, who he cares for and wants to give a better life.  

Narciso works as a locksmith. His business is very busy because it is one of the few that does this work in his town.  Every day, starting very early, he serves his customers.  His customers know the quality of his work, so they don't hesitate to have him repair their bolts, metal plates, tubes for doors, and metal stoves.  

According to Narciso, the item that generates the most income is the stove that sells for an average of 500 nuevos soles each.  There are times when he has a lot of work and in order to deliver promptly, he hires people to help with his work.  The thing he likes best about his work is helping customers when they lose their keys because they see him as their savior.  He has done this work for 20 years and he thinks the most difficult thing is to have to wait for customers all day in his store.  In the future, he wants to continue working with the same effort with the goal of succeeding in life.

He is a member of the community bank Virgen María and this is his second loan with MFP.  He is happy to know that he will have the financial support that he needs.  On the other hand, he promises once again to make his payments on time, as he has done with his past loans.  He is thankful to be part of his community bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people.  

When Narcisco receives your support, he will invest the loan in the purchase of materials to construct metal objects.

loans.use: to purchase materials for his metal shop.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat, 64, has operated his retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last twelve years. He is married to Esther and they have two school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of their field officers and this will be his third loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more goods to sell in his retail shop.

In the future, Josphat hopes to grow his retail shop to wholesale.

loans.use: to buy more retail goods to sell.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is a 31-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with six children between two months and 12 years old. The youngest child is not yet in school. Her husband works as a moto taxi driver

For the past 10 years, she has sold foodstuffs.  The business has enabled her to feed her children and meet the overall needs of family.

She needs a loan to buy more foodstuffs such as sorghum. She will save all future profits and continue paying school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs like sorghum to sell

loans.name: Makepesi Business Association Group

texts.en:
Aubrey is 40 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school.  He also cares for one dependent. He resides in Gweru.   Aubrey runs a retail business selling beverages and employs one person. The business has been in operation for five years. The main challenges he faces are low stock due to lack of capital, electricity cuts, and cost of operating a generator. 

Aubrey is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase stocks of beer. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to improve his family's standard of living by having more disposable income. In the future, Aubrey plans to have a bigger and better business with more employees.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of liquor for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chicks for poultry farming.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia de 43 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijo en su casa propia,  cuenta con servicios sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de la Matanza que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Toda esta zona sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

Aurelia se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chicha de jora (es una bebida rica elaborada a base de maíz y  muy consumida en el norte del Perú),esta actividad lo realiza desde hace 6 años, ya que es una costumbre que ha pasado de generación en generación. Últimamente se ha incrementado las ventas de la chicha de jora en la zona donde vive, lo que le ha favorecido para poder incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  

Teniendo la oportunidad de crecer Aurelia a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de harina de maíz para la elaboración de chicha de jora, con la finalidad de obtener mayores ganancias, sus clientes aumenten para solventar el crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Aurelia, 43, lives with her husband and child in her own home.  The only utility she has in her home is electricity, and she lives in a rural area of the Matanza district, which is in the department of Piura.  In this area, the population works mainly in agriculture and livestock. 

Aurelia has a business making and selling chicha de jora (a traditional Peruvian drink made from a base of corn.)   She has been doing this work for 6 years, because it is a tradition that has been passed down from generation to generation.  Lately the sale of chicha de jora has increased in the area where she lives, which has enabled her to increase her income and improve her family's quality of life.  

Having the opportunity to grow her business, Aurelia has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 Peruvian soles to buy a large quantity of corn flour to make chicha de jora.   Her goal is to have more customers and higher earnings so that she can pay off this loan and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn flour to continue making her chicha de jora and beer

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is an active lady and performs her household responsibilities by staying at home. Besides her household work she also crafts embroidery on clothes for her neighboring clients. 
 
Her husband operates a small medical store where he sells regular medicines to his customers. He is very fair in his rates and makes good sales and profits every month. 
 
Sakina is the mother of 8 children: her eldest son is an electrician while others are enrolled in a local school and getting their education.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will purchase medicines in bulk to be able to fulfill the customer demands and increase his sales and profits.  

He is well experienced in his business and Sakina hopes that an investment will be profitable one for his business.

loans.use: to buy medicines for selling.

loans.name: Nely

texts.es: Nely  de 53 años es viuda y tiene un hijo en la edad de 30 años. Ella vive al suroccidente de Barranquilla donde  vende mercancía variada, negocio que inició cuando por la necesidad de generar ingresos, su amiga le dejó una mercancía para que la vendiera y ganara dinero; allí empezó su aventura de negocios, que ha extendido hasta el día de hoy,  con la comercialización de una gran variedad de productos que compra directamente y muchas veces mediante guías especializadas. Su negocio crece diariamente porque su clientela se ha fidelizado y hace pedidos a los que no puede responder oportunamente, esa es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará nuevas líneas de productos como prendas de vestir, que vienen en las revistas con grandes descuentos para el fin de año. Su sueño es tener una casa propia y ampliar su negocio para lograr mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Nely is 53 years old and a widow. She has a son who’s 30 years old. She lives southwest of Barranquilla where she sells various merchandise. She started the business because she needed the income. Her friend gave her merchandise in order to sell it and earn money. That’s how she began her business venture which has continued to this day with the purchase of a great variety of products that she buys directly and many times through specialty vendors. Her business grows every day because her clientele has been loyal, and they have orders that they cannot fill conveniently. That is the reason she comes to Kiva, first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will buy new product lines like clothing that comes from catalogues with major discounts for the end of the year. Her dream is to have her own home and to grow her business and get better income.

loans.use: to buy clothing that comes from catalogues with major discounts.

loans.name: María Clementina

texts.es:
María de 57 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su esposo e hijo, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona de actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

María cuenta con su negocio de comida la misma que a colocado al frente de un banco, actividad que realiza desde hace varios años, sus clientes son las personas que trabajan en el banco y transitan por esa zona, es conocida por la limpieza y la buena sazón que tiene, con los ingresos que adquiera podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida. Su esposo es zapatero actividad con la ayuda también económicamente en su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1500 nuevos soles para implementar su negocio con la compra de más insumos, mesas y sillas para seguir brindando un buen servicio a sus clientes, ya que se han ido incrementando y con sus ganancias cubrir sus gastos familiares.  María con su trabajo y sus ganas de salir adelante se ha ganado el respeto y la fidelidad de sus clientes, con la finalidad de que más adelante tenga su propio local y pueda brindarle otras oportunidad académica a su hijo.
texts.en:
María is 57 years old and lives in her own house, which has all the basic services, with her husband and child. It is located in the urban area of the district of Tambogrande which belongs to the department of Piura. The area is noted for its agriculture, livestock and crafts.

Maria has a food business which she has run for several years and which is located in front of a bank. Her customers are people who work at the bank and pass through the area. She is well-known for her cleanliness and tasty food. With the income she earns, she wlll be able to have a better quality of life. Her husband is a cobbler which also helps her financially with the household. 

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles (PEN) to consolidate her business with the purchase of more supplies, tables and chairs to continue offering her customers good service, as the number of customers has been increasing and with the income she can cover the family expenses. Maria with her hardwork and desire to succeed has earned the respect and loyalty of her customers, with the view to in the future having her own premises and offering her child other academic possibilities.

loans.use: to buy more supplies, tables and chairs in order to continue offering customers good service.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
This is Leticia, 53, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Ramon, a vendor, and a mother to their three children.  She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Leticia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Leticia hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Guillermina Arely

texts.es:
Guillermina, necesita surtir el negocio D. la tienda además D. comprar materiales para la elaboración D. loza, por eso está nuevamente solicitando un préstamo, el cual invertirá en aceite, harina, gaseosas, leña, nacazcol, loza cruda. Esta inversión ayudara a que Guillermina pueda aumentar los productos en la tienda y mantener lo necesario para la producción D. ollas, comales, sartenes D. barro.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo en su momento para tener la mercadería deseada, además que sus ventas fueron mejorando, D. esta misma manera espera que esta nueva inversión traiga  mejoras para la familia.
texts.en:
Guillermina needs to stock her store as well as purchase materials to make earthenware.  For this reason, she is requesting another loan which she will invest in oil, flour, sodas, firewood, nacazcol [black dye used for making pottery], unfinished ceramics.  This will help her to increase the stock in her store and maintain a stock of materials she needs to make pans, griddles and pots out of clay.  

The previous loan helped her to have the merchandise she wanted at that time.  It also helped increase her sales and in the same way, she hopes that this new loan will bring better things for her family.

loans.use: purchase oil, flour, sodas, firewood, nacazcol, unfinished ceramics.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
El señor Alexander, tiene 37 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos,  reside en  una Comunidad rural del Municipio de Siguatepeque, Comayagua.
Su núcleo familiar esta compuesto por su esposa y sus 3 hijos (18, 15, y 12 años), actualmente uno de sus hijos esta  estudiando la educación primaria.
La actividad económica a que se dedica es la agricultura, específicamente producción de hortalizas (producción de tomate), desde hace 16 años se dedica a trabajar la tierra propia, la que obtuvo  por una herencia familiar.
Don Alexander es muy optimista ya que sus tierras son muy fértiles y apropiadas para la producción agrícola.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos y pago mano de obra para realizar la cosecha.
Espera ahorrar una parte de sus ingresos para crearles un patrimonio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alexander, 37, has three children.  He lives in a rural community in the Municipality of Siguatepeue, Comayagua.  His nuclear family is composed of his wife and three children (18, 15 and 12 years old); one of his sons is currently attending elementary school.

His economic activity is farming, specifically growing vegetables (tomatoes).  He’s been farming on his own lands that he acquired through a family inheritance for 16 years.

Alexander is very optimistic because his land is very fertile and appropriate for farming.  He is currently asking for a loan to buy supplies and to pay labor costs to bring in the harvest.  He hopes to save part of his income to create an estate for his children.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Talaileva

texts.en:
Talaileva is a married mother of 41 with 8 children.


Talaileva owns & operates a business venture, taxi service. She has 4 years of experience in this business. Talaileva needs a loan of WST $2500 to maintain vehicle. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be $300WST or US$125 per week) to make improvements to her house.

Talaileva joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Talaileva's 5th loan with SPBD.




*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score". For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to maintain her vehicle

loans.name: Ivonne

texts.es:
Ivonne forma parte del Banco comunal “Volver a Empezar” perteneciente a la comuna de Puente Alto.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio desde hace 16 años. Tiene un local en un persa y feria libre, en donde vende artículos eléctricos, entre cables de audio, conexiones para computadores, adaptadores y accesorios para video juegos. 
Ella trabaja los días martes, miércoles, viernes y domingo, entre las ferias libres y persa. 
Con el crédito comprará artículos de electrónica para abastecer su negocio durante la temporada de navidad. Comenta que debe comprar el triple de mercadería que compra usualmente, debido a la demanda de artículos durante el periodo de fiestas.
Una de sus metas es tener un local comercial establecido. 
Ivonne vive junto a su marido y sus siete hijos de 24,20, 19, 17, 13, 12, 7 años de edad. Comenta que su marido también tiene un puesto en la feria, en el cual repara y vende artículos para celulares.
Ella comenta que uno de sus sueños a nivel familiar son obtener su casa propia, para esto se encuentra ahorrando dinero junto a su marido.
Ivonne está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. 
Además comparte experiencias y actividades con los demás integrantes del grupo del Banco comunal. 
Respecto a las capacitaciones ha aprendido a mantener su negocio. Lo cual le brindado una estabilidad económica. 
Comenta además que la ayuda entregada por Fondo esperanza no es solo monetaria, sino que ha sido un apoyo integral. 
Puente Alto es una comuna ubicada al norte de Santiago, capital de Chile. Fue fundada como un pequeño pueblo rural a fines del siglo XIX, pero dado su crecimiento demográfico es actualmente una de las comunas con mayor población de Chile, superando los 600 mil habitantes. Es la puerta de entrada a uno de los sectores precordilleranos de la región Metropolitana, conocido como el Cajón del Maipo, sector con espacios de caminatas, cabalgatas, rafting, entre otras actividades y servicios de alojamiento y alimentación.
texts.en:
Ivonne is part of the “Volver a Empezar” (To Begin Again) communal bank in the commune of Puente Alto.  She has been a merchant for 16 years.  She has a stand in a free street market and in a swap meet where she sells electrical items like audio cables, computer cables, adapters and video game accessories.  She works Tuesday, Wednesday, Friday and Sunday between the two types of markets.

She will use the loan to buy electrical items to stock her business for the Christmas season.  She comments that she must buy three times the usual amount of merchandise due to high demand during the festive season.  One of her goals is to have a fixed commercial locale.

Ivonne lives with her husband and seven children who are 24, 20, 19, 17, 13, 12 and 7 years old.  She comments that her husband also has a stand in the market where he repairs and sells mobile phone equipment.

She comments that one of her dreams on the family side is to have a house of her own and she and her husband are saving money for this.  Ivonne is very happy and grateful for the support provided by Fondo Espinoza since it’s allowed her to invest in her business.

She shares experiences and activities with the other members of the communal bank.  With respect to the training, she’s learned how to manage her business which has led to economic stability.  She also comments that the help she gets from Fondo Esperanza isn’t only monetary but has been an integral support.

Puente Alto is a commune located in north Santiago, capital of Chile.  It was founded as a small rural town at the end of the 19th century but due to its population growth it’s now one of Chile’s most populous communes with more than 600,000 inhabitants.  It is the entryway to one of the Andean foothill areas in the metropolitan region known as Maipo Canyon, an area with hiking paths, bridle trails, rafting and other activities and lodging and food services.

loans.use: to buy electronic items to stock her business for Christmas.

loans.name: Norma Elena

texts.es: Norma Elena tiene 35 años de edad, su actividad económica es una  pulpería que la tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación es una emprendedora que ha iniciado con mucho esfuerzo su propio negocio. Este negocio le ha permitido con las ganancias que obtiene apoyar a su familia y sacar a sus dos hijos adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Norma Elena está solicitando crédito para poder invertir en su inventario lo cual comprara granos básicos, aceite, pasta de diente, desodorante, huevos, entre otros productos derivados, esto permitirá que sus clientes la visite por su variedad de producto que le ofrecerá.
texts.en:
Norma Elena is 35 years old.  Her economic activity is a grocery store located at home.  She is an entrepreneur who has started her own business with much effort.  This business’ profits have made it possible for her to support her family and move her two children forward with much effort.

Norma Elena is asking for a loan to invest in stock inventory.  She will buy basic grains, oil, toothpaste, deodorant and eggs, among other products which will cause her customers to visit her thanks to the wide variety of products she’ll offer.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Buribek

texts.ru: Последние годы Бурибек занимается выращиванием и продажей сельхозпродуктов. Он трудолюбивый и честный человек, женат и ответственный отец шестерых детей. Его семья очень большая и он старается содержать их в хороших условиях жизни. Бурибек выращивает овощи, такие, как лук, морковь и картошку. С детства он привык работать на земле, так как он вырос в деревне. Бурибек хотел бы получить займ в размере 3000 Сомони для покупки ГСМ, минеральных удобрений, семян и прополку. Он надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Buribek has been growing and selling produce for the last several years. He is an industrious and honest person. He is married, and a responsible father of six children. His family is vary large, and he tries to provide a good quality of life for them. Buribek grows vegetables, such as onions, carrots, and potatoes. Since childhood he has been accustomed to working on the land, as he grew up in the countryside. Buribek would like to recieve a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy gas and oil, fertilzers, seeds, and weeding. He looks forward to your help and kindness.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer, seeds, fuel and weeding

loans.name: Apolinario

texts.en: Apolinario, 31 years old, lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children. Apolinario is providing motorela [a motorcycle encased in a carriage with two rows of seats facing each other], or motorcycle, services. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the services. Apolinario is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Apolinario hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for a motorela service

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: LAURA: Es una señora alegre y amable de 41 años de edad, casada con 3 hijos adolescentes que estudian su secundaria. Su esposo trabaja como conductor. Desde hace más de 15 años estableció una pequeña tienda de zapatos y ropa nueva, en un tramo que alquila en uno de los mercados del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Anteriormente era integrante de un grupo solidario y gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por PANA PANA y financiados por KIVA, le han permitido adquirir garantías y solicita su primer crédito en la modalidad de individual, para comprar en Managua: Blusas, faldas, camisetas, ropa interior, entre otros productos y venderlos a precios accesibles a su clientela de Bilwi. Ella sueña con ser una comerciante exitosa.

loans.use: para comprar en Managua: Blusas, faldas, camisetas, ropa interior, entre otros productos

loans.name: Cruzche Iii Group

texts.en:
34 year old Paulina, who is a member of the group, is married with eight children who range in age from 2 months to 15 years old. She needs to work hard to support her large family and has two businesses. She has an animal husbandry business and raises chickens and pigs. In addition, she works with palm leaves of the area and fabricates bottle covers of palm leaves as well as palm hats. She  takes orders for her palm creations and delivers them weekly.  Paulina is requesting a loan to buy a large quantity of palm leaves and supplies so that she will have plenty of raw materials available.

Paulina and her friends in the “Cruzche III” Trust Bank feel fortunate to participate in the monthly educational trainings of the Trust Bank when a Facilitator shares beneficial information with them in their own language. As the ladies have had little or no formal education, they are very grateful to obtain knowledge about important and relevant themes including business administration, family matters, women’s issues and empowerment. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of education and loans “Microcredit Plus” and it is most effective.

KIVA investors from around the world are valued partners with Friendship Bridge in the lives of Paula and the members of the “Cruzche III” Trust Bank.
