They are on the path towards a more prosperous future, benefitting themselves, their families and their families in Santa Cruz El Quiche, Guatemala! Thank you!

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of palm leaves and supplies so that she will have plenty of raw materials to make hats.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is a very optimistic person, after he left the alcoholism since more than 16 years ago, Ismael promised never return to the addictions again, and also he wants to demonstrate to his family that is an useful and very hard-working person. He started his own business since 15 years ago and he is working to the production of metal pieces business, which are used for the production of quarry figures. Ismael has demonstrated his complete recovery from the addictions and he continues demonstrating his great love for his family.

He requires a loan of $475 USD. to purchase raw materials, which helped him to increase the production of metallic pieces, his job has increased constantly, but he comments that he does not have the capacity to cover his demand. He wants to continue demonstrating the love for his family and for the life, he requests your help and also he thanks your support.

** \\\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\\\"

Ismael es una persona muy tenaz y optimistas, después de haber dejado el alcoholismo hace ya más de 16 años, Ismael prometió que jamás volvería a regresar a las adicciones y quiere demostrar a su familia que es una persona útil y muy trabajadora. Comenzó su propio negocio hace 15 años y se dedica a la fabricación de piezas de metal, las cuales se utilizan para la producción de figuras de cantera. Ismael ha demostrado su completa recuperación de las adicciones y sigue demostrando su gran amor a la familia.

El requiere de un préstamo de $475 USD. para comprar insumos que le ayudaran a aumentar la producción de piezas metálicas, su trabajo ha aumentado constantemente pero no tiene la capacidad para atender el incremento de su demanda. El quiere seguir demostrando el amor por su familia y por la vida, pide de tu ayuda y agradece tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Kezia

texts.en:
Kezia is married with two children, she started her business with capital of $1100 which she borrowed from the group in 2005. Since then she has expanded the business. She has been trained by Rafode in business management and loan utilization.

Given the loan she intends to purchase additional stock to enable her to serve a variety of clients.

loans.use: purchase of additional stocks for her business

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Yim S. is 42 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. One child is at home and one is in school. Yim makes her living by weaving clothes and selling them to retailers, and earns around $2.50 per day. Her husband is a body guard and contributes his entire salary to the household every month.

S. hopes to use this loan to create more clothes, which are in great demand from her clients. She will use her earnings to repair her home, which was damaged during the rainy season. In the future, she hopes to save enough money to buy a weaving machine to facilitate her business and to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and to repair their home

loans.name: Anjay

texts.en:
Anjay T. is forty-five years of age and married with four children. He started his business after dropping out of school twenty-five years ago. He owns a small business at the center of Makeni town of Sierra Leone and deals mainly in selling music tapes. He used the profit earned from his first loan for the education of his children and made a promise to himself that his children will not drop out of school like he did.

A hardworking man, he has been able to repay his loans on time and is determined to improve the general welfare of his family. Anjay requests larger loan to increase his inventory and selection to attract more customers.

loans.use: Increase inventory and selection of music tapes

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
Eusebia is 56 years old and lives in the town of Tampico, Tamaulipas. She is married and has three children; only the youngest daughter remains single. Her husband is a mason and with the salary that he receives, it was impossible for the children to keep studying. In order to give them this opportunity, Eusebia began her own business twelve years ago with grocery sales. She set up a place in front of her home to open her shop. Little by little she improved her business to meet the needs of her clients. The good work that she did has allowed her to continue the business for so long.

Now Eusebia needs a loan of $375 that she will use to purchase merchandise and give her store a better supply. She promises to repay this amount in five months. You can be an important part in the development of this business. Choose to support Eusebia; she sincerely appreciates your help.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Eusebia tiene 56 años de edad, vive en la localidad de Tampico, Tamaulipas, está casada y tiene tres hijos, solo la menor está soltera. Su esposo es albañil y con el salario que recibe era imposible que sus hijos continuaran estudiando, para poder darles esa posibilidad Eusebia inició su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes hace 12 años, acondicionando un lugar frente a su casa para abrir su tienda, poco a poco fue surtiendo mejor su negocio para cubrir todas las necesidades de sus clientes, el buen trabajo que realiza le ha permitido continuar en el negocio por tanto tiempo.

Ahora Eusebia necesita un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para tener un mejor surtido, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 5 meses. Tú puedes formar parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, decídete a apoyar a Eusebia, ella te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: Merchandise for grocery store.

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr:
A retailer of grocery products, Mrs. Amivi H. was born in Lome in the Gulf prefecture on November 12th, 1977. Married and the mother of three children, she has many responsibilities that she is unable to meet because her business is so small. She is also in charge of most of the household expenses because her husband's income as an accountant is insufficient. She is thus seeking a $1000 loan to build a stand and to expand her business; additional profit will allow her to improve her standard of living.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Revendeuse de produits alimentaires, Madame Amivi H. est née à Lomé dans la préfecture du Golfe le 12 novembre 1977. Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, elle a beaucoup de charges qu’elle n’arrive pas à satisfaire à cause de la petitesse de son commerce et aussi des charges du ménage dont elle règle la grande partie car les revenus de son mari comptable dans une société privée, ne suffisent pas. Elle sollicite ainsi un appui financier de $1000 pour construire un kiosque et agrandir son commerce et tirer de un bénéfice pouvant lui permettre d’améliorer son niveau de vie.

loans.use: Construction of a retail stand and stocking of grocery products

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Mrs. L. Ann married in 1986 and has one daughter, three years old. She learned to weave Kroma (Cambodian scarves) from her neighbor and started her own Kroma production in 2000. Her husband, Suon Soeurn, makes looms for villagers. He is currently also serving in the military in the province of Kandal. In the future, they hope that borrowing money from MAXIMA will help them to send their daughter to school to pursue a higher education.

She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time, in the amount of $500. She will use this money to expand her Kroma production by purchasing extra cotton fiber.

loans.use: Purchasing cotton fiber for producing Kroma (scarves)

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 25-year-old Angela M.. She is married with one child, aged 3. In 1998 Angela established a vegetable business. Angela has already received and successfully repaid three loans from SELFINA, and now requests a loan of $1050 in order to purchase additional stocks of onions, tomatoes, and potatoes in bulk. 

The Swahili word for this type of outside shop or stall is genge. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people usually send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of onions, tomatoes, and potatoes in bulk.

loans.name: Ni Wayan Suatri

texts.id:
Being not young anymore, 42 year old, does not make Ni Wayan Suatri lazy working. Not only because of economic needs, but also her responsibility to support the future of his child who just started first grade of high school. Ni Wayan Suatri realized that her husband's farming income could not support all her family's need anymore. So she wants to help her husband in bringing in extra income by starting a small pig farm in her home. Despite only using simple pig pen, she could farm several fattening pigs to be later slaughtered. From this small business profit, Ni Wayan Suatri realized significant benefit to her family's finances. Each fattening pig, farmed for 6 months, she could earn $66 profit, and it could help pay her child's tuition and save the rest for her old days. DINARI loans was used to buy more pigs and quality feeds so her product can satisfy customer and increase her profit.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Dalam usia yang tidak bisa dibilang muda lagi yaitu 42 tahun tidak membuat Ni Wayan Suatri menjadi malas dalam bekerja. Itu bukan saja karena tuntutan hidup, tetapi juga karena rasa tanggung jawabnya atas masa depan seorang anaknya yang masih harus ditanggungnya terutama dalam hal pendidikannya yang baru menginjak tahun pertama Sekolah menengah atas. Ni Wayan Suatri melihat bahwa penghasilan suaminya yang hanya seorang petani dengan penghasilan yang pas-pasan sudah tidak bisa lagi mencukupi keperluan keluarganya, sehingga timbul niatnya untuk membantu suaminya dalam memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya yaitu dengan memelihara ternak babi di rumahnya. Walaupun kandangnya sederhana tapi itu dirasanya sudah cukup untuk bisa memelihara beberapa ekor babi khususnya babi penggemukan. Dari usaha yang digelutinya ini Ni Wayan Suatri merasakan manfaat yang luar biasa terhadap kesejahteraan keluarganya, karena selain memiliki kesibukan setiap harinya, usahanya ini juga bisa memberikan keuntungan walaupun jumlahnya tidak begitu besar. Dari satu ekor babi penggemukan yang dipelihara selama enam bulan bisa menghasilkan keuntungan sekitar Rp 600.000,- dan itu bisa dipergunakannya untuk membiayai sekolah anaknya dan sebagian kecil disimpannya untuk tabungan di hari tuanya kelak. Pinjaman yang diperolehnya dari DINARI dipergunakannya untuk menambah jumlah babi penggemukan dan juga pengadaan pakan yang berkualitas supaya hasilnya bisa memuaskan dan meningkatkan keuntungannya.

loans.use: Purchase piglets and feeds

loans.name: Las Flores, Group 1

texts.en:
Fausta is a 40-year-old woman who lives her two children and husband in the community of Los Alcarrizzos on the outskirts of Santo Domingo. She sells new clothing to her community members, and is asking for this loan so that she can have enough capital to purchase a larger quantity of clothes, have more to offer her clients, and consequently, turn a higher profit each week.

She is an incredibly hard-working woman, someone who has worked since she was only 7 years old! She works hard to improve her business, but also to take care of her children and make sure that they are raised in a safe and healthy home.

When Fausta has a bit of free time she loves to hang out with her children and husband, listen to music, or read Spanish literature.

On behalf of everyone at Esperanza International, and on behalf of Fausta, thank you for your support!

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Odinagul

texts.ru:
Odinagul Sattarova lives in the town of Vahdat. She is 44 years old, married and has six children. She has secondary education and is in the agriculture business. Every year she sows a small plot of land with wheat. This gives her family daily bread and flour, which is expensive to buy. Odinagul plans to sow the land with wheat and have a good harvest. She will stock up with seeds and sell the rest on the market. For a good harvest she needs to buy high quality seeds and mineral fertilizer and decided to apply for a loan. She will pay off the loan within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

Сатторова Одинагул жительница города Вахдат. Возраст клиентки 44 года. Замужем , имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Одинагул занимается земледелием .Она каждый год засеивает свой небольшой участок пшеницей.Это дает ее семье не покупать на рынке муку и готовый хлеб,что обходится ее семье очень дорого.Клиентка планирует засееть пшеницей землю и собрать хороший урожай.Запастись зерном ,а лишнее продать на рынке .Но что бы получить хороший урожай нужные качественные семеня пшеницы и минеральные удобрения.. Одинагул решила взять кредит и планирует погасить его в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy seeds of wheat and fertilizer

loans.name: Gouy Gui Group

texts.fr:
This request for a loan comes from the eco-village Keur goumak, which is located in the Diourbel region, Mbacké county, in the rural community of Dendey. This region suffers from isolation, but also from poor soil and brackish water. The population can only get their food supply at the weekly market (IOUMA) which is held every Wednesday. This loan will improve the quality of life of the population of the area by making varied foodstuffs available to them.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Cette demande de pret vient de l'écovillage de Keur goumak, situé dans la région de diourbel, département de mbacké, communauté rurale de Dendey. cette région souffre de son enclavement mais aussi de la pauvreté des sols et la salinité de l'eau. la population ne peut s'appovisionner en vivres que lors du marché habdomadaire (lOUMA) qui a eu lieu tous lel mercredis. Ce pret leur permettra d'améliorer la qualité de vie des populations en leur offrant une alimentation variée.

loans.use:
furnishing the population daily with reasonably priced basic foodstuffs

Approvisionnement quotitidien de la population en denrées de première necessité à bon marché

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina A. is a hair dresser. She has many customers, and her services are in great demand. She is married, but her husband's income from the Sanitary Office at the University of Cape Coast does not cover the expenses for Regina and her two children.

Regina plans to use the loan as captial to expand her business.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Ms. Fatoumata C. is 38 years old, lives with her three children and her husband in a monogamous family in the village of Dialakoroba (Kati prefecture) in the Koulikoro region.

Very early on, she started making money due to not being able to attend school. After having worked at several things without success, she decided to become specialized in the commerce of various articles. She works in this business throughout the year and gets her supplies twice a month in Bamako, the capital of the Republic of Mali.

In order to obtain financial resources to enlarge her commercial business, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso program with which she has had an association for six years now. She is on her fourth individual loan, and all the previous ones have been repaid without a problem.

With this loan, she intends to buy 15 to 20 sacks of foodstuffs and condiments at the grand marketplace of Bamako. This monthly provision will be stocked in her home and sold by displaying them in front of her door to customers who are made up of women from her village and from neighboring villages. She is a specialist in having available the essential condiments that customers generally need. The goods are nicely arranged and packaged on the table. Sale are made at the retail level by request. She intends to realize a profit of 60,000 francs CFA per month, which will enable her to help cover family expenses, to pay the loan interest, and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Fatoumata C. est agée 38 ans , vit avec ses 3 enfants, et son époux dans une famille monogame dans le village de Dialakoroba Préfecture de Kati Région de Koulikoro.

Elle a commencé très tot les activités génératrices de revenus faute de n’avoir pas pu faire l’école .Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, elle décida de se spécialiser dans le commerce d’articles divers . Elle mène cette activité durant toute l’année et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois à Bamako capitale de la République du Mali.

Afin d’obtenir des ressources financières pour élagir son activité commerciale ,elle décida d’intégrer le programme de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel elle est en rélation depuis maitenant 6 ans. Elle est à son quatrième pret individuel et tous les précedents ont été remboursés sans difficultés. Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 15 à 20 sacs de denrées et condiments alimentaires au grand marché de Bamako. Cette provision mensuelle sera stockée chez elle afin de les vendre sur des étales devant sa porte à une clientèle constituée de femmes de son village et des villages environnants. Elle a la spécialité de disposer de l’essentiel des condiments alimentaires dont les clints ont généralement besoin. Les produits sont bien disposés et bien conditionnés sur une table. La vente se fait au détail à la demande. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 60.000 F CFA par mois qui lui permettra de contribuer aux dépenses de sa famille payer les intérêts du prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.

loans.use: To buy a large amount of condiments

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Ms. Gregoria R., who lives in the Barrio San Juan zone, formed this committee after contacting her friends and neighbors of the aforementioned zone. The group is comprised of 19 women of the same area. The women partake in different business activities, such as clothing sales, foodstuffs, cosmetics, farming, etc. They are requesting a loan of 300,000 Paraguay Guarani each in order to purchase clothing, basic need items, foodstuffs, and other goods to be sold.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Para la formación del presente comité fue la señora Gregoria R., ella vive en la zona del Barrio San juan, Esta Sra. contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité de dicha zona. El comité esta constituido por 19 señoras todas de la misma zona. Las señoras tienen actividades diferentes una de otra, como ser venta de ropas, comestible, cosméticos , granjera etc. Las señoras retiran un crédito de 300.000 C/U. Ellas Obtiene el crédito para la compra de ropas, artículo de primera necesidad, comidas y otros. Para su posterior venta.

loans.use: Purchase clothing, cosmetics, fabric, basic need items, and other goods

loans.name: Salha's Wakakamavu Group

texts.en:
Salha is 23 years and is married with a 2 years old child. She has been selling clothes since 2006. She works everyday from 10am to 6pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $37 from her sales.

In the past, Salha has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Salha now requests a loan to buy more clothes for her business for resale. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwanahija, who has a business selling bananas, cassavas and sweet potatoes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Leonilda

texts.es:
Leonilda es socia del Banco Comunal Sumaq Wasi que quiere decir Casa Bonita en quechua. Leonilda es madre soltera, tiene 51 años y 3 hijos de los cuales 2 son estudiantes, Leonilda vive en el distrito de Carmen Alto y su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado 12 de abril en el centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende papa de todas las variedades, olluco (tubérculo), sus productos los adquiere en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad. Además Leonilda cría animales menores como cuy, gallina en su casa y luego lo vende en el mismo mercado.

Leonilda necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa. Los sueños de Leonilda son que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales, tener capital propio y una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Leonilda is a member of the Sumaq Wasi Village Bank, which means “Pretty House” in Quechua. Leonilda is 51 years old and is a single mother with three children, two of whom are students. Leonilda lives in the Carmen Alto district, and her business is located in the 12 de Abril market which is in the center of the city of Ayacucho. There, she sells olluco (tuber) and potatoes of all varieties. She acquires her products in the city’s supply market. In addition, Leonilda breeds young animals like guinea pigs and hens in her home and then later sells them in that same market.

Leonilda needs a loan of 1,000 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of potatoes. Leonilda dreams that her children will grow up to become good professionals, that they will have their own capital and that they will have shops in their own homes.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Leonilda needs a loan of 1,000 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of potatoes.

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en:
Mrs. Ouk H. is a villager in Pnouv Lek Village in the Kampong Cham Province. She is a garment worker in a factory. Her husband Mr. Phon KimH. is a motorbike driver.

Even though they have differenct careers they do not make enough money to earn a good living. Therefore Mrs. Ouk H. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a Tuk Tuk cart. She wants to start a new business as a Tuk Tuk driver. She hopes this loan will increase her income and help to improve her living conditions.

She is 30 years old and the mother of one child. Her child is too young to work or study.

Her husband is on the right of photo.

loans.use: To buy a Tuk Tuk cart

loans.name: Roatha's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Raotha T. is a group leader of six members, who all live in the Angk Tnaot Kaeut village in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She owns 0.5 hectare farm, where she cultivates rice to sell. Her husband, Mr. Hang Sarun is a construction worker who earns a small amount of money for supporting the family. Although they have different businesses, they still cannot earn enough to support the family well. So Mrs. Raotha T. requests a loan to buy piglets to start a new pig-breeding business, which she hopes will increase her income. Mrs. Raotha T. is 37 years old and the mother of four children; three are enrolled in the local school, and the youngest one is 2 years old.

loans.use: Buy piglets to start a new breeding business

loans.name: Raymond Yaovi

texts.fr:
Monsieur A. Yaovi Raymond est un jeune de 24 ans qui vit à Adidomé. Très dévoué et étant très instruit, il s’est lancé dans le commerce de pagne qu'il vend de marchés en marchés et dans lequel il réussit bien. Pour sécuriser son revenu, il est impératif qu’il dispose d’un fond de roulement. C’est dans ce souci qu’il sollicite un crédit.
Ce crédit lui permettra de faire le stockage de toutes les variétés et qualités de pagnes afin d’élargir son étalage. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Mr. Yaovi Raymond A. is a young man, 24 years old, who lives in Adidomé. He is very devoted and, being well-educated, he got started in the commerce of pagnes (colorful West African cloth) that he sells from marketplace to marketplace. His is successful in his business. To secure his income, it is imperative that he has working capital. With this concern in mind, he is requesting a loan which will permit him to create an inventory of all the varieties and grades of pagnes to expand his display. The success of this project will enable him to improve his living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell "pagnes"

loans.name: Trinh Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Trịnh Thị Thủy  năm nay  35 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương năm 2008. hai vợ chồng chị Thủy hiện đều tham gia công việc buôn bán cá. Hàng ngày chồng chị đi lấy cá từ các ao nuôi cá của bà con về cho chị bán tại các chợ. Công việc ngày càng phát triển đem lại cho gia đình chị thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay  10.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc buôn bán cá của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Trịnh Thị Thủy is 35 years old. She joined TYM Fund in 2008. She and her husband both work in the fish sales. Each day, her husband gathers fish from the neighborhood's farm sites so that she can resell them at the markets. This business continues to grow and evolve bringing the family an income of 5,000,000 VND per month. This loan cycle, she hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND to reinvest in the family's fish selling business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business - Selling Fish

loans.name: Roci Magali

texts.es:
A sus cortos 21 años, Roci es una mujer, madre y esposa muy responsable y trabajadora. Junto con su esposo se encarga de manejar una pequeña empresa en la cual se dedica a la fabricación de ganchos de ropa. Estos productos los vende hace tres años al interior del país y a vendedores minoristas en diferentes provincias.

Paralelo a su negocio ella trabaja eventualmente para una empresa grande de ropa. Ella se encarga de confeccionar los acabados de diferentes prendas de ropa. Lo bueno de este trabajo es que le permite solventar gastos en temporadas donde los costos de estos suben, como Navidad y en feriados. Antes de casarse ella pudo estudiar computación en un instituto.

Actualmente tiene una hijita de un año y medio, esta casada y tiene planes de seguir creciendo en su empresa de ganchos para poder brindarle un futuro mejor para su hija.
texts.en:
At her 21 years of age, Roci is a very responsible and hardworking woman and wife. Together with her husband she manages a small business that manufactures clothes hangers. She has been selling these products for three years in the interior of the country as well as to small vendors in different provinces. Along with her business she also works sporadically for a large clothing company. She is in charge of the finishes on the different types of garments. The good thing about this work is that it allows her to cover her expenses during the seasons when costs are higher such as Christmas and during fairs. Before getting married she studied computing at an institute. She currently has a one and a half year old daughter and is married. She plans on continuing to expand her clothes hanger business in order to offer her daughter a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to manufacture clothes hangers.

loans.name: Petra

texts.en:
Petra used to work as a vegetable and fish vendor in her village.  But then she decided to shift into the poultry business wherein she raises broilers for 40 days.  Weekly, she can sell a maximum of 75 broilers and earn an average of PHP2,500.00.  She wants to improve her business for the of her two children who are in high school.  She wants to borrow a loan of PHP15,000.00 as additional capital in her poultry business, which will be of great help for her family.  She hopes that some day she will be successful in her venture.  

Petra is more empowered right now to strive hard for her family in order to achieve her goals in life. She believes that everything has a reason and purpose, she added. 

Petra is married to Conrado, a part-time carpenter in their village.  They have four children: the eldest is Sheila, already married, 28 years old, and a graduate with a B.S. in Education; Catherine, a college undergraduate in criminology who now works in a factory; Irene, 15 years old, a fourth-year high school student, and April Jane, 13 years old, a second- year high school student .

loans.use: Additional business capital

loans.name: Tohirjon

texts.ru: Насриддинов Тохирджон житель Гиссарского района. Возраст 29 лет, женат и имеет троих детей. Образование среднее. Работает на стройке . Кроме того занимается земледелием , на что  и запрашивает кредит. Имеет участок земли , который засеивает картофелем и другими овощами. Получаемую продукцию продает и получает за это доход. Планирует использовать кредит для покупки семян и удобрений. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 8 месяцев.
texts.en:
Tohirjon N. lives in the Gissar district. He is 29 years, married and has three children. He has a secondary education and works in construction. Besides this work, he is involved in agriculture, for which he is requesting a loan. Tohirjon owns a plot of land where he plants potatoes and other vegetables. He picks and sells the vegetables for profit. Tohirjon plans to use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer. He will be able to repay the loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati M. is forty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to three children who are all still in school. Some are in the senior high school while others are in the basic school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Fati works hard to make some income to support her husband and to provide for the family. She is a trader. She deals in provisions such as milk, sugar, candies, bread, etc. She procures the goods from the wholesale dealers in the regional capital, Cape Coast and sells in her community. Fati owns a shop by the road side in which she sells.

She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure more goods to stock her shop.

loans.use: To procure more goods to stock her shop

loans.name: Tausi's Group

texts.en:
N. Tausi is the chairperson of the Bugolo Zibulatudde Group in Kikondo, Lugazi. She is 43 years old, married with six children, and also cares for two more kids, all in school. She is a business lady with a business selling fish (mukene) for a living. She buys the fish from fishermen at a wholesale prices and sells to her customers at retail prices.

She has successfully completed the repayment of her previous loan and with this new loan, she intends to buy more small fish for sale to her ever-increasing customers. Her customers are in and around Lugazi district and she intends to look for additional customers as long as she can.

loans.use: Buying more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To produce and sell oil from palm nuts

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: "My friends encouraged me to go into business. What I do now is sell vegetables to earn a little income to support my family. I sell my vegetables in Tagbilaran City. I dream that someday I will have my own farm to grow vegetables to sell," says Norma C., 49-year-old mother of three children. Norma would like to ask for a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase more vegetables to sell. She is also interested in venturing into other lines of business. In this way, she will have enough money to support her children, especially in school. CEVI helps small businesses to grow. It provides its clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To puchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ousseynou

texts.fr: ousseynou D. est un imprimeur de profession qui a son bureau chez lui aux parcelles assainies de thies ;son activité consiste à faire des photocopies ,des plastifications,des reliures et des traitements de texte avec l'aide d'un de ses amis;avec le pret ,il veut acheter du matériel comme du papier ,des feuilles de plastification et de l'encre pour améliorer sa marge bénéficiaire
texts.en:
Ousseynou D. is a printer by trade, and he has his office in his home in the Parcelles Assainies neighborhood of Thies. His work consists in making photocopies, laminating, binding, and word processing with the help of one of his friends. With the loan, he wants to buy materials such as paper, laminating sheets, and ink so as to improve his profit margin.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of materials he needs to do his work

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es socia del Bancomunal Madres del Futuro.
María es conviviente tiene 44 años, dos hijos de 18 y 8 años, el mayor entro a la fuerzas Aéreas, y el ultimo está estudiando en la escuela estatal.
María trabajaba vendiendo en un colegio golosinas por más de cinco años, se retiro por que salió embarazada y dejo de trabajar con los ahorros compro un carro de segunda, con las ganancias compro  una moto-taxi, los cuales los da a trabajar.
Desde que María está en Finca  aprendió a desenvolverse en el negocio, a invertir  
María necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles, para pintar su carro y arreglo de motor para que pase la revisión técnica.
El sueño de María es poner un negocio de terapia física en su casa.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Madres del Futuro Community Bank. She is 44 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children aged 18 and 8. The older one is in the Air Force, and the younger one is still at school. María used to sell candy at a school for more than five years but stopped when she became pregnant. With her savings she bought a secondhand car, and then with the profit from that she bought a motor-taxi. She earns her living from these vehicles. Since María has been with Kiva partner Finca, she has learned how to run a business and how to invest her money. She needs a loan of 2600 soles to re-spray her car and fix the engine so that it will pass the motor vehicle inspection. Her dream is to open a physiotherapy business in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Re-spray her car and fix the engine

loans.name: Hakamadah's Group

texts.en: K. Hakamadah is the leader of this group in Buloba. He is 45 years old and has had a fishing business for over seven years. He is a father of six children, four of which are still in school and he cares for two grand children. Although he fishes himself, he owns two boats with two employees that pay him every day. He is a very hard working man.  He also has two cows and hopes to increase the number of his cows and boats from efficient use of his loans. Hakamadah is asking for a loan to help buy more fishing nets and hooks for his business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets and hooks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more maize and beans in bulk

loans.name: Erminia Isabel

texts.es: Erminia Isabel A. tiene 44 años. Tiene 3 hijos y ninguno depende de ella, la actividad económica es la compra y venta de cerdo. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Erminia inicia este negocio por la necesidad de obtener una fuente de ingresos, ella se dedica a ofrecer sus servicios de domestica, pero al no obtener el suficiente ingreso para su familia, decide dedicarse a esta actividad económica. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdo y materia prima. Su deseo es que sus hijos finalicen sus estudios y logren ser buenos profesionales para el día de mañana.
texts.en:
Erminia Isabel A. is 44 years old and has 3 adult children. For more than 5 years, she has been in the business of buying and selling pork. Erminia previously worked as a domestic employee, but her income was not enough to support her family so she decided to start this business so that she could earn more money.

The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to buy pork and supplies. She hopes that her children finish their studies so that they can become successful professional in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Ngozi is 27 years old. She is married and has two children. She sells sarongs and clothes of various colors and sizes. She is hoping for a loan of N140,000 to purchase more sarongs and clothes to sell. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and clothes to sell

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur a ouvert dans le quartier de Baguida à Lomé depuis 2001 un centre de blanchisserie ; cette activité lui permet surtout de subvenir aux besoins de sa femme et de son enfant. Beaucoup de clients apprécient le sérieux avec lequel il traite les vestes et la rigueur qu’il maintient dans son échéancier de remise des vestes et autres habits. Après 8 ans de vie professionnelle, il pense désormais procéder au réaménagement de son centre de blanchisserie ; pour cette raison, il a approché WAGES en vue d’obtenir un crédit pouvant lui permettre d’acheter une porte vitrée, de construire un hangar, d’acheter un autre séchoir à la mode et acquérir également d’autres accessoires indispensables. Ceci devrait d'aménager permettre d’aménager son atelier.
texts.en:
Mr. A. opened his laundry business in the Baguida neighborhood of Lomé in 2001. This activity allows him to support his wife and child. Many clients appreciate how responsibly he takes his work: both in the treatment of their suits and other clothing and the promptness of service. After eight years in business, he now wants to refurbish his establishment. For this reason, he approached WAGES to obtain a loan that would allow him to purchase a door with a window, to build a storage area, and acquire an additional clothes dryer and assorted other needed accessories. This would allow him to renovate his workplace.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a glass door, a clothes dryer and assorted cleaning supplies

loans.name: Luzonia

texts.en:
Luzonia resides in the village of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela and has already been widowed for six years. At the age of 47, she is still sending two of her children to elementary school. She has seven children and most of them are already married.

Luzonia is involved in retailing cosmetics and apparel from DXN Company, making a net profit which is already sufficient for her needs. She hopes to obtain a loan of PHP 3,000 to have additional revolving capital to further improve her business. She wants to have additional items to sell to her customers.

Luzonia still dreams of managing a general store someday. She couldn’t start her dream business so far due to insufficient capital. She hopes that someday, when she is capable of obtaining a larger loan, she will put her dreams into reality.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is 48 years old, married and has six children. She is a very happy woman, and uses her engaging personality to attract new customers to her stall in Warri, Delta state, where she makes a living selling colorful sarongs. Her goal is to be a major distributor of sarongs in her community. She has been in this business for a long time, and is applying for this loan to buy more sarongs to sell. She is doing well because the high season for her business has arrived, and business is good. She extends her thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Jonelyn

texts.en:
“If there’s a will, there’s a way” – words of encouragement from hardworking mother, Jonelyn D. V., of Barangay Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is the loving wife of Mr. Marcos D. V. and they are gifted with three children. Despite the hardships and difficulties of their life, they have strong faith and determination to improve their standard of living through patience and hard work.

As a way of earning income, her husband works as a caretaker in Jacintas Hotel and Resort while Jonelyn has a business buying and selling vegetables in their village. She buys vegetables from farmers and sells them at Solano Public Market and also house to house in their village. Her monthly income is 4,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) which they use for their daily needs and for the schooling of their children. Due to the high cost of commodities, she needs to increase her income to meet their daily needs, but she has little capital. Therefore, she applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP from Kiva lenders to be used to improve her small business. She believes that with patience and sacrifice she can improve her business.

loans.use: Additional capital for selling fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en: 49-year-old Herminia farms rice for a living. She is married and has 9 children. Her oldest is only 20 years old. Having a big family, she works extra hard to provide for their daily needs. She makes sure her farm is in the best condition so that it can produce quality harvests and thus sustain her family. She sought the help of CEVI to assist her financially. Her previous loans were used to finance her farm. She is now requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP. This loan will be used for farming supplies such as gasoline for the tractor, seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies for the farm. Receiving this loan is really helpful to Herminia and her family.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Micah Group

texts.en: Akua is fifty-two years old. She is divorced and has given birth to five children who are all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Takoradi. Takoradi is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the main occupation of the people there. Akua is a fish monger. She makes income mainly from this business to support her family. She is the leader of a village trust bank group called Micah. The members are all traders and food vendors who support their families through these businesses. They want to use the loan to purchase stock in bulk to avoid price hikes and also cut down on frequent travels. They are expecting to make higher profits this season to help pay their kids school fees. Your support would enable them grow their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Dieyla

texts.fr:
Madame Dieyla N. est une femme très  active de 52 ans qui habite à Ouakam.  Elle  est très connue a travers  sa fidélité et sa régularité au sein de l’U-IMCEC a la caisse de   Ouakam. En même temps qu’elle a démarré  ses activités  elle a aussi commence a travailler avec l’institution jusqu'à nos jours. Son activité  primaire est la commercialisation de légumes  et de produits locaux. Ce  qui l’a pousse a opte pour cette activité  c’est le fait qu’elle n’a jamais voulu rester oisive. Elle a toujours voulu gagner sa vie à la sueur de son front. Madame  N.  est veuve ayant en charge 6 enfants qui sont tous nourris et entretenus par elle-même. Elle est sociétaire  de la caisse de Ouakam depuis neuf ans et a déjà rembourse 9 prêts qui lui toujours permis de renforcer son capital, renforcer son activité primaire et même  créé  une activité de commerce de produits cosmétiques et divers  qu’elle se procure généralement  au Maroc. C’est une fierté  pour Madame Dieyla de voyager, d’être en contact avec beaucoup de gens, de découvrir  d’autres cultures. Elle est parent  bénéficiaire.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  a exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dieyla N., aged 52, is a very active woman who lives in Ouakam. She is well known and appreciated in the Ouakam branch of U-IMCEC, due to her loyalty and regularity. At the same time she launched her business, she became a client with our institution. Her primary activity is selling vegetables and local products. She chose this activity because she did not want to ever lead an idle life. She always wanted to make a living by the sweat of her brow.

Mrs. N. is a widow who provides alone for her six children. She has been a member of our Ouakam branch for nine years and repaid on schedule already nine loans. These loans enabled her to boost her working capital and bolster her primary business. They even enabled her to launch another activity, which is selling cosmetics and similar items that she usually buys in Morocco. Mrs. N. is proud to travel, be in contact with many people and discover other cultures. She will be the beneficiary of this loan.

Always looking to actively participate in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC – with the positive support of lenders – succeeds in supporting women in revenue-generating activities which promote valuable socioeconomic development.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Mirada De Luz Group

texts.en:
Village Bank “Mirada de Luz” (View of Light) comprises 17 persevering members from the city of Talca.  Talca is a city in the region of Maule, in central Chile.  Most Maule residents work in rural areas, where they tend to farms and grow crops.  The region is best known for its colonial architecture and artisanal exports, in addition to its wineries.  Nevertheless, because the working population there has grown significantly, the region remains one of the poorest in Chile.

The main businesses run by the members of this village bank include ceramic work, jewelry making, shoe repair, clothing sales, and dressmaking workshops. 

Verónica, the founder of village bank “Mirada de Luz,” is pictured above in the first row, wearing black pants and a black shirt.  She buys and sells children’s clothing door-to-door.  Verónica also sells underwear and cheese, and she makes and sells pearl bracelets.  She has two children studying at the university level.  Her husband also works at his own independent business because he lost two of his fingers in an accident and had difficulty finding work because of this.  

Verónica plans to invest her portion of the group loan in merchandise.  Her dreams are to grow her business and have a store of her own in the city center, so that she can find economic stability that will help her maintain her quality of life as she ages.

For Verónica, Fondo Esperanza and her village bank, “Mirada de Luz,” have been a great moral help in addition to helping her economically.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and supplies

loans.name: Emelita's Group

texts.en:
Emelita P. is from the village of Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. She is 49 years old. Emelita is the leader of a 3-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Emelita is married and has 2 school-aged children. Emelita owns & operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income is the manufacture of bamboo products which are sold to local businesses and community members. Emelita has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Emelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Emelita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Emelita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna P. is from the village of Magsaysay, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Lorna owns and operates a store, selling rice in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2001, Lorna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 12th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy soft-drinks, water, dairy products, meats, beans, cheese, rice, sugar, candles, soups, churros, bread, cookies, sardines, salt, and spices.

loans.name: Tumama

texts.en:
Tumama L. is 48 and married with 5 children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale.  Tumama has 3 years of experience in this business.  Tumama needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Tumama joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Tumama's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Tumama L. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.8 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Blanca Elvira

texts.es:
La señora  Blanca P. es socia del banco comunal El Mirador, vive en  el sector la autopista en la parroquia Turi que quiere decir  "hermano" en quichua, esta localidad está ubicada en  una colina empinada, desde donde podemos disfrutar de  una vista espectacular de las luces de la ciudad en el atardecer y noche, así como apreciar la belleza natural de su cadena montañosa  que lo rodean.

Nuestra socia tiene 56 años de edad se encuentra casada y en su unión ha concebido 8 hijos quienes se encuentran de 31, 30, 29, 27, 24, 22, 16 años de edad, cinco de sus hijos son casados y viven independientes, sus hijos de 27 y 24 años solteros trabajan en una fábrica de calzado y le ayudan económicamente con los gastos del hogar, su última  hija estudia en un colegio de la localidad, su esposo trabaja en una carpintería  y ella se dedica a la cría y venta  de cuyes, pollos en su comunidad  manteniendo un ingreso adicional para cubrir las necesidades de su hogar  y también es para el consumo en su casa , gracias al  sacrificio del  trabajo mutuo lograron  edificar  su casa propia.

Lleva dos ciclos trabajando con  los prestamos de la Fundación gracias a la invitación que le hizo su consuegra a formar parte de éste grupo de mujeres emprendedoras para buscar la superación personal y familiar, con el  nuevo crédito comprará crías de cuyes y alimento para incrementar su criadero. Su sueño es que si le va bien en la venta  de sus animales va a crear otro piso de su casa para agrandar su criadero.
texts.en:
Blanca P. is a member of the communal bank El Mirador. She lives in the Autopista sector of the Turi parish, which means 'brother' in Quechua. This place is located on a steep hill, where one can enjoy a spectacular view of the city in the afternoon and at night and appreciate the natural beauty of the mountain range that surrounds it. Our member is 56 years old and is married with 8 children (31, 30, 29, 27, 24, 22 and 16 years old). 5 of her children are married and live independently. The children who are 27 and 24 are single and worked in a shoe factory and help with the household costs, and her youngest daughter studies in a college in the region. Blanca's husband is a carpenter and she works raising and selling guinea pigs and chickens in her community, giving additional income to cover the necessities of their home, and also for consumption in their home. Thanks to the sacrifices of their mutual work they have been able to have their own home. Blanca has been working with loans from Fundación for 2 loan cycles, thanks to the invitation from her mother-in-law to become part of this group of empresarial woman, in search of improving her family and personal situation. With the new loan she will purchase guinea pigs to breed and feed to increase her breeding place. Her dream is that sales go well. She is going to create another level in her house to increase her breeding room.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase guinea pigs and feed

loans.name: Teap

texts.en: Teap M. is 40 years old and lives with her husband in Takeo province. She makes cow ties and sells them to the local market to earn approximately US$10 in revenue each day. Her husband is a moto-taxi driver who earns, on average, US$3 every day. This couple has four children living at home to support. Teap M. would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to purchase ties and more materials to make more cow ties.

loans.use: to make cow ties

loans.name: Silva

texts.en: Silva M. is from the villiage of Saralandj in Shirak Marz in the Republic of Armenia.  She is an accountant by training with a high school education.  Silva is married with a daughter and 2 sons.  She has other relatives in the town of Artik who she helps by providing fresh vegetables.  She has been involved in agricultural work for over 18 years and enjoys working with the land.  Currently her daughter studies at the State University of Yerevan in the capital of Armenia.  Her 2 sons are studying in primary school.  It has been difficult for Silva to raise the investment required to grow her small livestock and vegetable production business and support her childern’s education.  Therefore, Silva is looking for an $800 loan to increase the number of cattle and purchase seed.  From her business plan she is expecting a 20% increase in her income with the increase of her livestock and vegetable growing businesses.  This additional income will allow her to continue supporting her daughter’s education.  Silva is fond of her village, Saralandj, where she was born and is fortunate to have most of her closest relatives living near her family.

loans.use: Fertilizers, Seed and Animal Feed

loans.name: Mariesol

texts.en: Mariesol S.'s main source of income comes from selling both food and daily use products in her community. She runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop). Mariesol is 46 years old, married and has six school-aged children. They are from the village of San Andres, Kadingilan, Bukidnon. Mariesol has been in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Mariesol joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase inventory and for working capital. Mariesol is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chourb

texts.en:
Chourb B., 26, is married and resides with her husband and a young child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She and her husband sell fruits for an income of USD 8 per day. 

B. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to repair her house. In the future, she would like to start a business of buying recyclable materials to resell.  This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Sabineh Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Sabineh” group. They are small-scale-business women based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Haja K. (pictured left). She is age thirty-two and was born in Makeni city where she and her husband and three children are currently residing. Her husband is a photographer and one of her children is in primary school, another is in secondary and the youngest is not of school-going age.

Haja has had many years of experience in business. She sells soaps and Vaseline. With her share of the loan, she will buy more bars of soap and tins of Vaseline to sell.

loans.use: To buy more bars of soap and tins of Vaseline to sell

loans.name: Maria Cristy

texts.en:
Maria Cristy L. is from the village of  Kidahon Malinao, Gingoog City. She is 27 years old. Maria Cristy is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Maria Cristy owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Maria Cristy has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maria Cristy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Cristy is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Maria Cristy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo D. C. is from the village of Sta Cruz, Poblacion, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Nore. He is 50 years old, married and has 5 children. Edgardo owns and operates a vulcanizing / welding shop. Edgardo has been engaged in his business for 11 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2007, Edgardo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edgardo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to purchase materials for his business. Edgardo is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Edgardo from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

loans.name: Julia Alexandrina

texts.es:
Julia de 62 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (zona urbana, con una ecología en reconstrucción), ella tiene una pequeña tienda de confites. 

Tuvo su negocio porque en el sector por donde vive no había tienda de confites ni de dulces, comenzó a vender dulces y confites, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo tener su propio local, ahora se levanta a las 08h00am hasta las 17h00 todos los días. 

Para poder continuar con mas clientela el necesita comprar con el préstamo confites y dulces y así satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. En el futuro quiere tener mas locales de dulces.
texts.en:
Julia, 62, lives in La Primavera de Duran (an urban zone that is recovering ecologically). She has a small sweets shop. She opened her business because there were neither sweets nor candy shops in her neighborhood. She started to sell candy and sweets and gradually was able to have her own store. Now, she is open for business daily from 8am until 5pm. To continue expanding her customer base she needs a loan to buy more sweets and candies to meet their demand. In the future she’d like to have more candy stores.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For sweets.

loans.name: Julius Gichari

texts.en:
Julius Gichari W. is a 43-year-old gentleman who is married to Sarah Njeri; together they have two children. His primary business is running a butcher shop, but he also has a secondary business where he manages a taxi business. He has been a butcher for the past fifteen years, making 15,000 KES every month.

Julius joined KADET after some friends convinced him, and he has applied for his first loan which he will use to add more stock to his butcher shop. He hopes to open a hotel in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more meat

loans.name: Adilia

texts.es: La señora Adilia F. D., tiene la edad de 30 años vive en el barrio Waspan Norte, es casada y su esposo labora como operario de zona franca, y con sus ingresos apoya a los gastos mensuales del hogar, tienen un hijo menor de edad, ella vende ropa usada y cosméticos tiene 3 años de ganarse la vida de esta manera, por los problemas económicos del país, las vendas a veces bajan y suben, es por esa razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de un mayor inventario de mercadería que le permita mejores condiciones económicas, esta inversión le permitirá a futuro la compra de un terreno donde ir edificando su hogar, un hogar digno cómodo, y seguro que permita un desarrollo optimo en la vida de su pequeño.
texts.en:
Sra. Adilia F. D. is 30 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Waspan Norte. She is married and her husband works as an operator in the free trade district. With the income she earns, Adilia is able to help with the monthly household expenses. They have a young child.

Adilia has been selling used clothing and cosmetics for three years to earn a living. Due to the economic problems occurring in the country, her sales occasionally rise and fall. She is requesting a loan in order to buy a larger inventory of merchandise to improve her financial situation. This investment will allow her in the future to buy land where she can build a decent and comfortable home. She is confident that this will help her provide an optimal environment in which her child can develop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of used clothing

loans.name: Glenda Yomahira

texts.es:
Glenda Yomahira T. E. tiene 23 anos. Es soltera y vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 9 anos. 

Glenda es una socia de la ventanilla rural Progreso Comunitario, que está ubicada a dos horas de Chillanes. Son 11 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de cacao o tienen sus propios pequeños negocios.  

A Glenda es agricultura de cacao. Realiza las compras de sus productos en Babahoyo y las ventas de sus productos en Mata de Cacao cada quince dias. 

Solicita el crédito para mantener limpios sus cultivos de cacao y cuidar a los cultivos, comprando los insumos necesarios. Trabajando, poco a poco se va a avanzar. Su sueno es mejorar con su familia y tener un poco mas para ellos. A veces se desafía con el cacao que sale sanado. 

En su tiempo libre le gusta pasar tiempo en la casa con sus hijos y hacer el indoor.
texts.en:
Glenda Yomahira T. E., 23, is single and lives in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  She has two children who are 4 and 9 years of age.

Glenda is a member of the Progreso Comunitario (Community Progress) communal bank located two hours from Chillanes.  It has 11 members who are mostly cocoa bean farmers or own small businesses.

Glenda is a cocoa bean farmer.  She buys her products in Babahoyo and sells them in Mata de Cacao every two weeks.

She is asking for funds to weed her fields and care for her crops buying the necessary supplies.  Working bit by bit she will advance.  Her dream is to improve with her family and have a bit more for them.  Sometimes she is challenged to produce healthy crops.

In her free time she likes to spend time at home with her children and go to the gym.

loans.use: To buy cocoa bean farming supplies.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen has a mixed farm in Kisii town in western Kenya, where she has been farming for 40 years and employs one farmhand. Her mixed farm produces sorghum, beans, cassava, potatoes and mangoes, which are all sold to the local market. She also earns income from the sale of clothes to the local market. Hellen is 61 years old. She is married with five children who are all adults. One of her children is currently attending school. Her primary challenge in farming has been lack of finances to expand her activities.

She has requested this loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The income from the sale of milk will help improve the livelihood of her family. She comments that she has heard good benefits from those already granted the loan, and it has inspired her to take one also.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Gunay

texts.ru:
Gunay D. 20 let. Ona ne zamujem i jivet v Absheron regione vmeste s semyoy. Gunay zakonchila shkolu i nachala idti na kursi parexmaxera nauchivshis etomu delu ona uje 2 qoda kak otkrila sebe salon i rabotayet tam. 

Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit neobxodimiye veshi chobi ulidshit svoy salon.
texts.en:
Gunay D. is twenty years old. She is not married and lives in the Absheron region together with her family. Gunay graduated from school and started taking hair dresser classes. She has learned this business and it has been two years since she has opened her beauty salon.

At this time she needs 2000 AZN to buy supplies to improve her beauty salon.

loans.use: To buy necessary supplies to improve beauty salon

loans.name: Daniel Lerionka

texts.en:
Daniel M. is 23 years old from Isampin village and is married with three children who are between the ages of six and one month. He is a farmer and plants maize on his farm, getting a monthly income of Kshs 6,000.

He is currently applying for his first loan from KADET Ltd, which he will use to add maize and bean seeds for the next planting season. He will also use part of the money to pay for labour costs.

His desire is to expand his business and maximize profits.

loans.use: To buy maize and bean seeds.

loans.name: Mnatsakan

texts.en: Mnatsakan G. is 23 years old. He lives in Zovaber village, Sevan area with his parents and his sister. Mnatsakan’s family is engaged in animal breeding and after leaving school, Mnatsakan is carrying on his family tradition. Now on his farm he has cows, pigs and chickens. Mnatsakan’s parents and sister help him a lot with the farming, so they are able to keep their family. Mnatsakan and his father take upon themselves all the hard farming work. Mnatsakan’s sister and mother are busy with housekeeping and do light activity at their farm. Mnatsakan intends to increase his farm, so he is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan, which will allow him to buy some calves for his farm and fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: To buy some calves for his farm and fodder for his farm animals.

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en:
Mostafa is from Iraq. He is 32 years old. He is married and has 2 children. 

In 2008, Mostafa decided to open his own store where he sells a wide variety of frozen meat. He has more experience now and he is well-known in his local area. 

He is requesting a $2400 loan to renovate his store and coat the walls with ceramic. His goal is to increase his sales and expand his store in the future.

loans.use: Renovate his store and coat the walls with ceramic

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single man from Lebanon living with his parents. Despite his young age, he has good experience working as a home painter for four years. He works on a freelance basis upon the customers’ request.  As its common in Lebanon, he helps his father with the family income. Today, he is requesting to borrow $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renew his business tools and purchase paints for a new project. He needs to be prepared to satisfy the client and earn a good business reputation. In the future, he hopes to continue the growth of his business and be able to take construction projects in order to expand his business operation.

loans.use: To renew his business tools and purchase paints

loans.name: Angélica Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Angélica Patricia R. tiene ya más de cuatro años dedicándose a la venta de ropa nueva y usada.
El negocio es la fuente de ingresos para su familia ya que es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos los cuales les quiere dar el estudio necesario.
 Pero en este momento a su negocio le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión.
Es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo y así invertir en el negocio y tener más ingresos para su familia. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas de ropa.
texts.en: Angélica Patricia R. has been selling new and used clothes for more than four years.  Her business is her family's sole source of income since she is a single mother and has two children for whom she wants to provide an education.  Right now her business merchandise is lacking variety but she doesn't have the necessary money to invest in it.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan which she will invest in her business to make more income for her family.  She plans to pay back her loan with the profits that she makes from her clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Sebastian Antonio

texts.es: Sebastián tiene 52 años su negocio es brindar el servicio de música y anuncios en la calle, es un hombre muy trabajador y que busca la forma de generar ingresos para su hogar. Inicio este medio de vida hace 6 años, la experiencia obtenida con su negocio ha sido muy reconfortante, su hijo le ayuda en lo que puede de su negocio ya que a su hijo también le gusta mucho este negocio. el motivo de su financiamiento es para la compra de parlantes, cables, discos y Dvd que son necesarios.
texts.en: Sebastián is 52 years old.  His business is providing music and street announcement services.  He is a very hard-working man who is seeking ways to make income for his household.  He started in this business 6 years ago and the experience he has gained has made him very happy.  His son helps him in the business as much as he can since he also really enjoys this line of business.  Sebastián is requesting this loan to buy speakers, cables, records and DVDs that he needs.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sikyomu Group-Mukono

texts.en: N. Harriet was inspired by a close acquaintance to start up a retail shop in Katosi-Mukono a decade ago. The friend had observed that a retail shop stocked with a variety of general merchandise in the Katosi trading center would be a lucrative venture. Before that, 45-year-old N. Harriet, a happy-go-lucky single mother of 3, was banking on profits from a banana sales business. She now sells essential commodities such as sugar, maize flour and rice and the business generates 200,000 UGX monthly. Harriet plans to use this loan to purchase more retail commodities to resell. Harriet belongs to the Sikyomu group-Mukono.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buying beans for retail sale

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San K., 42, resides in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. K. sells soft drinks, earning an income of about $7 per day. 

Her husband produces traditional musical instruments to sell, earning an income of about $5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $35 on food and $74 on the other necessary expenses. 

K. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more materials for her husband to make traditional musical instruments. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy materials for her husband to make musical instruments

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: Madame Akouavi est âgée de 58ans elle réside à Attiégou. Elle est veuve et à 03 enfants en charge. Elle a démarré l’activité il ya 6ans et est spécialisée dans la vente de pagnes et de céréales.  Madame Akouavi s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays et à Lomé et revend  au marché d’Akodesséwa.  Bien qu’elle s’occupe seule de ses enfants elle reste dynamique, courageuse et elle désire solliciter ce premier prêt pour acheter des pagnes et des céréales afin de mieux vendre pour  réaliser de profit et voir ses derniers grandir dans de bonnes conditions.
texts.en: Mrs. Akouavi is 58 years old and lives in Attiegou. She is a widow with three dependent children. She started her business six years ago, and specializes in the sale of African dresses and cereals. Mrs. Akouavi gets her supplies inside the country and in Lome, and retails on the market of Akodessewa. Even though she takes care of her children by herself, she remains energetic and resolute. She wants to request this first loan to purchase African dresses and cereals in order to sell more, make a profit, and be able to see her younger children grow up in good conditions.

loans.use: To purchases African dresses and cereals

loans.name: Gladys Marcelina

texts.es:
Gladys es socia del  Banco Comunal “Dulce Amanecer”, ubicado en el distrito y departamento de Puno, tiene 36 años de edad, con grado de educación superior.  Es soltera  y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. 
La señora se dedica a la  venta de abarrotes y trabaja  con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace cinco años.  Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio venta de abarrotes.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 1300.00 nuevo soles, comprará mercadería al por mayor para su tienda como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, leches, etc.
También nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de carros, es un negocio que lo realiza esporádicamente (alterno).  Ella trabaja sola.
Su sueño es tener una tienda mucho más grande y bien abastecida para generar más ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the “Dulce Amanecer” (Sweet Dawn) community bank which is located in Puno district and department.  She is 36 years old and completed her higher education.  She is single and has two school-age children.

Gladys sells groceries.  She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for five years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she used that money for her grocery business.

Gladys will use this new loan for 1,300 soles to buy merchandise wholesale for her store.  She will buy products such as rice, sugar, oil, milk, etc.  She tells us that she also sells cars.  It is a business that she carries out sporadically.  She works on her own.

Gladys' dream is to own a much bigger store which is well stocked so that she can make more income.  What Gladys likes about her community bank is the punctuality.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, oil, milk, etc. for her store (wholesale)

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
